     211           1 : class LoopControl : public BreakableControl
     212             : {
     213             :     // Loops' children are emitted in dominance order, so they can always
     214             :     // have a TDZCheckCache.
     215             :     BytecodeEmitter::TDZCheckCache tdzCache_;
     216             : 
     217             :     // Stack depth when this loop was pushed on the control stack.
     218             :     int32_t stackDepth_;
     219             : 
     220             :     // The loop nesting depth. Used as a hint to Ion.
     221             :     uint32_t loopDepth_;
     222             : 
     223             :     // Can we OSR into Ion from here? True unless there is non-loop state on the stack.
     224             :     bool canIonOsr_;
     225             : 
     226             :   public:
     227             :     // The target of continue statement jumps, e.g., the update portion of a
     228             :     // for(;;) loop.
     229             :     JumpTarget continueTarget;
     230             : 
     231             :     // Offset of the last continue in the loop.
     232             :     JumpList continues;
     233             : 
     234           1 :     LoopControl(BytecodeEmitter* bce, StatementKind loopKind)
     235             :       : BreakableControl(bce, loopKind),
     236             :         tdzCache_(bce),
     237           1 :         continueTarget({ -1 })
     238             :     {
     239             :         MOZ_ASSERT(is<LoopControl>());
     240             : 
     241           1 :         LoopControl* enclosingLoop = findNearest<LoopControl>(enclosing());
     242             : 
     243           1 :         stackDepth_ = bce->stackDepth;
     244           1 :         loopDepth_ = enclosingLoop ? enclosingLoop->loopDepth_ + 1 : 1;
     245             : 
     246             :         int loopSlots;
     247           1 :         if (loopKind == StatementKind::Spread)
     248             :             loopSlots = 3;
     249           1 :         else if (loopKind == StatementKind::ForInLoop || loopKind == StatementKind::ForOfLoop)
     250             :             loopSlots = 2;
     251             :         else
     252           1 :             loopSlots = 0;
     253             : 
     254             :         MOZ_ASSERT(loopSlots <= stackDepth_);
     255             : 
     256           1 :         if (enclosingLoop) {
     257           1 :             canIonOsr_ = (enclosingLoop->canIonOsr_ &&
     258           1 :                           stackDepth_ == enclosingLoop->stackDepth_ + loopSlots);
     259             :         } else {
     260           1 :             canIonOsr_ = stackDepth_ == loopSlots;
     261             :         }
     262           1 :     }
     263             : 
     264             :     uint32_t loopDepth() const {
     265             :         return loopDepth_;
     266             :     }
     267             : 
     268             :     bool canIonOsr() const {
     269             :         return canIonOsr_;
     270             :     }
     271             : 
     272           1 :     MOZ_MUST_USE bool emitSpecialBreakForDone(BytecodeEmitter* bce) {
     273             :         // This doesn't pop stack values, nor handle any other controls.
     274             :         // Should be called on the toplevel of the loop.
     275             :         MOZ_ASSERT(bce->stackDepth == stackDepth_);
     276             :         MOZ_ASSERT(bce->innermostNestableControl == this);

     278           1 :         if (!bce->newSrcNote(SRC_BREAK))
     279             :             return false;
     280           1 :         if (!bce->emitJump(JSOP_GOTO, &breaks))
     281             :             return false;
     282             : 
     283           1 :         return true;
     284             :     }

     331           1 : class BytecodeEmitter::EmitterScope : public Nestable<BytecodeEmitter::EmitterScope>

     334             :     // scope. Initially populated as the set of names this scope binds. As

     632             : {

     636             :         // Parser.

     773           1 : BytecodeEmitter::EmitterScope::searchAndCache(BytecodeEmitter* bce, JSAtom* name)
     774             : {

     844             : bool
     845           1 : BytecodeEmitter::EmitterScope::deadZoneFrameSlotRange(BytecodeEmitter* bce, uint32_t slotStart,
     846             :                                                       uint32_t slotEnd)
     847             : {
     848             :     // Lexical bindings throw ReferenceErrors if they are used before
     849             :     // initialization. See ES6 8.1.1.1.6.
     850             :     //
     851             :     // For completeness, lexical bindings are initialized in ES6 by calling
     852             :     // InitializeBinding, after which touching the binding will no longer
     853             :     // throw reference errors. See 13.1.11, 9.2.13, 13.6.3.4, 13.6.4.6,
     854             :     // 13.6.4.8, 13.14.5, 15.1.8, and 15.2.0.15.

     856           1 :         if (!bce->emit1(JSOP_UNINITIALIZED))
     857             :             return false;
     858           1 :         for (uint32_t slot = slotStart; slot < slotEnd; slot++) {
     859           1 :             if (!bce->emitLocalOp(JSOP_INITLEXICAL, slot))
     860             :                 return false;
     861             :         }
     862           1 :         if (!bce->emit1(JSOP_POP))
     863             :             return false;
     864             :     }
     865             : 
     866             :     return true;
     867             : }

     875             : bool
     876           1 : BytecodeEmitter::EmitterScope::enterLexical(BytecodeEmitter* bce, ScopeKind kind,
     877             :                                             Handle<LexicalScope::Data*> bindings)
     878             : {
     879             :     MOZ_ASSERT(kind != ScopeKind::NamedLambda && kind != ScopeKind::StrictNamedLambda);
     880             :     MOZ_ASSERT(this == bce->innermostEmitterScope);
     881             : 
     882           1 :     if (!ensureCache(bce))
     883             :         return false;
     884             : 
     885             :     // Marks all names as closed over if the the context requires it. This
     886             :     // cannot be done in the Parser as we may not know if the context requires
     887             :     // all bindings to be closed over until after parsing is finished. For
     888             :     // example, legacy generators require all bindings to be closed over but
     889             :     // it is unknown if a function is a legacy generator until the first
     890             :     // 'yield' expression is parsed.
     891             :     //
     892             :     // This is not a problem with other scopes, as all other scopes with
     893             :     // bindings are body-level. At the time of their creation, whether or not
     894             :     // the context requires all bindings to be closed over is already known.
     895           1 :     if (bce->sc->allBindingsClosedOver())
     896           1 :         MarkAllBindingsClosedOver(*bindings);
     897             : 
     898             :     // Resolve bindings.
     899           1 :     TDZCheckCache* tdzCache = bce->innermostTDZCheckCache;
     900           1 :     uint32_t firstFrameSlot = frameSlotStart();

     903           1 :         if (!checkSlotLimits(bce, bi))
     904           0 :             return false;
     905             : 
     906           1 :         NameLocation loc = NameLocation::fromBinding(bi.kind(), bi.location());

    1089           1 :         updateFrameFixedSlots(bce, bi);

    1091           1 :         nextFrameSlot_ = 0;
    1092             :     }

    1524             : 
    1525           1 : class MOZ_STACK_CLASS TryEmitter
    1526             : {
    1527             :   public:
    1528             :     enum Kind {
    1529             :         TryCatch,
    1530             :         TryCatchFinally,
    1531             :         TryFinally
    1532             :     };
    1533             :     enum ShouldUseRetVal {
    1534             :         UseRetVal,
    1535             :         DontUseRetVal
    1536             :     };
    1537             :     enum ShouldUseControl {
    1538             :         UseControl,
    1539             :         DontUseControl,
    1540             :     };
    1541             : 
    1542             :   private:
    1543             :     BytecodeEmitter* bce_;
    1544             :     Kind kind_;
    1545             :     ShouldUseRetVal retValKind_;
    1546             : 
    1547             :     // Track jumps-over-catches and gosubs-to-finally for later fixup.
    1548             :     //
    1549             :     // When a finally block is active, non-local jumps (including
    1550             :     // jumps-over-catches) result in a GOSUB being written into the bytecode
    1551             :     // stream and fixed-up later.
    1552             :     //
    1553             :     // If ShouldUseControl is DontUseControl, all that handling is skipped.
    1554             :     // DontUseControl is used by yield*, that matches to the following:
    1555             :     //   * has only one catch block
    1556             :     //   * has no catch guard
    1557             :     //   * has JSOP_GOTO at the end of catch-block
    1558             :     //   * has no non-local-jump
    1559             :     //   * doesn't use finally block for normal completion of try-block and
    1560             :     //     catch-block
    1561             :     Maybe<TryFinallyControl> controlInfo_;
    1562             : 
    1563             :     int depth_;
    1564             :     unsigned noteIndex_;
    1565             :     ptrdiff_t tryStart_;
    1566             :     JumpList catchAndFinallyJump_;
    1567             :     JumpTarget tryEnd_;
    1568             :     JumpTarget finallyStart_;
    1569             : 
    1570             :     enum State {
    1571             :         Start,
    1572             :         Try,
    1573             :         TryEnd,
    1574             :         Catch,
    1575             :         CatchEnd,
    1576             :         Finally,
    1577             :         FinallyEnd,
    1578             :         End
    1579             :     };
    1580             :     State state_;
    1581             : 
    1582             :     bool hasCatch() const {
    1583             :         return kind_ == TryCatch || kind_ == TryCatchFinally;
    1584             :     }
    1585             :     bool hasFinally() const {
    1586           1 :         return kind_ == TryCatchFinally || kind_ == TryFinally;
    1587             :     }
    1588             : 
    1589             :   public:
    1590             :     TryEmitter(BytecodeEmitter* bce, Kind kind, ShouldUseRetVal retValKind = UseRetVal,
    1591             :                ShouldUseControl controlKind = UseControl)
    1592             :       : bce_(bce),
    1593             :         kind_(kind),
    1594             :         retValKind_(retValKind),
    1595             :         depth_(0),
    1596             :         noteIndex_(0),
    1597             :         tryStart_(0),
    1598           1 :         state_(Start)
    1599             :     {
    1600           1 :         if (controlKind == UseControl)
    1601           1 :             controlInfo_.emplace(bce_, hasFinally() ? StatementKind::Finally : StatementKind::Try);
    1602           1 :         finallyStart_.offset = 0;
    1603             :     }
    1604             : 
    1605             :     bool emitJumpOverCatchAndFinally() {
    1606           1 :         if (!bce_->emitJump(JSOP_GOTO, &catchAndFinallyJump_))
    1607             :             return false;
    1608             :         return true;
    1609             :     }
    1610             : 
    1611           1 :     bool emitTry() {
    1612             :         MOZ_ASSERT(state_ == Start);
    1613             : 
    1614             :         // Since an exception can be thrown at any place inside the try block,
    1615             :         // we need to restore the stack and the scope chain before we transfer
    1616             :         // the control to the exception handler.
    1617             :         //
    1618             :         // For that we store in a try note associated with the catch or
    1619             :         // finally block the stack depth upon the try entry. The interpreter
    1620             :         // uses this depth to properly unwind the stack and the scope chain.
    1621           1 :         depth_ = bce_->stackDepth;
    1622             : 
    1623             :         // Record the try location, then emit the try block.
    1624           1 :         if (!bce_->newSrcNote(SRC_TRY, &noteIndex_))
    1625             :             return false;
    1626           1 :         if (!bce_->emit1(JSOP_TRY))
    1627             :             return false;
    1628           1 :         tryStart_ = bce_->offset();
    1629             : 
    1630           1 :         state_ = Try;
    1631           1 :         return true;
    1632             :     }
    1633             : 
    1634             :   private:
    1635           1 :     bool emitTryEnd() {
    1636             :         MOZ_ASSERT(state_ == Try);
    1637             :         MOZ_ASSERT(depth_ == bce_->stackDepth);
    1638             : 
    1639             :         // GOSUB to finally, if present.
    1640           1 :         if (hasFinally() && controlInfo_) {
    1641           1 :             if (!bce_->emitJump(JSOP_GOSUB, &controlInfo_->gosubs))
    1642             :                 return false;
    1643             :         }
    1644             : 
    1645             :         // Source note points to the jump at the end of the try block.
    1646           1 :         if (!bce_->setSrcNoteOffset(noteIndex_, 0, bce_->offset() - tryStart_ + JSOP_TRY_LENGTH))
    1647             :             return false;
    1648             : 
    1649             :         // Emit jump over catch and/or finally.
    1650           1 :         if (!bce_->emitJump(JSOP_GOTO, &catchAndFinallyJump_))
    1651             :             return false;
    1652             : 
    1653           1 :         if (!bce_->emitJumpTarget(&tryEnd_))
    1654             :             return false;
    1655             : 
    1656           1 :         return true;
    1657             :     }
    1658             : 
    1659             :   public:
    1660           1 :     bool emitCatch() {
    1661           1 :         if (state_ == Try) {
    1662           1 :             if (!emitTryEnd())
    1663             :                 return false;
    1664             :         } else {
    1665             :             MOZ_ASSERT(state_ == Catch);
    1666           1 :             if (!emitCatchEnd(true))
    1667             :                 return false;
    1668             :         }
    1669             : 
    1670             :         MOZ_ASSERT(bce_->stackDepth == depth_);
    1671             : 
    1672           1 :         if (retValKind_ == UseRetVal) {
    1673             :             // Clear the frame's return value that might have been set by the
    1674             :             // try block:
    1675             :             //
    1676             :             //   eval("try { 1; throw 2 } catch(e) {}"); // undefined, not 1
    1677           1 :             if (!bce_->emit1(JSOP_UNDEFINED))
    1678             :                 return false;
    1679           1 :             if (!bce_->emit1(JSOP_SETRVAL))
    1680             :                 return false;
    1681             :         }
    1682             : 
    1683           1 :         state_ = Catch;
    1684           1 :         return true;
    1685             :     }
    1686             : 
    1687             :   private:
    1688           1 :     bool emitCatchEnd(bool hasNext) {
    1689             :         MOZ_ASSERT(state_ == Catch);
    1690             : 
    1691           1 :         if (!controlInfo_)
    1692             :             return true;
    1693             : 
    1694             :         // gosub <finally>, if required.
    1695           1 :         if (hasFinally()) {
    1696           1 :             if (!bce_->emitJump(JSOP_GOSUB, &controlInfo_->gosubs))
    1697             :                 return false;
    1698             :             MOZ_ASSERT(bce_->stackDepth == depth_);
    1699             :         }
    1700             : 
    1701             :         // Jump over the remaining catch blocks.  This will get fixed
    1702             :         // up to jump to after catch/finally.
    1703           1 :         if (!bce_->emitJump(JSOP_GOTO, &catchAndFinallyJump_))
    1704             :             return false;
    1705             : 
    1706             :         // If this catch block had a guard clause, patch the guard jump to
    1707             :         // come here.
    1708           1 :         if (controlInfo_->guardJump.offset != -1) {
    1709           1 :             if (!bce_->emitJumpTargetAndPatch(controlInfo_->guardJump))
    1710             :                 return false;
    1711           1 :             controlInfo_->guardJump.offset = -1;
    1712             : 
    1713             :             // If this catch block is the last one, rethrow, delegating
    1714             :             // execution of any finally block to the exception handler.
    1715           1 :             if (!hasNext) {
    1716           1 :                 if (!bce_->emit1(JSOP_EXCEPTION))
    1717             :                     return false;
    1718           1 :                 if (!bce_->emit1(JSOP_THROW))
    1719             :                     return false;
    1720             :             }
    1721             :         }
    1722             : 
    1723             :         return true;
    1724             :     }
    1725             : 
    1726             :   public:
    1727           1 :     bool emitFinally(const Maybe<uint32_t>& finallyPos = Nothing()) {
    1728             :         MOZ_ASSERT(hasFinally());
    1729             : 
    1730           1 :         if (state_ == Try) {
    1731           1 :             if (!emitTryEnd())
    1732             :                 return false;
    1733             :         } else {
    1734             :             MOZ_ASSERT(state_ == Catch);
    1735           1 :             if (!emitCatchEnd(false))
    1736             :                 return false;
    1737             :         }
    1738             : 
    1739             :         MOZ_ASSERT(bce_->stackDepth == depth_);
    1740             : 
    1741           1 :         if (!bce_->emitJumpTarget(&finallyStart_))
    1742             :             return false;
    1743             : 
    1744           1 :         if (controlInfo_) {
    1745             :             // Fix up the gosubs that might have been emitted before non-local
    1746             :             // jumps to the finally code.
    1747           1 :             bce_->patchJumpsToTarget(controlInfo_->gosubs, finallyStart_);
    1748             : 
    1749             :             // Indicate that we're emitting a subroutine body.
    1750           1 :             controlInfo_->setEmittingSubroutine();
    1751             :         }
    1752           1 :         if (finallyPos) {
    1753           1 :             if (!bce_->updateSourceCoordNotes(finallyPos.value()))
    1754             :                 return false;
    1755             :         }
    1756           1 :         if (!bce_->emit1(JSOP_FINALLY))
    1757             :             return false;
    1758             : 
    1759           1 :         if (retValKind_ == UseRetVal) {
    1760           1 :             if (!bce_->emit1(JSOP_GETRVAL))
    1761             :                 return false;
    1762             : 
    1763             :             // Clear the frame's return value to make break/continue return
    1764             :             // correct value even if there's no other statement before them:
    1765             :             //
    1766             :             //   eval("x: try { 1 } finally { break x; }"); // undefined, not 1
    1767           1 :             if (!bce_->emit1(JSOP_UNDEFINED))
    1768             :                 return false;
    1769           1 :             if (!bce_->emit1(JSOP_SETRVAL))
    1770             :                 return false;
    1771             :         }
    1772             : 
    1773           1 :         state_ = Finally;
    1774           1 :         return true;
    1775             :     }
    1776             : 
    1777             :   private:
    1778           1 :     bool emitFinallyEnd() {
    1779             :         MOZ_ASSERT(state_ == Finally);
    1780             : 
    1781           1 :         if (retValKind_ == UseRetVal) {
    1782           1 :             if (!bce_->emit1(JSOP_SETRVAL))
    1783             :                 return false;
    1784             :         }
    1785             : 
    1786           1 :         if (!bce_->emit1(JSOP_RETSUB))
    1787             :             return false;
    1788             : 
    1789           1 :         bce_->hasTryFinally = true;
    1790             :         return true;
    1791             :     }
    1792             : 
    1793             :   public:
    1794           1 :     bool emitEnd() {
    1795           1 :         if (state_ == Catch) {
    1796             :             MOZ_ASSERT(!hasFinally());
    1797           1 :             if (!emitCatchEnd(false))
    1798             :                 return false;
    1799             :         } else {
    1800             :             MOZ_ASSERT(state_ == Finally);
    1801             :             MOZ_ASSERT(hasFinally());
    1802           1 :             if (!emitFinallyEnd())
    1803             :                 return false;
    1804             :         }
    1805             : 
    1806             :         MOZ_ASSERT(bce_->stackDepth == depth_);
    1807             : 
    1808             :         // ReconstructPCStack needs a NOP here to mark the end of the last
    1809             :         // catch block.
    1810           1 :         if (!bce_->emit1(JSOP_NOP))
    1811             :             return false;
    1812             : 
    1813             :         // Fix up the end-of-try/catch jumps to come here.
    1814           1 :         if (!bce_->emitJumpTargetAndPatch(catchAndFinallyJump_))
    1815             :             return false;
    1816             : 
    1817             :         // Add the try note last, to let post-order give us the right ordering
    1818             :         // (first to last for a given nesting level, inner to outer by level).
    1819           1 :         if (hasCatch()) {
    1820           1 :             if (!bce_->tryNoteList.append(JSTRY_CATCH, depth_, tryStart_, tryEnd_.offset))
    1821             :                 return false;
    1822             :         }
    1823             : 
    1824             :         // If we've got a finally, mark try+catch region with additional
    1825             :         // trynote to catch exceptions (re)thrown from a catch block or
    1826             :         // for the try{}finally{} case.
    1827           1 :         if (hasFinally()) {
    1828           1 :             if (!bce_->tryNoteList.append(JSTRY_FINALLY, depth_, tryStart_, finallyStart_.offset))
    1829             :                 return false;
    1830             :         }
    1831             : 
    1832           1 :         state_ = End;
    1833           1 :         return true;
    1834             :     }
    1835             : };
    1836             : 
    1837             : class MOZ_STACK_CLASS IfThenElseEmitter
    1838             : {
    1839             :     BytecodeEmitter* bce_;
    1840             :     JumpList jumpAroundThen_;
    1841             :     JumpList jumpsAroundElse_;
    1842             :     unsigned noteIndex_;
    1843             :     int32_t thenDepth_;
    1844             : #ifdef DEBUG
    1845             :     int32_t pushed_;
    1846             :     bool calculatedPushed_;
    1847             : #endif
    1848             :     enum State {
    1849             :         Start,
    1850             :         If,
    1851             :         Cond,
    1852             :         IfElse,
    1853             :         Else,
    1854             :         End
    1855             :     };
    1856             :     State state_;
    1857             : 
    1858             :   public:
    1859             :     explicit IfThenElseEmitter(BytecodeEmitter* bce)
    1860             :       : bce_(bce),
    1861             :         noteIndex_(-1),
    1862             :         thenDepth_(0),
    1863             : #ifdef DEBUG
    1864             :         pushed_(0),
    1865             :         calculatedPushed_(false),
    1866             : #endif
    1867           1 :         state_(Start)
    1868             :     {}
    1869             : 
    1870             :     ~IfThenElseEmitter()
    1871           1 :     {}
    1872             : 
    1873             :   private:
    1874           1 :     bool emitIf(State nextState) {
    1875             :         MOZ_ASSERT(state_ == Start || state_ == Else);
    1876             :         MOZ_ASSERT(nextState == If || nextState == IfElse || nextState == Cond);
    1877             : 
    1878             :         // Clear jumpAroundThen_ offset that points previous JSOP_IFEQ.
    1879           1 :         if (state_ == Else)
    1880           1 :             jumpAroundThen_ = JumpList();
    1881             : 
    1882             :         // Emit an annotated branch-if-false around the then part.
    1883           1 :         SrcNoteType type = nextState == If ? SRC_IF : nextState == IfElse ? SRC_IF_ELSE : SRC_COND;
    1884           1 :         if (!bce_->newSrcNote(type, &noteIndex_))
    1885             :             return false;
    1886           1 :         if (!bce_->emitJump(JSOP_IFEQ, &jumpAroundThen_))
    1887             :             return false;
    1888             : 
    1889             :         // To restore stack depth in else part, save depth of the then part.
    1890             : #ifdef DEBUG
    1891             :         // If DEBUG, this is also necessary to calculate |pushed_|.
    1892             :         thenDepth_ = bce_->stackDepth;
    1893             : #else
    1894           1 :         if (nextState == IfElse || nextState == Cond)
    1895           1 :             thenDepth_ = bce_->stackDepth;
    1896             : #endif
    1897           1 :         state_ = nextState;
    1898           1 :         return true;
    1899             :     }
    1900             : 
    1901             :   public:
    1902             :     bool emitIf() {
    1903           1 :         return emitIf(If);
    1904             :     }
    1905             : 
    1906             :     bool emitCond() {
    1907           1 :         return emitIf(Cond);
    1908             :     }
    1909             : 
    1910             :     bool emitIfElse() {
    1911           1 :         return emitIf(IfElse);
    1912             :     }
    1913             : 
    1914           1 :     bool emitElse() {
    1915             :         MOZ_ASSERT(state_ == IfElse || state_ == Cond);
    1916             : 
    1917           1 :         calculateOrCheckPushed();
    1918             : 
    1919             :         // Emit a jump from the end of our then part around the else part. The
    1920             :         // patchJumpsToTarget call at the bottom of this function will fix up
    1921             :         // the offset with jumpsAroundElse value.
    1922           1 :         if (!bce_->emitJump(JSOP_GOTO, &jumpsAroundElse_))
    1923             :             return false;
    1924             : 
    1925             :         // Ensure the branch-if-false comes here, then emit the else.
    1926           1 :         if (!bce_->emitJumpTargetAndPatch(jumpAroundThen_))
    1927             :             return false;
    1928             : 
    1929             :         // Annotate SRC_IF_ELSE or SRC_COND with the offset from branch to
    1930             :         // jump, for IonMonkey's benefit.  We can't just "back up" from the pc
    1931             :         // of the else clause, because we don't know whether an extended
    1932             :         // jump was required to leap from the end of the then clause over
    1933             :         // the else clause.
    1934           1 :         if (!bce_->setSrcNoteOffset(noteIndex_, 0,
    1935           1 :                                     jumpsAroundElse_.offset - jumpAroundThen_.offset))
    1936             :         {
    1937             :             return false;
    1938             :         }
    1939             : 
    1940             :         // Restore stack depth of the then part.
    1941           1 :         bce_->stackDepth = thenDepth_;
    1942           1 :         state_ = Else;
    1943           1 :         return true;
    1944             :     }
    1945             : 
    1946           1 :     bool emitEnd() {
    1947             :         MOZ_ASSERT(state_ == If || state_ == Else);
    1948             : 
    1949           1 :         calculateOrCheckPushed();
    1950             : 
    1951           1 :         if (state_ == If) {
    1952             :             // No else part, fixup the branch-if-false to come here.
    1953           1 :             if (!bce_->emitJumpTargetAndPatch(jumpAroundThen_))
    1954             :                 return false;
    1955             :         }
    1956             : 
    1957             :         // Patch all the jumps around else parts.
    1958           1 :         if (!bce_->emitJumpTargetAndPatch(jumpsAroundElse_))
    1959             :             return false;
    1960             : 
    1961           1 :         state_ = End;
    1962           1 :         return true;
    1963             :     }
    1964             : 
    1965             :     void calculateOrCheckPushed() {
    1966             : #ifdef DEBUG
    1967             :         if (!calculatedPushed_) {
    1968             :             pushed_ = bce_->stackDepth - thenDepth_;
    1969             :             calculatedPushed_ = true;
    1970             :         } else {
    1971             :             MOZ_ASSERT(pushed_ == bce_->stackDepth - thenDepth_);
    1972             :         }
    1973             : #endif
    1974             :     }
    1975             : 
    1976             : #ifdef DEBUG
    1977             :     int32_t pushed() const {
    1978             :         return pushed_;
    1979             :     }
    1980             : 
    1981             :     int32_t popped() const {
    1982             :         return -pushed_;
    1983             :     }
    1984             : #endif
    1985             : };
    1986             : 
    1987           1 : class ForOfLoopControl : public LoopControl
    1988             : {
    1989             :     // The stack depth of the iterator.
    1990             :     int32_t iterDepth_;
    1991             : 
    1992             :     // for-of loops, when throwing from non-iterator code (i.e. from the body
    1993             :     // or from evaluating the LHS of the loop condition), need to call
    1994             :     // IteratorClose.  This is done by enclosing non-iterator code with
    1995             :     // try-catch and call IteratorClose in `catch` block.
    1996             :     // If IteratorClose itself throws, we must not re-call IteratorClose. Since
    1997             :     // non-local jumps like break and return call IteratorClose, whenever a
    1998             :     // non-local jump is emitted, we must tell catch block not to perform
    1999             :     // IteratorClose.
    2000             :     //
    2001             :     //   for (x of y) {
    2002             :     //     // Operations for iterator (IteratorNext etc) are outside of
    2003             :     //     // try-block.
    2004             :     //     try {
    2005             :     //       ...
    2006             :     //       if (...) {
    2007             :     //         // Before non-local jump, clear iterator on the stack to tell
    2008             :     //         // catch block not to perform IteratorClose.
    2009             :     //         tmpIterator = iterator;
    2010             :     //         iterator = undefined;
    2011             :     //         IteratorClose(tmpIterator, { break });
    2012             :     //         break;
    2013             :     //       }
    2014             :     //       ...
    2015             :     //     } catch (e) {
    2016             :     //       // Just throw again when iterator is cleared by non-local jump.
    2017             :     //       if (iterator === undefined)
    2018             :     //         throw e;
    2019             :     //       IteratorClose(iterator, { throw, e });
    2020             :     //     }
    2021             :     //   }
    2022             :     Maybe<TryEmitter> tryCatch_;
    2023             : 
    2024             :     bool allowSelfHosted_;
    2025             : 
    2026             :     IteratorKind iterKind_;
    2027             : 
    2028             :   public:
    2029             :     ForOfLoopControl(BytecodeEmitter* bce, int32_t iterDepth, bool allowSelfHosted,
    2030             :                      IteratorKind iterKind)
    2031             :       : LoopControl(bce, StatementKind::ForOfLoop),
    2032             :         iterDepth_(iterDepth),
    2033             :         allowSelfHosted_(allowSelfHosted),
    2034           1 :         iterKind_(iterKind)
    2035             :     {
    2036             :     }
    2037             : 
    2038           1 :     bool emitBeginCodeNeedingIteratorClose(BytecodeEmitter* bce) {
    2039           1 :         tryCatch_.emplace(bce, TryEmitter::TryCatch, TryEmitter::DontUseRetVal);
    2040             : 
    2041           1 :         if (!tryCatch_->emitTry())
    2042             :             return false;
    2043           1 :         return true;
    2044             :     }
    2045             : 
    2046           1 :     bool emitEndCodeNeedingIteratorClose(BytecodeEmitter* bce) {
    2047           1 :         if (!tryCatch_->emitCatch())              // ITER ...
    2048             :             return false;
    2049             : 
    2050           1 :         if (!bce->emit1(JSOP_EXCEPTION))          // ITER ... EXCEPTION
    2051             :             return false;
    2052           1 :         unsigned slotFromTop = bce->stackDepth - iterDepth_;
    2053           1 :         if (!bce->emitDupAt(slotFromTop))         // ITER ... EXCEPTION ITER
    2054             :             return false;
    2055             : 
    2056             :         // If ITER is undefined, it means the exception is thrown by
    2057             :         // IteratorClose for non-local jump, and we should't perform
    2058             :         // IteratorClose again here.
    2059           1 :         if (!bce->emit1(JSOP_UNDEFINED))          // ITER ... EXCEPTION ITER UNDEF
    2060             :             return false;
    2061           1 :         if (!bce->emit1(JSOP_STRICTNE))           // ITER ... EXCEPTION NE
    2062             :             return false;
    2063             : 
    2064             :         IfThenElseEmitter ifIteratorIsNotClosed(bce);
    2065           1 :         if (!ifIteratorIsNotClosed.emitIf())      // ITER ... EXCEPTION
    2066             :             return false;
    2067             : 
    2068             :         MOZ_ASSERT(slotFromTop == unsigned(bce->stackDepth - iterDepth_));
    2069           1 :         if (!bce->emitDupAt(slotFromTop))         // ITER ... EXCEPTION ITER
    2070             :             return false;
    2071           1 :         if (!emitIteratorClose(bce, CompletionKind::Throw)) // ITER ... EXCEPTION
    2072             :             return false;
    2073             : 
    2074           1 :         if (!ifIteratorIsNotClosed.emitEnd())     // ITER ... EXCEPTION
    2075             :             return false;
    2076             : 
    2077           1 :         if (!bce->emit1(JSOP_THROW))              // ITER ...
    2078             :             return false;
    2079             : 
    2080           1 :         if (!tryCatch_->emitEnd())
    2081             :             return false;
    2082             : 
    2083           1 :         tryCatch_.reset();
    2084             :         return true;
    2085             :     }
    2086             : 
    2087           1 :     bool emitIteratorClose(BytecodeEmitter* bce,
    2088             :                            CompletionKind completionKind = CompletionKind::Normal) {
    2089           1 :         ptrdiff_t start = bce->offset();
    2090           1 :         if (!bce->emitIteratorClose(iterKind_, completionKind, allowSelfHosted_))
    2091             :             return false;
    2092           1 :         ptrdiff_t end = bce->offset();
    2093           1 :         return bce->tryNoteList.append(JSTRY_FOR_OF_ITERCLOSE, 0, start, end);
    2094             :     }
    2095             : 
    2096           1 :     bool emitPrepareForNonLocalJump(BytecodeEmitter* bce, bool isTarget) {
    2097             :         // Pop unnecessary value from the stack.  Effectively this means
    2098             :         // leaving try-catch block.  However, the performing IteratorClose can
    2099             :         // reach the depth for try-catch, and effectively re-enter the
    2100             :         // try-catch block.
    2101           1 :         if (!bce->emit1(JSOP_POP))                        // ITER
    2102             :             return false;
    2103             : 
    2104             :         // Clear ITER slot on the stack to tell catch block to avoid performing
    2105             :         // IteratorClose again.
    2106           1 :         if (!bce->emit1(JSOP_UNDEFINED))                  // ITER UNDEF
    2107             :             return false;
    2108           1 :         if (!bce->emit1(JSOP_SWAP))                       // UNDEF ITER
    2109             :             return false;
    2110             : 
    2111           1 :         if (!emitIteratorClose(bce))                      // UNDEF
    2112             :             return false;
    2113             : 
    2114           1 :         if (isTarget) {
    2115             :             // At the level of the target block, there's bytecode after the
    2116             :             // loop that will pop the iterator and the value, so push
    2117             :             // an undefined to balance the stack.
    2118           1 :             if (!bce->emit1(JSOP_UNDEFINED))              // UNDEF UNDEF
    2119             :                 return false;
    2120             :         } else {
    2121           1 :             if (!bce->emit1(JSOP_POP))                    //
    2122             :                 return false;
    2123             :         }
    2124             : 
    2125             :         return true;
    2126             :     }
    2127             : };
    2128             : 
    2129           1 : BytecodeEmitter::BytecodeEmitter(BytecodeEmitter* parent,
    2130             :                                  Parser<FullParseHandler>* parser, SharedContext* sc,
    2131             :                                  HandleScript script, Handle<LazyScript*> lazyScript,
    2132             :                                  uint32_t lineNum, EmitterMode emitterMode)
    2133             :   : sc(sc),
    2134             :     cx(sc->context),
    2135             :     parent(parent),
    2136             :     script(cx, script),
    2137             :     lazyScript(cx, lazyScript),
    2138             :     prologue(cx, lineNum),
    2139             :     main(cx, lineNum),
    2140             :     current(&main),
    2141             :     parser(parser),

    2508             : static inline unsigned
    2509             : LengthOfSetLine(unsigned line)
    2510             : {

    2512             : }
    2513             : 
    2514             : /* Updates line number notes, not column notes. */
    2515             : bool
    2516           1 : BytecodeEmitter::updateLineNumberNotes(uint32_t offset)
    2517             : {
    2518           1 :     TokenStream* ts = &parser->tokenStream;
    2519             :     bool onThisLine;
    2520           1 :     if (!ts->srcCoords.isOnThisLine(offset, currentLine(), &onThisLine)) {
    2521           0 :         ts->reportError(JSMSG_OUT_OF_MEMORY);
    2522           0 :         return false;
    2523             :     }
    2524             : 
    2525           1 :     if (!onThisLine) {
    2526           1 :         unsigned line = ts->srcCoords.lineNum(offset);
    2527           1 :         unsigned delta = line - currentLine();
    2528             : 
    2529             :         /*
    2530             :          * Encode any change in the current source line number by using
    2531             :          * either several SRC_NEWLINE notes or just one SRC_SETLINE note,
    2532             :          * whichever consumes less space.
    2533             :          *
    2534             :          * NB: We handle backward line number deltas (possible with for
    2535             :          * loops where the update part is emitted after the body, but its
    2536             :          * line number is <= any line number in the body) here by letting
    2537             :          * unsigned delta_ wrap to a very large number, which triggers a
    2538             :          * SRC_SETLINE.
    2539             :          */
    2540           1 :         current->currentLine = line;
    2541           1 :         current->lastColumn  = 0;
    2542           1 :         if (delta >= LengthOfSetLine(line)) {
    2543           1 :             if (!newSrcNote2(SRC_SETLINE, ptrdiff_t(line)))
    2544             :                 return false;
    2545             :         } else {
    2546           1 :             do {
    2547           1 :                 if (!newSrcNote(SRC_NEWLINE))
    2548             :                     return false;
    2549             :             } while (--delta != 0);
    2550             :         }
    2551             :     }
    2552             :     return true;
    2553             : }
    2554             : 
    2555             : /* Updates the line number and column number information in the source notes. */
    2556             : bool
    2557           1 : BytecodeEmitter::updateSourceCoordNotes(uint32_t offset)
    2558             : {
    2559           1 :     if (!updateLineNumberNotes(offset))
    2560             :         return false;
    2561             : 
    2562           1 :     uint32_t columnIndex = parser->tokenStream.srcCoords.columnIndex(offset);
    2563           1 :     ptrdiff_t colspan = ptrdiff_t(columnIndex) - ptrdiff_t(current->lastColumn);
    2564           1 :     if (colspan != 0) {
    2565             :         // If the column span is so large that we can't store it, then just
    2566             :         // discard this information. This can happen with minimized or otherwise
    2567             :         // machine-generated code. Even gigantic column numbers are still
    2568             :         // valuable if you have a source map to relate them to something real;
    2569             :         // but it's better to fail soft here.
    2570           1 :         if (!SN_REPRESENTABLE_COLSPAN(colspan))
    2571             :             return true;
    2572           1 :         if (!newSrcNote2(SRC_COLSPAN, SN_COLSPAN_TO_OFFSET(colspan)))
    2573             :             return false;
    2574           1 :         current->lastColumn = columnIndex;
    2575             :     }
    2576             :     return true;
    2577             : }
    2578             : 
    2579             : bool
    2580           1 : BytecodeEmitter::emitLoopHead(ParseNode* nextpn, JumpTarget* top)
    2581             : {
    2582           1 :     if (nextpn) {
    2583             :         /*
    2584             :          * Try to give the JSOP_LOOPHEAD the same line number as the next
    2585             :          * instruction. nextpn is often a block, in which case the next
    2586             :          * instruction typically comes from the first statement inside.
    2587             :          */
    2588           1 :         if (nextpn->isKind(PNK_LEXICALSCOPE))
    2589           1 :             nextpn = nextpn->scopeBody();
    2590             :         MOZ_ASSERT_IF(nextpn->isKind(PNK_STATEMENTLIST), nextpn->isArity(PN_LIST));
    2591           1 :         if (nextpn->isKind(PNK_STATEMENTLIST) && nextpn->pn_head)
    2592           1 :             nextpn = nextpn->pn_head;
    2593           1 :         if (!updateSourceCoordNotes(nextpn->pn_pos.begin))
    2594             :             return false;
    2595             :     }
    2596             : 
    2597           1 :     *top = { offset() };
    2598           1 :     return emit1(JSOP_LOOPHEAD);

    2655             : 
    2656             : namespace {
    2657             : 
    2658             : class NonLocalExitControl
    2659             : {
    2660             :   public:
    2661             :     enum Kind
    2662             :     {
    2663             :         // IteratorClose is handled especially inside the exception unwinder.
    2664             :         Throw,
    2665             : 
    2666             :         // A 'continue' statement does not call IteratorClose for the loop it
    2667             :         // is continuing, i.e. excluding the target loop.
    2668             :         Continue,
    2669             : 
    2670             :         // A 'break' or 'return' statement does call IteratorClose for the
    2671             :         // loop it is breaking out of or returning from, i.e. including the
    2672             :         // target loop.
    2673             :         Break,
    2674             :         Return
    2675             :     };
    2676             : 
    2677             :   private:
    2678             :     BytecodeEmitter* bce_;
    2679             :     const uint32_t savedScopeNoteIndex_;
    2680             :     const int savedDepth_;
    2681             :     uint32_t openScopeNoteIndex_;
    2682             :     Kind kind_;
    2683             : 
    2684             :     NonLocalExitControl(const NonLocalExitControl&) = delete;
    2685             : 
    2686             :     MOZ_MUST_USE bool leaveScope(BytecodeEmitter::EmitterScope* scope);
    2687             : 
    2688             :   public:
    2689             :     NonLocalExitControl(BytecodeEmitter* bce, Kind kind)
    2690             :       : bce_(bce),
    2691           1 :         savedScopeNoteIndex_(bce->scopeNoteList.length()),
    2692             :         savedDepth_(bce->stackDepth),
    2693           1 :         openScopeNoteIndex_(bce->innermostEmitterScope->noteIndex()),
    2694           1 :         kind_(kind)
    2695             :     { }
    2696             : 
    2697           1 :     ~NonLocalExitControl() {
    2698           1 :         for (uint32_t n = savedScopeNoteIndex_; n < bce_->scopeNoteList.length(); n++)
    2699           1 :             bce_->scopeNoteList.recordEnd(n, bce_->offset(), bce_->inPrologue());
    2700           1 :         bce_->stackDepth = savedDepth_;
    2701           1 :     }
    2702             : 
    2703             :     MOZ_MUST_USE bool prepareForNonLocalJump(BytecodeEmitter::NestableControl* target);
    2704             : 
    2705             :     MOZ_MUST_USE bool prepareForNonLocalJumpToOutermost() {
    2706           1 :         return prepareForNonLocalJump(nullptr);
    2707             :     }
    2708             : };
    2709             : 
    2710             : bool
    2711           1 : NonLocalExitControl::leaveScope(BytecodeEmitter::EmitterScope* es)
    2712             : {
    2713           1 :     if (!es->leave(bce_, /* nonLocal = */ true))
    2714             :         return false;
    2715             : 
    2716             :     // As we pop each scope due to the non-local jump, emit notes that
    2717             :     // record the extent of the enclosing scope. These notes will have
    2718             :     // their ends recorded in ~NonLocalExitControl().
    2719           1 :     uint32_t enclosingScopeIndex = ScopeNote::NoScopeIndex;
    2720           1 :     if (es->enclosingInFrame())
    2721           1 :         enclosingScopeIndex = es->enclosingInFrame()->index();
    2722           1 :     if (!bce_->scopeNoteList.append(enclosingScopeIndex, bce_->offset(), bce_->inPrologue(),
    2723           1 :                                     openScopeNoteIndex_))
    2724             :         return false;
    2725           1 :     openScopeNoteIndex_ = bce_->scopeNoteList.length() - 1;
    2726             : 
    2727           1 :     return true;
    2728             : }
    2729             : 
    2730             : /*
    2731             :  * Emit additional bytecode(s) for non-local jumps.
    2732             :  */
    2733             : bool
    2734           1 : NonLocalExitControl::prepareForNonLocalJump(BytecodeEmitter::NestableControl* target)
    2735             : {
    2736             :     using NestableControl = BytecodeEmitter::NestableControl;
    2737             :     using EmitterScope = BytecodeEmitter::EmitterScope;
    2738             : 
    2739           1 :     EmitterScope* es = bce_->innermostEmitterScope;
    2740           1 :     int npops = 0;
    2741             : 
    2742             :     // For 'continue', 'break', and 'return' statements, emit IteratorClose
    2743             :     // bytecode inline. 'continue' statements do not call IteratorClose for
    2744             :     // the loop they are continuing.
    2745           1 :     bool emitIteratorClose = kind_ == Continue || kind_ == Break || kind_ == Return;
    2746           1 :     bool emitIteratorCloseAtTarget = emitIteratorClose && kind_ != Continue;
    2747             : 
    2748           1 :     auto flushPops = [&npops](BytecodeEmitter* bce) {
    2749           1 :         if (npops && !bce->emitPopN(npops))
    2750             :             return false;
    2751           1 :         npops = 0;
    2752           1 :         return true;
    2753           1 :     };
    2754             : 
    2755             :     // Walk the nestable control stack and patch jumps.
    2756           1 :     for (NestableControl* control = bce_->innermostNestableControl;
    2757             :          control != target;
    2758           1 :          control = control->enclosing())
    2759             :     {
    2760             :         // Walk the scope stack and leave the scopes we entered. Leaving a scope
    2761             :         // may emit administrative ops like JSOP_POPLEXICALENV but never anything
    2762             :         // that manipulates the stack.
    2763           1 :         for (; es != control->emitterScope(); es = es->enclosingInFrame()) {
    2764           1 :             if (!leaveScope(es))
    2765             :                 return false;
    2766             :         }
    2767             : 
    2768           1 :         switch (control->kind()) {
    2769             :           case StatementKind::Finally: {
    2770           1 :             TryFinallyControl& finallyControl = control->as<TryFinallyControl>();
    2771           1 :             if (finallyControl.emittingSubroutine()) {
    2772             :                 /*
    2773             :                  * There's a [exception or hole, retsub pc-index] pair and the
    2774             :                  * possible return value on the stack that we need to pop.
    2775             :                  */
    2776           1 :                 npops += 3;
    2777             :             } else {
    2778           1 :                 if (!flushPops(bce_))
    2779             :                     return false;
    2780           1 :                 if (!bce_->emitJump(JSOP_GOSUB, &finallyControl.gosubs)) // ...
    2781             :                     return false;
    2782             :             }
    2783             :             break;
    2784             :           }
    2785             : 
    2786             :           case StatementKind::ForOfLoop:
    2787           1 :             if (emitIteratorClose) {
    2788           1 :                 if (!flushPops(bce_))
    2789             :                     return false;
    2790             : 
    2791           1 :                 ForOfLoopControl& loopinfo = control->as<ForOfLoopControl>();
    2792           1 :                 if (!loopinfo.emitPrepareForNonLocalJump(bce_, /* isTarget = */ false)) // ...
    2793             :                     return false;
    2794             :             } else {
    2795           0 :                 npops += 2;
    2796             :             }
    2797             :             break;
    2798             : 
    2799             :           case StatementKind::ForInLoop:
    2800           1 :             if (!flushPops(bce_))
    2801             :                 return false;
    2802             : 
    2803             :             // The iterator and the current value are on the stack.
    2804           1 :             if (!bce_->emit1(JSOP_POP))                   // ... ITER
    2805             :                 return false;
    2806           1 :             if (!bce_->emit1(JSOP_ENDITER))               // ...
    2807             :                 return false;
    2808             :             break;
    2809             : 
    2810             :           default:
    2811             :             break;
    2812             :         }
    2813             :     }
    2814             : 
    2815           1 :     if (!flushPops(bce_))
    2816             :         return false;
    2817             : 
    2818           1 :     if (target && emitIteratorCloseAtTarget && target->is<ForOfLoopControl>()) {
    2819           1 :         ForOfLoopControl& loopinfo = target->as<ForOfLoopControl>();
    2820           1 :         if (!loopinfo.emitPrepareForNonLocalJump(bce_, /* isTarget = */ true)) // ... UNDEF UNDEF
    2821             :             return false;
    2822             :     }
    2823             : 
    2824           1 :     EmitterScope* targetEmitterScope = target ? target->emitterScope() : bce_->varEmitterScope;
    2825           1 :     for (; es != targetEmitterScope; es = es->enclosingInFrame()) {
    2826           1 :         if (!leaveScope(es))
    2827             :             return false;
    2828             :     }
    2829             : 
    2830             :     return true;
    2831             : }
    2832             : 
    2833             : }  // anonymous namespace
    2834             : 
    2835             : bool
    2836           1 : BytecodeEmitter::emitGoto(NestableControl* target, JumpList* jumplist, SrcNoteType noteType)
    2837             : {
    2838             :     NonLocalExitControl nle(this, noteType == SRC_CONTINUE
    2839             :                                   ? NonLocalExitControl::Continue

    2900           1 : BytecodeEmitter::emitAtomOp(JSAtom* atom, JSOp op)
    2901             : {
    2902             :     MOZ_ASSERT(atom);
    2903             :     MOZ_ASSERT(JOF_OPTYPE(op) == JOF_ATOM);
    2904             : 
    2905             :     // .generator lookups should be emitted as JSOP_GETALIASEDVAR instead of
    2906             :     // JSOP_GETNAME etc, to bypass |with| objects on the scope chain.

    2910             :                   atom != cx->names().dotGenerator);

    3024           1 : BytecodeEmitter::strictifySetNameOp(JSOp op)

    3039             : 
    3040             : bool
    3041           1 : BytecodeEmitter::checkSideEffects(ParseNode* pn, bool* answer)
    3042             : {
    3043           1 :     if (!CheckRecursionLimit(cx))
    3044             :         return false;
    3045             : 
    3046             :  restart:
    3047             : 
    3048           1 :     switch (pn->getKind()) {
    3049             :       // Trivial cases with no side effects.
    3050             :       case PNK_NOP:
    3051             :       case PNK_STRING:
    3052             :       case PNK_TEMPLATE_STRING:
    3053             :       case PNK_REGEXP:
    3054             :       case PNK_TRUE:
    3055             :       case PNK_FALSE:
    3056             :       case PNK_NULL:
    3057             :       case PNK_RAW_UNDEFINED:
    3058             :       case PNK_ELISION:
    3059             :       case PNK_GENERATOR:
    3060             :       case PNK_NUMBER:
    3061             :       case PNK_OBJECT_PROPERTY_NAME:
    3062             :         MOZ_ASSERT(pn->isArity(PN_NULLARY));
    3063           1 :         *answer = false;
    3064           1 :         return true;
    3065             : 
    3066             :       // |this| can throw in derived class constructors, including nested arrow
    3067             :       // functions or eval.
    3068             :       case PNK_THIS:
    3069             :         MOZ_ASSERT(pn->isArity(PN_UNARY));
    3070           0 :         *answer = sc->needsThisTDZChecks();
    3071           0 :         return true;
    3072             : 
    3073             :       // Trivial binary nodes with more token pos holders.
    3074             :       case PNK_NEWTARGET:
    3075             :         MOZ_ASSERT(pn->isArity(PN_BINARY));
    3076             :         MOZ_ASSERT(pn->pn_left->isKind(PNK_POSHOLDER));
    3077             :         MOZ_ASSERT(pn->pn_right->isKind(PNK_POSHOLDER));
    3078           0 :         *answer = false;
    3079           0 :         return true;
    3080             : 
    3081             :       case PNK_BREAK:
    3082             :       case PNK_CONTINUE:
    3083             :       case PNK_DEBUGGER:
    3084             :         MOZ_ASSERT(pn->isArity(PN_NULLARY));
    3085           0 :         *answer = true;
    3086           0 :         return true;
    3087             : 
    3088             :       // Watch out for getters!
    3089             :       case PNK_DOT:
    3090             :         MOZ_ASSERT(pn->isArity(PN_NAME));
    3091           1 :         *answer = true;
    3092           1 :         return true;
    3093             : 
    3094             :       // Unary cases with side effects only if the child has them.
    3095             :       case PNK_TYPEOFEXPR:
    3096             :       case PNK_VOID:
    3097             :       case PNK_NOT:
    3098             :         MOZ_ASSERT(pn->isArity(PN_UNARY));
    3099           1 :         return checkSideEffects(pn->pn_kid, answer);
    3100             : 
    3101             :       // Even if the name expression is effect-free, performing ToPropertyKey on
    3102             :       // it might not be effect-free:
    3103             :       //
    3104             :       //   RegExp.prototype.toString = () => { throw 42; };
    3105             :       //   ({ [/regex/]: 0 }); // ToPropertyKey(/regex/) throws 42
    3106             :       //
    3107             :       //   function Q() {
    3108             :       //     ({ [new.target]: 0 });
    3109             :       //   }
    3110             :       //   Q.toString = () => { throw 17; };
    3111             :       //   new Q; // new.target will be Q, ToPropertyKey(Q) throws 17
    3112             :       case PNK_COMPUTED_NAME:
    3113             :         MOZ_ASSERT(pn->isArity(PN_UNARY));
    3114           0 :         *answer = true;
    3115           0 :         return true;
    3116             : 
    3117             :       // Looking up or evaluating the associated name could throw.
    3118             :       case PNK_TYPEOFNAME:
    3119             :         MOZ_ASSERT(pn->isArity(PN_UNARY));
    3120           1 :         *answer = true;
    3121           1 :         return true;
    3122             : 
    3123             :       // These unary cases have side effects on the enclosing object/array,
    3124             :       // sure.  But that's not the question this function answers: it's
    3125             :       // whether the operation may have a side effect on something *other* than
    3126             :       // the result of the overall operation in which it's embedded.  The
    3127             :       // answer to that is no, for an object literal having a mutated prototype
    3128             :       // and an array comprehension containing no other effectful operations
    3129             :       // only produce a value, without affecting anything else.
    3130             :       case PNK_MUTATEPROTO:
    3131             :       case PNK_ARRAYPUSH:
    3132             :         MOZ_ASSERT(pn->isArity(PN_UNARY));
    3133           0 :         return checkSideEffects(pn->pn_kid, answer);
    3134             : 
    3135             :       // Unary cases with obvious side effects.
    3136             :       case PNK_PREINCREMENT:
    3137             :       case PNK_POSTINCREMENT:
    3138             :       case PNK_PREDECREMENT:
    3139             :       case PNK_POSTDECREMENT:
    3140             :       case PNK_THROW:
    3141             :         MOZ_ASSERT(pn->isArity(PN_UNARY));
    3142           1 :         *answer = true;
    3143           1 :         return true;
    3144             : 
    3145             :       // These might invoke valueOf/toString, even with a subexpression without
    3146             :       // side effects!  Consider |+{ valueOf: null, toString: null }|.
    3147             :       case PNK_BITNOT:
    3148             :       case PNK_POS:
    3149             :       case PNK_NEG:
    3150             :         MOZ_ASSERT(pn->isArity(PN_UNARY));
    3151           1 :         *answer = true;
    3152           1 :         return true;
    3153             : 
    3154             :       // This invokes the (user-controllable) iterator protocol.
    3155             :       case PNK_SPREAD:
    3156             :         MOZ_ASSERT(pn->isArity(PN_UNARY));
    3157           0 :         *answer = true;
    3158           0 :         return true;
    3159             : 
    3160             :       case PNK_INITIALYIELD:
    3161             :       case PNK_YIELD_STAR:
    3162             :       case PNK_YIELD:
    3163             :       case PNK_AWAIT:
    3164             :         MOZ_ASSERT(pn->isArity(PN_UNARY));
    3165           1 :         *answer = true;
    3166           1 :         return true;
    3167             : 
    3168             :       // Deletion generally has side effects, even if isolated cases have none.
    3169             :       case PNK_DELETENAME:
    3170             :       case PNK_DELETEPROP:
    3171             :       case PNK_DELETEELEM:
    3172             :         MOZ_ASSERT(pn->isArity(PN_UNARY));
    3173           1 :         *answer = true;
    3174           1 :         return true;
    3175             : 
    3176             :       // Deletion of a non-Reference expression has side effects only through
    3177             :       // evaluating the expression.
    3178             :       case PNK_DELETEEXPR: {
    3179             :         MOZ_ASSERT(pn->isArity(PN_UNARY));
    3180           0 :         ParseNode* expr = pn->pn_kid;
    3181           0 :         return checkSideEffects(expr, answer);
    3182             :       }
    3183             : 
    3184             :       case PNK_SEMI:
    3185             :         MOZ_ASSERT(pn->isArity(PN_UNARY));
    3186           0 :         if (ParseNode* expr = pn->pn_kid)
    3187             :             return checkSideEffects(expr, answer);
    3188           0 :         *answer = false;
    3189           0 :         return true;
    3190             : 
    3191             :       // Binary cases with obvious side effects.
    3192             :       case PNK_ASSIGN:
    3193             :       case PNK_ADDASSIGN:
    3194             :       case PNK_SUBASSIGN:
    3195             :       case PNK_BITORASSIGN:
    3196             :       case PNK_BITXORASSIGN:
    3197             :       case PNK_BITANDASSIGN:
    3198             :       case PNK_LSHASSIGN:
    3199             :       case PNK_RSHASSIGN:
    3200             :       case PNK_URSHASSIGN:
    3201             :       case PNK_MULASSIGN:
    3202             :       case PNK_DIVASSIGN:
    3203             :       case PNK_MODASSIGN:
    3204             :       case PNK_POWASSIGN:
    3205             :       case PNK_SETTHIS:
    3206             :         MOZ_ASSERT(pn->isArity(PN_BINARY));
    3207           1 :         *answer = true;
    3208           1 :         return true;
    3209             : 
    3210             :       case PNK_STATEMENTLIST:
    3211             :       case PNK_CATCHLIST:
    3212             :       // Strict equality operations and logical operators are well-behaved and
    3213             :       // perform no conversions.
    3214             :       case PNK_OR:
    3215             :       case PNK_AND:
    3216             :       case PNK_STRICTEQ:
    3217             :       case PNK_STRICTNE:
    3218             :       // Any subexpression of a comma expression could be effectful.
    3219             :       case PNK_COMMA:
    3220             :         MOZ_ASSERT(pn->pn_count > 0);
    3221             :         MOZ_FALLTHROUGH;
    3222             :       // Subcomponents of a literal may be effectful.
    3223             :       case PNK_ARRAY:
    3224             :       case PNK_OBJECT:
    3225             :         MOZ_ASSERT(pn->isArity(PN_LIST));
    3226           1 :         for (ParseNode* item = pn->pn_head; item; item = item->pn_next) {
    3227           1 :             if (!checkSideEffects(item, answer))
    3228             :                 return false;
    3229           1 :             if (*answer)
    3230             :                 return true;
    3231             :         }
    3232             :         return true;
    3233             : 
    3234             :       // Most other binary operations (parsed as lists in SpiderMonkey) may
    3235             :       // perform conversions triggering side effects.  Math operations perform
    3236             :       // ToNumber and may fail invoking invalid user-defined toString/valueOf:
    3237             :       // |5 < { toString: null }|.  |instanceof| throws if provided a
    3238             :       // non-object constructor: |null instanceof null|.  |in| throws if given
    3239             :       // a non-object RHS: |5 in null|.
    3240             :       case PNK_BITOR:
    3241             :       case PNK_BITXOR:
    3242             :       case PNK_BITAND:
    3243             :       case PNK_EQ:
    3244             :       case PNK_NE:
    3245             :       case PNK_LT:
    3246             :       case PNK_LE:
    3247             :       case PNK_GT:
    3248             :       case PNK_GE:
    3249             :       case PNK_INSTANCEOF:
    3250             :       case PNK_IN:
    3251             :       case PNK_LSH:
    3252             :       case PNK_RSH:
    3253             :       case PNK_URSH:
    3254             :       case PNK_ADD:
    3255             :       case PNK_SUB:
    3256             :       case PNK_STAR:
    3257             :       case PNK_DIV:
    3258             :       case PNK_MOD:
    3259             :       case PNK_POW:
    3260             :         MOZ_ASSERT(pn->isArity(PN_LIST));
    3261             :         MOZ_ASSERT(pn->pn_count >= 2);

    3263           1 :         return true;

    3267             :         MOZ_ASSERT(pn->isArity(PN_BINARY));

    3269             :             return false;
    3270           0 :         if (*answer)
    3271             :             return true;
    3272           0 :         return checkSideEffects(pn->pn_right, answer);
    3273             : 
    3274             :       // More getters.
    3275             :       case PNK_ELEM:
    3276             :         MOZ_ASSERT(pn->isArity(PN_BINARY));
    3277           1 :         *answer = true;
    3278           1 :         return true;
    3279             : 
    3280             :       // These affect visible names in this code, or in other code.
    3281             :       case PNK_IMPORT:

    3290             :         MOZ_ASSERT(pn->isArity(PN_UNARY));
    3291           0 :         *answer = true;
    3292           0 :         return true;
    3293             : 
    3294             :       // Every part of a loop might be effect-free, but looping infinitely *is*
    3295             :       // an effect.  (Language lawyer trivia: C++ says threads can be assumed
    3296             :       // to exit or have side effects, C++14 [intro.multithread]p27, so a C++
    3297             :       // implementation's equivalent of the below could set |*answer = false;|
    3298             :       // if all loop sub-nodes set |*answer = false|!)
    3299             :       case PNK_DOWHILE:
    3300             :       case PNK_WHILE:
    3301             :       case PNK_FOR:
    3302             :       case PNK_COMPREHENSIONFOR:

    3304           0 :         *answer = true;
    3305           0 :         return true;
    3306             :

    3365             :       // |with ({ get x() { throw 42; } }) ({ x });|, for example, triggers

    3376             :          * A named function, contrary to ES3, is no longer effectful, because
    3377             :          * we bind its name lexically (using JSOP_CALLEE) instead of creating
    3378             :          * an Object instance and binding a readonly, permanent property in it
    3379             :          * (the object and binding can be detected and hijacked or captured).
    3380             :          * This is a bug fix to ES3; it is fixed in ES3.1 drafts.
    3381             :          */
    3382           1 :         *answer = false;
    3383           1 :         return true;

    3722             :       case NameLocation::Kind::Dynamic:

    3815           1 : BytecodeEmitter::emitSetOrInitializeNameAtLocation(HandleAtom name, const NameLocation& loc,
    3816             :                                                    RHSEmitter emitRhs, bool initialize)
    3817             : {
    3818           1 :     bool emittedBindOp = false;
    3819             : 
    3820           1 :     switch (loc.kind()) {
    3821             :       case NameLocation::Kind::Dynamic:
    3822             :       case NameLocation::Kind::Import:
    3823             :       case NameLocation::Kind::DynamicAnnexBVar: {

    3826             :             return false;
    3827           1 :         if (loc.kind() == NameLocation::Kind::DynamicAnnexBVar) {

    3829             :             // even if lexical environments in between contain same-named
    3830             :             // bindings.
    3831           0 :             if (!emit1(JSOP_BINDVAR))
    3832             :                 return false;
    3833             :         } else {
    3834           1 :             if (!emitIndexOp(JSOP_BINDNAME, atomIndex))
    3835             :                 return false;
    3836             :         }

    3838           1 :         if (!emitRhs(this, loc, emittedBindOp))
    3839             :             return false;

    3842             :         break;

    3844             :

    3846             :         JSOp op;

    3872             :             return false;

    3876           0 :         if (!emitRhs(this, loc, emittedBindOp))
    3877             :             return false;
    3878             :         // Assigning to the named lambda is a no-op in sloppy mode but
    3879             :         // throws in strict mode.
    3880           0 :         if (sc->strict() && !emit1(JSOP_THROWSETCALLEE))
    3881             :             return false;
    3882             :         break;

    3991           1 : BytecodeEmitter::emitPropLHS(ParseNode* pn)
    3992             : {
    3993             :     MOZ_ASSERT(pn->isKind(PNK_DOT));
    3994             :     MOZ_ASSERT(!pn->as<PropertyAccess>().isSuper());
    3995             : 
    3996           1 :     ParseNode* pn2 = pn->pn_expr;
    3997             : 
    3998             :     /*
    3999             :      * If the object operand is also a dotted property reference, reverse the
    4000             :      * list linked via pn_expr temporarily so we can iterate over it from the
    4001             :      * bottom up (reversing again as we go), to avoid excessive recursion.
    4002             :      */
    4003           1 :     if (pn2->isKind(PNK_DOT) && !pn2->as<PropertyAccess>().isSuper()) {
    4004             :         ParseNode* pndot = pn2;
    4005             :         ParseNode* pnup = nullptr;
    4006             :         ParseNode* pndown;
    4007             :         for (;;) {
    4008             :             /* Reverse pndot->pn_expr to point up, not down. */

    4010           1 :             pndot->pn_expr = pnup;
    4011           1 :             if (!pndown->isKind(PNK_DOT) || pndown->as<PropertyAccess>().isSuper())
    4012             :                 break;
    4013             :             pnup = pndot;
    4014             :             pndot = pndown;
    4015             :         }
    4016             : 
    4017             :         /* pndown is a primary expression, not a dotted property reference. */
    4018           1 :         if (!emitTree(pndown))
    4019             :             return false;
    4020             : 
    4021           1 :         do {
    4022             :             /* Walk back up the list, emitting annotated name ops. */
    4023           1 :             if (!emitAtomOp(pndot, JSOP_GETPROP))
    4024             :                 return false;
    4025             :

    4141             : bool
    4142           1 : BytecodeEmitter::emitGetNameAtLocationForCompoundAssignment(JSAtom* name, const NameLocation& loc)

    4145             :         // For dynamic accesses we need to emit GETBOUNDNAME instead of
    4146             :         // GETNAME for correctness: looking up @@unscopables on the
    4147             :         // environment chain (due to 'with' environments) must only happen

    4151             :         // the earlier BINDNAME.

    4237             : {
    4238             :     MOZ_ASSERT(pn->isKind(PNK_ELEM) && pn->as<PropertyByValue>().isSuper());
    4239             : 
    4240             :     // The ordering here is somewhat screwy. We need to evaluate the propval
    4241             :     // first, by spec. Do a little dance to not emit more than one JSOP_THIS.
    4242             :     // Since JSOP_THIS might throw in derived class constructors, we cannot
    4243             :     // just push it earlier as the receiver. We have to swap it down instead.
    4244             : 
    4245           0 :     if (!emitTree(pn->pn_right))
    4246             :         return false;
    4247             :

    4249             :     // it inside both the GETELEM and the SETELEM.

    4251           0 :         if (!emit1(JSOP_TOID))
    4252             :             return false;
    4253             :     }
    4254             : 
    4255           0 :     if (!emitGetThisForSuperBase(pn->pn_left))
    4256             :         return false;
    4257             : 
    4258           0 :     if (opts == EmitElemOption::Call) {
    4259           0 :         if (!emit1(JSOP_SWAP))
    4260             :             return false;
    4261             : 
    4262             :         // We need another |this| on top, also
    4263           0 :         if (!emitDupAt(1))
    4264             :             return false;
    4265             :     }
    4266             :

    4296             : }

    4303             :         opts = EmitElemOption::Call;

    4322             :

    4324             :

    4326             :     // it inside both the GETELEM and the SETELEM. This is done by
    4327             :     // emit(Super)ElemOperands.

    4329           0 :         if (!emitSuperElemOperands(pn->pn_kid, EmitElemOption::IncDec))

    4332           1 :         if (!emitElemOperands(pn->pn_kid, EmitElemOption::IncDec))
    4333             :             return false;
    4334             :     }
    4335             :

    4338             :

    4340           1 :     if (isSuper) {
    4341             :         // There's no such thing as JSOP_DUP3, so we have to be creative.
    4342             :         // Note that pushing things again is no fewer JSOps.
    4343           0 :         if (!emitDupAt(2))                              // KEY THIS OBJ KEY
    4344             :             return false;
    4345           0 :         if (!emitDupAt(2))                              // KEY THIS OBJ KEY THIS
    4346             :             return false;
    4347           0 :         if (!emitDupAt(2))                              // KEY THIS OBJ KEY THIS OBJ
    4348             :             return false;

    4350             :     } else {
    4351             :                                                         // OBJ KEY
    4352           1 :         if (!emit1(JSOP_DUP2))                          // OBJ KEY OBJ KEY
    4353             :             return false;

    4359             :         return false;
    4360           1 :     if (post && !emit1(JSOP_DUP))                       // OBJ KEY N? N
    4361             :         return false;

    4363             :         return false;

    4365             :         return false;
    4366             : 
    4367           1 :     if (post) {

    4369             :             // We have one more value to rotate around, because of |this|
    4370             :             // on the stack

    4372             :                 return false;
    4373             :         }
