    4449             : /*
    4450             :  * Using MOZ_NEVER_INLINE in here is a workaround for llvm.org/pr14047.

    4454             : MOZ_NEVER_INLINE bool
    4455           1 : BytecodeEmitter::emitSwitch(ParseNode* pn)
    4456             : {
    4457           1 :     ParseNode* cases = pn->pn_right;
    4458             :     MOZ_ASSERT(cases->isKind(PNK_LEXICALSCOPE) || cases->isKind(PNK_STATEMENTLIST));
    4459             : 
    4460             :     // Emit code for the discriminant.
    4461           1 :     if (!emitTree(pn->pn_left))
    4462             :         return false;
    4463             : 
    4464             :     // Enter the scope before pushing the switch BreakableControl since all
    4465             :     // breaks are under this scope.
    4466             :     Maybe<TDZCheckCache> tdzCache;
    4467             :     Maybe<EmitterScope> emitterScope;
    4468           1 :     if (cases->isKind(PNK_LEXICALSCOPE)) {
    4469           1 :         if (!cases->isEmptyScope()) {
    4470           1 :             tdzCache.emplace(this);
    4471           1 :             emitterScope.emplace(this);
    4472           1 :             if (!emitterScope->enterLexical(this, ScopeKind::Lexical, cases->scopeBindings()))
    4473             :                 return false;
    4474             :         }
    4475             : 
    4476             :         // Advance |cases| to refer to the switch case list.
    4477           1 :         cases = cases->scopeBody();
    4478             : 
    4479             :         // A switch statement may contain hoisted functions inside its
    4480             :         // cases. The PNX_FUNCDEFS flag is propagated from the STATEMENTLIST
    4481             :         // bodies of the cases to the case list.
    4482           1 :         if (cases->pn_xflags & PNX_FUNCDEFS) {
    4483             :             MOZ_ASSERT(emitterScope);

    4487             :                         return false;
    4488             :                 }
    4489             :             }
    4490             :         }
    4491             :     }
    4492             : 
    4493             :     // After entering the scope, push the switch control.
    4494             :     BreakableControl controlInfo(this, StatementKind::Switch);
    4495             : 
    4496           1 :     ptrdiff_t top = offset();
    4497             : 
    4498             :     // Switch bytecodes run from here till end of final case.
    4499           1 :     uint32_t caseCount = cases->pn_count;
    4500           1 :     if (caseCount > JS_BIT(16)) {
    4501           0 :         parser->tokenStream.reportError(JSMSG_TOO_MANY_CASES);
    4502           0 :         return false;
    4503             :     }
    4504             : 
    4505             :     // Try for most optimal, fall back if not dense ints.
    4506           1 :     JSOp switchOp = JSOP_TABLESWITCH;
    4507           1 :     uint32_t tableLength = 0;
    4508             :     int32_t low, high;

    4512           1 :         (caseCount == 1 && (hasDefault = firstCase->isDefault())))

    4514             :         caseCount = 0;
    4515             :         low = 0;

    4549           1 :             if (unsigned(i + int(JS_BIT(15))) >= unsigned(JS_BIT(16))) {

    4555           1 :             if (i > high)
    4556           1 :                 high = i;

    4558             :             // Check for duplicates, which require a JSOP_CONDSWITCH.

    4560             :             // case (because it requires a malloc'd bitmap).

    4615             :

    4641           1 :                 continue;

    4732             : 
    4733             :         // If this is emitted as a TABLESWITCH, we'll need to know this case's
    4734             :         // offset later when emitting the table. Store it in the node's
    4735             :         // pn_offset (giving the field a different meaning vs. how we used it
    4736             :         // on the immediately preceding line of code).
    4737           1 :         caseNode->setOffset(here.offset);
    4738             : 
    4739             :         TDZCheckCache tdzCache(this);
    4740             : 
    4741           1 :         if (!emitTree(caseNode->statementList()))
    4742           0 :             return false;
    4743           1 :     }
    4744             : 
    4745           1 :     if (!hasDefault) {
    4746             :         // If no default case, offset for default is to end of switch.
    4747           1 :         if (!emitJumpTarget(&defaultOffset))
    4748             :             return false;
    4749             :     }
    4750             :     MOZ_ASSERT(defaultOffset.offset != -1);
    4751             : 
    4752             :     // Set the default offset (to end of switch if no default).
    4753             :     jsbytecode* pc;
    4754           1 :     if (switchOp == JSOP_CONDSWITCH) {
    4755           1 :         pc = nullptr;
    4756             :         patchJumpsToTarget(condSwitchDefaultOff, defaultOffset);
    4757             :     } else {
    4758             :         MOZ_ASSERT(switchOp == JSOP_TABLESWITCH);
    4759           1 :         pc = code(top);
    4760           1 :         SET_JUMP_OFFSET(pc, defaultOffset.offset - top);
    4761           1 :         pc += JUMP_OFFSET_LEN;
    4762             :     }
    4763             :

    4766             :         return false;

    4769             :         // Skip over the already-initialized switch bounds.
    4770           1 :         pc += 2 * JUMP_OFFSET_LEN;
    4771             :

    4787             :         return false;

    5067             : bool
    5068           1 : BytecodeEmitter::emitDestructuringLHSRef(ParseNode* target, size_t* emitted)

    5129             : bool
    5130           1 : BytecodeEmitter::emitSetOrInitializeDestructuring(ParseNode* target, DestructuringFlavor flav)
    5131             : {
    5132             :     // Now emit the lvalue opcode sequence. If the lvalue is a nested
    5133             :     // destructuring initialiser-form, call ourselves to handle it, then pop
    5134             :     // the matched value. Otherwise emit an lvalue bytecode sequence followed
    5135             :     // by an assignment op.
    5136           1 :     if (target->isKind(PNK_SPREAD))
    5137           1 :         target = target->pn_kid;
    5138           1 :     else if (target->isKind(PNK_ASSIGN))
    5139           1 :         target = target->pn_left;
    5140           1 :     if (target->isKind(PNK_ARRAY) || target->isKind(PNK_OBJECT)) {
    5141           1 :         if (!emitDestructuringOps(target, flav))
    5142             :             return false;
    5143             :         // Per its post-condition, emitDestructuringOps has left the
    5144             :         // to-be-destructured value on top of the stack.
    5145           1 :         if (!emit1(JSOP_POP))
    5146             :             return false;
    5147             :     } else {
    5148           1 :         switch (target->getKind()) {
    5149             :           case PNK_NAME: {
    5150             :             auto emitSwapScopeAndRhs = [](BytecodeEmitter* bce, const NameLocation&,
    5151             :                                           bool emittedBindOp)
    5152             :             {
    5153           1 :                 if (emittedBindOp) {
    5154             :                     // This is like ordinary assignment, but with one
    5155             :                     // difference.
    5156             :                     //
    5157             :                     // In `a = b`, we first determine a binding for `a` (using
    5158             :                     // JSOP_BINDNAME or JSOP_BINDGNAME), then we evaluate `b`,
    5159             :                     // then a JSOP_SETNAME instruction.
    5160             :                     //
    5161             :                     // In `[a] = [b]`, per spec, `b` is evaluated first, then
    5162             :                     // we determine a binding for `a`. Then we need to do
    5163             :                     // assignment-- but the operands are on the stack in the
    5164             :                     // wrong order for JSOP_SETPROP, so we have to add a
    5165             :                     // JSOP_SWAP.
    5166             :                     //
    5167             :                     // In the cases where we are emitting a name op, emit a
    5168             :                     // swap because of this.
    5169           1 :                     return bce->emit1(JSOP_SWAP);
    5170             :                 }
    5171             : 
    5172             :                 // In cases of emitting a frame slot or environment slot,
    5173             :                 // nothing needs be done.
    5174             :                 return true;
    5175             :             };
    5176             : 
    5177           1 :             RootedAtom name(cx, target->name());
    5178           1 :             switch (flav) {
    5179             :               case DestructuringDeclaration:
    5180           1 :                 if (!emitInitializeName(name, emitSwapScopeAndRhs))
    5181             :                     return false;
    5182             :                 break;
    5183             : 
    5184             :               case DestructuringFormalParameterInVarScope: {
    5185             :                 // If there's an parameter expression var scope, the
    5186             :                 // destructuring declaration needs to initialize the name in
    5187             :                 // the function scope. The innermost scope is the var scope,
    5188             :                 // and its enclosing scope is the function scope.
    5189           0 :                 EmitterScope* funScope = innermostEmitterScope->enclosingInFrame();

    5191           0 :                 if (!emitSetOrInitializeNameAtLocation(name, paramLoc, emitSwapScopeAndRhs, true))
    5192           0 :                     return false;
    5193           0 :                 break;
    5194             :               }
    5195             : 
    5196             :               case DestructuringAssignment:
    5197           1 :                 if (!emitSetName(name, emitSwapScopeAndRhs))
    5198             :                     return false;
    5199             :                 break;
    5200             :             }
    5201             : 
    5202             :             break;
    5203             :           }
    5204             : 
    5205             :           case PNK_DOT: {
    5206             :             // The reference is already pushed by emitDestructuringLHSRef.
    5207             :             JSOp setOp;
    5208           1 :             if (target->as<PropertyAccess>().isSuper())
    5209           0 :                 setOp = sc->strict() ? JSOP_STRICTSETPROP_SUPER : JSOP_SETPROP_SUPER;
    5210             :             else
    5211           1 :                 setOp = sc->strict() ? JSOP_STRICTSETPROP : JSOP_SETPROP;
    5212           1 :             if (!emitAtomOp(target, setOp))
    5213             :                 return false;
    5214             :             break;
    5215             :           }
    5216             : 
    5217             :           case PNK_ELEM: {
    5218             :             // The reference is already pushed by emitDestructuringLHSRef.
    5219           1 :             if (target->as<PropertyByValue>().isSuper()) {
    5220           0 :                 JSOp setOp = sc->strict() ? JSOP_STRICTSETELEM_SUPER : JSOP_SETELEM_SUPER;
    5221             :                 // emitDestructuringLHSRef already did emitSuperElemOperands
    5222             :                 // part of emitSuperElemOp.  Perform remaining part here.
    5223           0 :                 if (!emitElemOpBase(setOp))
    5224             :                     return false;
    5225             :             } else {
    5226           1 :                 JSOp setOp = sc->strict() ? JSOP_STRICTSETELEM : JSOP_SETELEM;
    5227           1 :                 if (!emitElemOpBase(setOp))
    5228             :                     return false;
    5229             :             }
    5230             :             break;
    5231             :           }
    5232             : 
    5233             :           case PNK_CALL:
    5234             :             MOZ_ASSERT_UNREACHABLE("Parser::reportIfNotValidSimpleAssignmentTarget "
    5235             :                                    "rejects function calls as assignment "
    5236             :                                    "targets in destructuring assignments");
    5237             :             break;
    5238             : 
    5239             :           default:
    5240           0 :             MOZ_CRASH("emitSetOrInitializeDestructuring: bad lhs kind");
    5241             :         }
    5242             : 
    5243             :         // Pop the assigned value.
    5244           1 :         if (!emit1(JSOP_POP))
    5245             :             return false;
    5246             :     }
    5247             : 
    5248             :     return true;
    5249             : }
    5250             : 
    5251             : bool
    5252           1 : BytecodeEmitter::emitIteratorNext(ParseNode* pn, IteratorKind iterKind /* = IteratorKind::Sync */,
    5253             :                                   bool allowSelfHosted /* = false */)
    5254             : {
    5255             :     MOZ_ASSERT(allowSelfHosted || emitterMode != BytecodeEmitter::SelfHosting,
    5256             :                ".next() iteration is prohibited in self-hosted code because it "
    5257             :                "can run user-modifiable iteration code");
    5258             : 
    5259           1 :     if (!emit1(JSOP_DUP))                                 // ... ITER ITER
    5260             :         return false;
    5261           1 :     if (!emitAtomOp(cx->names().next, JSOP_CALLPROP))     // ... ITER NEXT
    5262             :         return false;
    5263           1 :     if (!emit1(JSOP_SWAP))                                // ... NEXT ITER
    5264             :         return false;
    5265           1 :     if (!emitCall(JSOP_CALL, 0, pn))                      // ... RESULT
    5266             :         return false;

    5270             :             return false;

    5276             :     return true;

    5278             : 
    5279             : bool
    5280           1 : BytecodeEmitter::emitIteratorClose(IteratorKind iterKind /* = IteratorKind::Sync */,
    5281             :                                    CompletionKind completionKind /* = CompletionKind::Normal */,
    5282             :                                    bool allowSelfHosted /* = false */)
    5283             : {
    5284             :     MOZ_ASSERT(allowSelfHosted || emitterMode != BytecodeEmitter::SelfHosting,
    5285             :                ".close() on iterators is prohibited in self-hosted code because it "
    5286             :                "can run user-modifiable iteration code");
    5287             : 
    5288             :     // Generate inline logic corresponding to IteratorClose (ES 7.4.6).
    5289             :     //
    5290             :     // Callers need to ensure that the iterator object is at the top of the
    5291             :     // stack.
    5292             : 
    5293           1 :     if (!emit1(JSOP_DUP))                                 // ... ITER ITER
    5294             :         return false;
    5295             : 
    5296             :     // Step 3.
    5297             :     //
    5298             :     // Get the "return" method.
    5299           1 :     if (!emitAtomOp(cx->names().return_, JSOP_CALLPROP))  // ... ITER RET
    5300             :         return false;
    5301             : 
    5302             :     // Step 4.
    5303             :     //
    5304             :     // Do nothing if "return" is null or undefined.
    5305             :     IfThenElseEmitter ifReturnMethodIsDefined(this);
    5306           1 :     if (!emit1(JSOP_DUP))                                 // ... ITER RET RET
    5307             :         return false;
    5308           1 :     if (!emit1(JSOP_UNDEFINED))                           // ... ITER RET RET UNDEFINED
    5309             :         return false;
    5310           1 :     if (!emit1(JSOP_NE))                                  // ... ITER RET ?NEQL
    5311             :         return false;
    5312           1 :     if (!ifReturnMethodIsDefined.emitIfElse())
    5313             :         return false;
    5314             : 
    5315           1 :     if (completionKind == CompletionKind::Throw) {
    5316             :         // 7.4.6 IteratorClose ( iterator, completion )
    5317             :         //   ...
    5318             :         //   3. Let return be ? GetMethod(iterator, "return").
    5319             :         //   4. If return is undefined, return Completion(completion).
    5320             :         //   5. Let innerResult be Call(return, iterator, « »).
    5321             :         //   6. If completion.[[Type]] is throw, return Completion(completion).
    5322             :         //   7. If innerResult.[[Type]] is throw, return
    5323             :         //      Completion(innerResult).
    5324             :         //
    5325             :         // For CompletionKind::Normal case, JSOP_CALL for step 5 checks if RET
    5326             :         // is callable, and throws if not.  Since step 6 doesn't match and
    5327             :         // error handling in step 3 and step 7 can be merged.
    5328             :         //
    5329             :         // For CompletionKind::Throw case, an error thrown by JSOP_CALL for
    5330             :         // step 5 is ignored by try-catch.  So we should check if RET is
    5331             :         // callable here, outside of try-catch, and the throw immediately if
    5332             :         // not.
    5333           1 :         CheckIsCallableKind kind = CheckIsCallableKind::IteratorReturn;
    5334           1 :         if (!emitCheckIsCallable(kind))                   // ... ITER RET
    5335             :             return false;
    5336             :     }
    5337             : 
    5338             :     // Steps 5, 8.
    5339             :     //
    5340             :     // Call "return" if it is not undefined or null, and check that it returns
    5341             :     // an Object.
    5342           1 :     if (!emit1(JSOP_SWAP))                                // ... RET ITER
    5343             :         return false;
    5344             : 
    5345             :     Maybe<TryEmitter> tryCatch;
    5346             : 
    5347           1 :     if (completionKind == CompletionKind::Throw) {
    5348             :         tryCatch.emplace(this, TryEmitter::TryCatch, TryEmitter::DontUseRetVal,
    5349           1 :                          TryEmitter::DontUseControl);
    5350             : 
    5351             :         // Mutate stack to balance stack for try-catch.
    5352           1 :         if (!emit1(JSOP_UNDEFINED))                       // ... RET ITER UNDEF
    5353             :             return false;
    5354           1 :         if (!tryCatch->emitTry())                         // ... RET ITER UNDEF
    5355             :             return false;
    5356           1 :         if (!emitDupAt(2))                                // ... RET ITER UNDEF RET
    5357             :             return false;
    5358           1 :         if (!emitDupAt(2))                                // ... RET ITER UNDEF RET ITER
    5359             :             return false;
    5360             :     }
    5361             : 
    5362           1 :     if (!emitCall(JSOP_CALL, 0))                          // ... ... RESULT
    5363             :         return false;
    5364             :     checkTypeSet(JSOP_CALL);
    5365             : 
    5366           1 :     if (iterKind == IteratorKind::Async) {
    5367           0 :         if (!emitAwait())                                 // ... ... RESULT
    5368             :             return false;
    5369             :     }
    5370             : 
    5371           1 :     if (completionKind == CompletionKind::Throw) {
    5372           1 :         if (!emit1(JSOP_SWAP))                            // ... RET ITER RESULT UNDEF
    5373             :             return false;
    5374           1 :         if (!emit1(JSOP_POP))                             // ... RET ITER RESULT
    5375             :             return false;
    5376             : 
    5377           1 :         if (!tryCatch->emitCatch())                       // ... RET ITER RESULT
    5378             :             return false;
    5379             : 
    5380             :         // Just ignore the exception thrown by call and await.
    5381           1 :         if (!emit1(JSOP_EXCEPTION))                       // ... RET ITER RESULT EXC
    5382             :             return false;
    5383           1 :         if (!emit1(JSOP_POP))                             // ... RET ITER RESULT
    5384             :             return false;
    5385             : 
    5386           1 :         if (!tryCatch->emitEnd())                         // ... RET ITER RESULT
    5387             :             return false;
    5388             : 
    5389             :         // Restore stack.
    5390           1 :         if (!emit2(JSOP_UNPICK, 2))                       // ... RESULT RET ITER
    5391             :             return false;
    5392           1 :         if (!emitPopN(2))                                 // ... RESULT
    5393             :             return false;
    5394             :     } else {
    5395           1 :         if (!emitCheckIsObj(CheckIsObjectKind::IteratorReturn)) // ... RESULT
    5396             :             return false;
    5397             :     }
    5398             : 
    5399           1 :     if (!ifReturnMethodIsDefined.emitElse())
    5400             :         return false;
    5401           1 :     if (!emit1(JSOP_POP))                                 // ... ITER
    5402             :         return false;
    5403           1 :     if (!ifReturnMethodIsDefined.emitEnd())
    5404             :         return false;
    5405             : 
    5406           1 :     return emit1(JSOP_POP);                               // ...
    5407             : }
    5408             : 
    5409             : template <typename InnerEmitter>
    5410             : bool
    5411           1 : BytecodeEmitter::wrapWithDestructuringIteratorCloseTryNote(int32_t iterDepth, InnerEmitter emitter)
    5412             : {
    5413             :     MOZ_ASSERT(this->stackDepth >= iterDepth);

    5425           1 : BytecodeEmitter::emitDefault(ParseNode* defaultExpr, ParseNode* pattern)

    5448             : bool

    5509             : 
    5510             : bool
    5511           1 : BytecodeEmitter::emitDestructuringOpsArray(ParseNode* pattern, DestructuringFlavor flav)
    5512             : {
    5513             :     MOZ_ASSERT(pattern->isKind(PNK_ARRAY));
    5514             :     MOZ_ASSERT(pattern->isArity(PN_LIST));
    5515             :     MOZ_ASSERT(this->stackDepth != 0);
    5516             : 
    5517             :     // Here's pseudo code for |let [a, b, , c=y, ...d] = x;|
    5518             :     //
    5519             :     // Lines that are annotated "covered by trynote" mean that upon throwing
    5520             :     // an exception, IteratorClose is called on iter only if done is false.
    5521             :     //
    5522             :     //   let x, y;
    5523             :     //   let a, b, c, d;
    5524             :     //   let iter, lref, result, done, value; // stack values
    5525             :     //
    5526             :     //   iter = x[Symbol.iterator]();
    5527             :     //
    5528             :     //   // ==== emitted by loop for a ====
    5529             :     //   lref = GetReference(a);              // covered by trynote
    5530             :     //
    5531             :     //   result = iter.next();
    5532             :     //   done = result.done;
    5533             :     //
    5534             :     //   if (done)
    5535             :     //     value = undefined;
    5536             :     //   else
    5537             :     //     value = result.value;
    5538             :     //
    5539             :     //   SetOrInitialize(lref, value);        // covered by trynote
    5540             :     //
    5541             :     //   // ==== emitted by loop for b ====
    5542             :     //   lref = GetReference(b);              // covered by trynote
    5543             :     //
    5544             :     //   if (done) {
    5545             :     //     value = undefined;
    5546             :     //   } else {
    5547             :     //     result = iter.next();
    5548             :     //     done = result.done;
    5549             :     //     if (done)
    5550             :     //       value = undefined;
    5551             :     //     else
    5552             :     //       value = result.value;
    5553             :     //   }
    5554             :     //
    5555             :     //   SetOrInitialize(lref, value);        // covered by trynote
    5556             :     //
    5557             :     //   // ==== emitted by loop for elision ====
    5558             :     //   if (done) {
    5559             :     //     value = undefined;
    5560             :     //   } else {
    5561             :     //     result = iter.next();
    5562             :     //     done = result.done;
    5563             :     //     if (done)
    5564             :     //       value = undefined;
    5565             :     //     else
    5566             :     //       value = result.value;
    5567             :     //   }
    5568             :     //
    5569             :     //   // ==== emitted by loop for c ====
    5570             :     //   lref = GetReference(c);              // covered by trynote
    5571             :     //
    5572             :     //   if (done) {
    5573             :     //     value = undefined;
    5574             :     //   } else {
    5575             :     //     result = iter.next();
    5576             :     //     done = result.done;
    5577             :     //     if (done)
    5578             :     //       value = undefined;
    5579             :     //     else
    5580             :     //       value = result.value;
    5581             :     //   }
    5582             :     //
    5583             :     //   if (value === undefined)
    5584             :     //     value = y;                         // covered by trynote
    5585             :     //
    5586             :     //   SetOrInitialize(lref, value);        // covered by trynote
    5587             :     //
    5588             :     //   // ==== emitted by loop for d ====
    5589             :     //   lref = GetReference(d);              // covered by trynote
    5590             :     //
    5591             :     //   if (done)
    5592             :     //     value = [];
    5593             :     //   else
    5594             :     //     value = [...iter];
    5595             :     //
    5596             :     //   SetOrInitialize(lref, value);        // covered by trynote
    5597             :     //
    5598             :     //   // === emitted after loop ===
    5599             :     //   if (!done)
    5600             :     //      IteratorClose(iter);
    5601             : 
    5602             :     // Use an iterator to destructure the RHS, instead of index lookup. We
    5603             :     // must leave the *original* value on the stack.
    5604           1 :     if (!emit1(JSOP_DUP))                                         // ... OBJ OBJ
    5605             :         return false;
    5606           1 :     if (!emitIterator())                                          // ... OBJ ITER
    5607             :         return false;
    5608             : 
    5609             :     // For an empty pattern [], call IteratorClose unconditionally. Nothing
    5610             :     // else needs to be done.
    5611           1 :     if (!pattern->pn_head)
    5612           0 :         return emitIteratorClose();                               // ... OBJ
    5613             : 
    5614             :     // Push an initial FALSE value for DONE.
    5615           1 :     if (!emit1(JSOP_FALSE))                                       // ... OBJ ITER FALSE
    5616             :         return false;
    5617             : 
    5618             :     // JSTRY_DESTRUCTURING_ITERCLOSE expects the iterator and the done value
    5619             :     // to be the second to top and the top of the stack, respectively.
    5620             :     // IteratorClose is called upon exception only if done is false.
    5621           1 :     int32_t tryNoteDepth = stackDepth;
    5622             : 
    5623           1 :     for (ParseNode* member = pattern->pn_head; member; member = member->pn_next) {
    5624           1 :         bool isFirst = member == pattern->pn_head;
    5625           1 :         DebugOnly<bool> hasNext = !!member->pn_next;
    5626             : 
    5627           1 :         size_t emitted = 0;
    5628             : 
    5629             :         // Spec requires LHS reference to be evaluated first.
    5630           1 :         ParseNode* lhsPattern = member;
    5631           1 :         if (lhsPattern->isKind(PNK_ASSIGN))
    5632           1 :             lhsPattern = lhsPattern->pn_left;
    5633             : 
    5634           1 :         bool isElision = lhsPattern->isKind(PNK_ELISION);
    5635           1 :         if (!isElision) {
    5636             :             auto emitLHSRef = [lhsPattern, &emitted](BytecodeEmitter* bce) {
    5637           1 :                 return bce->emitDestructuringLHSRef(lhsPattern, &emitted); // ... OBJ ITER DONE *LREF
    5638           1 :             };
    5639           1 :             if (!wrapWithDestructuringIteratorCloseTryNote(tryNoteDepth, emitLHSRef))
    5640           0 :                 return false;
    5641             :         }
    5642             : 
    5643             :         // Pick the DONE value to the top of the stack.
    5644           1 :         if (emitted) {
    5645           1 :             if (!emit2(JSOP_PICK, emitted))                       // ... OBJ ITER *LREF DONE
    5646             :                 return false;
    5647             :         }
    5648             : 
    5649           1 :         if (isFirst) {
    5650             :             // If this element is the first, DONE is always FALSE, so pop it.
    5651             :             //
    5652             :             // Non-first elements should emit if-else depending on the
    5653             :             // member pattern, below.
    5654           1 :             if (!emit1(JSOP_POP))                                 // ... OBJ ITER *LREF
    5655             :                 return false;
    5656             :         }
    5657             : 
    5658           1 :         if (member->isKind(PNK_SPREAD)) {
    5659             :             IfThenElseEmitter ifThenElse(this);
    5660           1 :             if (!isFirst) {
    5661             :                 // If spread is not the first element of the pattern,
    5662             :                 // iterator can already be completed.
    5663             :                                                                   // ... OBJ ITER *LREF DONE
    5664           1 :                 if (!ifThenElse.emitIfElse())                     // ... OBJ ITER *LREF
    5665             :                     return false;
    5666             : 
    5667           1 :                 if (!emitUint32Operand(JSOP_NEWARRAY, 0))         // ... OBJ ITER *LREF ARRAY
    5668             :                     return false;
    5669           1 :                 if (!ifThenElse.emitElse())                       // ... OBJ ITER *LREF
    5670             :                     return false;
    5671             :             }
    5672             : 
    5673             :             // If iterator is not completed, create a new array with the rest
    5674             :             // of the iterator.
    5675           1 :             if (!emitDupAt(emitted))                              // ... OBJ ITER *LREF ITER
    5676             :                 return false;
    5677           1 :             if (!emitUint32Operand(JSOP_NEWARRAY, 0))             // ... OBJ ITER *LREF ITER ARRAY
    5678             :                 return false;
    5679           1 :             if (!emitNumberOp(0))                                 // ... OBJ ITER *LREF ITER ARRAY INDEX
    5680             :                 return false;
    5681           1 :             if (!emitSpread())                                    // ... OBJ ITER *LREF ARRAY INDEX
    5682             :                 return false;
    5683           1 :             if (!emit1(JSOP_POP))                                 // ... OBJ ITER *LREF ARRAY
    5684             :                 return false;
    5685             : 
    5686           1 :             if (!isFirst) {
    5687           1 :                 if (!ifThenElse.emitEnd())
    5688             :                     return false;
    5689             :                 MOZ_ASSERT(ifThenElse.pushed() == 1);
    5690             :             }
    5691             : 
    5692             :             // At this point the iterator is done. Unpick a TRUE value for DONE above ITER.
    5693           1 :             if (!emit1(JSOP_TRUE))                                // ... OBJ ITER *LREF ARRAY TRUE
    5694             :                 return false;
    5695           1 :             if (!emit2(JSOP_UNPICK, emitted + 1))                 // ... OBJ ITER TRUE *LREF ARRAY
    5696             :                 return false;
    5697             : 
    5698             :             auto emitAssignment = [member, flav](BytecodeEmitter* bce) {
    5699             :                 return bce->emitSetOrInitializeDestructuring(member, flav); // ... OBJ ITER TRUE
    5700           1 :             };
    5701           1 :             if (!wrapWithDestructuringIteratorCloseTryNote(tryNoteDepth, emitAssignment))
    5702             :                 return false;
    5703             : 
    5704             :             MOZ_ASSERT(!hasNext);
    5705             :             break;
    5706             :         }
    5707             : 
    5708           1 :         ParseNode* pndefault = nullptr;
    5709           1 :         if (member->isKind(PNK_ASSIGN))
    5710           1 :             pndefault = member->pn_right;
    5711             : 
    5712             :         MOZ_ASSERT(!member->isKind(PNK_SPREAD));
    5713             : 
    5714             :         IfThenElseEmitter ifAlreadyDone(this);
    5715           1 :         if (!isFirst) {
    5716             :                                                                   // ... OBJ ITER *LREF DONE
    5717           1 :             if (!ifAlreadyDone.emitIfElse())                      // ... OBJ ITER *LREF
    5718             :                 return false;
    5719             : 
    5720           1 :             if (!emit1(JSOP_UNDEFINED))                           // ... OBJ ITER *LREF UNDEF
    5721             :                 return false;
    5722           1 :             if (!emit1(JSOP_NOP_DESTRUCTURING))                   // ... OBJ ITER *LREF UNDEF
    5723             :                 return false;
    5724             : 
    5725             :             // The iterator is done. Unpick a TRUE value for DONE above ITER.
    5726           1 :             if (!emit1(JSOP_TRUE))                                // ... OBJ ITER *LREF UNDEF TRUE
    5727             :                 return false;
    5728           1 :             if (!emit2(JSOP_UNPICK, emitted + 1))                 // ... OBJ ITER TRUE *LREF UNDEF
    5729             :                 return false;
    5730             : 
    5731           1 :             if (!ifAlreadyDone.emitElse())                        // ... OBJ ITER *LREF
    5732             :                 return false;
    5733             :         }
    5734             : 
    5735           1 :         if (emitted) {
    5736           1 :             if (!emitDupAt(emitted))                              // ... OBJ ITER *LREF ITER
    5737             :                 return false;
    5738             :         } else {
    5739           1 :             if (!emit1(JSOP_DUP))                                 // ... OBJ ITER *LREF ITER
    5740             :                 return false;
    5741             :         }
    5742           1 :         if (!emitIteratorNext(pattern))                           // ... OBJ ITER *LREF RESULT
    5743             :             return false;
    5744           1 :         if (!emit1(JSOP_DUP))                                     // ... OBJ ITER *LREF RESULT RESULT
    5745             :             return false;
    5746           1 :         if (!emitAtomOp(cx->names().done, JSOP_GETPROP))          // ... OBJ ITER *LREF RESULT DONE
    5747             :             return false;
    5748             : 
    5749           1 :         if (!emit1(JSOP_DUP))                                     // ... OBJ ITER *LREF RESULT DONE DONE
    5750             :             return false;
    5751           1 :         if (!emit2(JSOP_UNPICK, emitted + 2))                     // ... OBJ ITER DONE *LREF RESULT DONE
    5752             :             return false;
    5753             : 
    5754             :         IfThenElseEmitter ifDone(this);
    5755           1 :         if (!ifDone.emitIfElse())                                 // ... OBJ ITER DONE *LREF RESULT
    5756             :             return false;
    5757             : 
    5758           1 :         if (!emit1(JSOP_POP))                                     // ... OBJ ITER DONE *LREF
    5759             :             return false;

    5761             :             return false;

    5763             :             return false;

    5766             :             return false;

    5772             :             return false;
    5773             :         MOZ_ASSERT(ifDone.pushed() == 0);

    5777             :                 return false;

    5782             :             auto emitDefault = [pndefault, lhsPattern](BytecodeEmitter* bce) {
    5783           1 :                 return bce->emitDefault(pndefault, lhsPattern);    // ... OBJ ITER DONE *LREF VALUE
    5784           1 :             };

    5925           1 : BytecodeEmitter::emitTemplateString(ParseNode* pn)
    5926             : {
    5927             :     MOZ_ASSERT(pn->isArity(PN_LIST));
    5928             : 
    5929           1 :     bool pushedString = false;
    5930             : 
    5931           1 :     for (ParseNode* pn2 = pn->pn_head; pn2 != NULL; pn2 = pn2->pn_next) {
    5932           1 :         bool isString = (pn2->getKind() == PNK_STRING || pn2->getKind() == PNK_TEMPLATE_STRING);
    5933             : 
    5934             :         // Skip empty strings. These are very common: a template string like
    5935             :         // `${a}${b}` has three empty strings and without this optimization
    5936             :         // we'd emit four JSOP_ADD operations instead of just one.
    5937           1 :         if (isString && pn2->pn_atom->empty())

    5939             :

    5941             :             // We update source notes before emitting the expression

    5943             :                 return false;
    5944             :         }

    5946           1 :         if (!emitTree(pn2))
    5947             :             return false;
    5948             : 
    5949           1 :         if (!isString) {
    5950             :             // We need to convert the expression to a string
    5951           1 :             if (!emit1(JSOP_TOSTRING))
    5952             :                 return false;
    5953             :         }

    5956             :             // We've pushed two strings onto the stack. Add them together, leaving just one.
    5957           1 :             if (!emit1(JSOP_ADD))
    5958             :                 return false;

    5960             :             pushedString = true;
    5961             :         }

    6038             : static bool
    6039           1 : EmitAssignmentRhs(BytecodeEmitter* bce, ParseNode* rhs, uint8_t offset)
    6040             : {
    6041             :     // If there is a RHS tree, emit the tree.
    6042           1 :     if (rhs)

    6045             :     // Otherwise the RHS value to assign is already on the stack, i.e., the
    6046             :     // next enumeration value in a for-in or for-of loop. Depending on how
    6047             :     // many other values have been pushed on the stack, we need to get the

    6055             : bool
    6056           1 : BytecodeEmitter::emitAssignment(ParseNode* lhs, JSOp op, ParseNode* rhs)
    6057             : {
    6058             :     // Name assignments are handled separately because choosing ops and when
    6059             :     // to emit BINDNAME is involved and should avoid duplication.
    6060           1 :     if (lhs->isKind(PNK_NAME)) {
    6061             :         auto emitRhs = [op, lhs, rhs](BytecodeEmitter* bce, const NameLocation& lhsLoc,
    6062           1 :                                       bool emittedBindOp)
    6063             :         {

    6065             :             // the RHS and the op.

    6068             :                     return false;
    6069             :             }
    6070             :

    6072             :             // the top of the stack and we need to pick the right RHS value.
    6073           1 :             if (!EmitAssignmentRhs(bce, rhs, emittedBindOp ? 2 : 1))
    6074             :                 return false;

    6077           1 :                 RootedAtom name(bce->cx, lhs->name());

    6079           0 :                     return false;
    6080             :             }
    6081             :

    6083           1 :             if (op != JSOP_NOP && !bce->emit1(op))
    6084             :                 return false;
    6085             : 
    6086           1 :             return true;
    6087           1 :         };
    6088             : 
    6089           1 :         return emitSetName(lhs, emitRhs);
    6090             :     }
    6091             : 
    6092             :     // Deal with non-name assignments.
    6093           1 :     uint32_t atomIndex = (uint32_t) -1;
    6094           1 :     uint8_t offset = 1;
    6095             : 
    6096           1 :     switch (lhs->getKind()) {
    6097             :       case PNK_DOT:
    6098           1 :         if (lhs->as<PropertyAccess>().isSuper()) {
    6099           0 :             if (!emitSuperPropLHS(&lhs->as<PropertyAccess>().expression()))
    6100             :                 return false;
    6101             :             offset += 2;
    6102             :         } else {
    6103           1 :             if (!emitTree(lhs->expr()))
    6104             :                 return false;
    6105             :             offset += 1;
    6106             :         }
    6107           1 :         if (!makeAtomIndex(lhs->pn_atom, &atomIndex))
    6108             :             return false;
    6109             :         break;
    6110             :       case PNK_ELEM: {
    6111             :         MOZ_ASSERT(lhs->isArity(PN_BINARY));
    6112           1 :         EmitElemOption opt = op == JSOP_NOP ? EmitElemOption::Get : EmitElemOption::CompoundAssign;

    6114           0 :             if (!emitSuperElemOperands(lhs, opt))
    6115             :                 return false;
    6116             :             offset += 3;
    6117             :         } else {
    6118           1 :             if (!emitElemOperands(lhs, opt))
    6119             :                 return false;
    6120             :             offset += 2;
    6121             :         }
    6122             :         break;
    6123             :       }
    6124             :       case PNK_ARRAY:
    6125             :       case PNK_OBJECT:
    6126             :         break;
    6127             :       case PNK_CALL:
    6128           0 :         if (!emitTree(lhs))
    6129             :             return false;
    6130             : 
    6131             :         // Assignment to function calls is forbidden, but we have to make the
    6132             :         // call first.  Now we can throw.
    6133           0 :         if (!emitUint16Operand(JSOP_THROWMSG, JSMSG_BAD_LEFTSIDE_OF_ASS))
    6134             :             return false;
    6135             : 
    6136             :         // Rebalance the stack to placate stack-depth assertions.
    6137           0 :         if (!emit1(JSOP_POP))
    6138             :             return false;
    6139             :         break;
    6140             :       default:
    6141             :         MOZ_ASSERT(0);
    6142             :     }
    6143             : 
    6144           1 :     if (op != JSOP_NOP) {
    6145             :         MOZ_ASSERT(rhs);
    6146           1 :         switch (lhs->getKind()) {
    6147             :           case PNK_DOT: {
    6148             :             JSOp getOp;
    6149           1 :             if (lhs->as<PropertyAccess>().isSuper()) {
    6150           0 :                 if (!emit1(JSOP_DUP2))
    6151             :                     return false;
    6152             :                 getOp = JSOP_GETPROP_SUPER;
    6153             :             } else {
    6154           1 :                 if (!emit1(JSOP_DUP))
    6155             :                     return false;
    6156           1 :                 bool isLength = (lhs->pn_atom == cx->names().length);
    6157           1 :                 getOp = isLength ? JSOP_LENGTH : JSOP_GETPROP;
    6158             :             }
    6159           1 :             if (!emitIndex32(getOp, atomIndex))
    6160             :                 return false;
    6161             :             break;
    6162             :           }
    6163             :           case PNK_ELEM: {
    6164             :             JSOp elemOp;
    6165           1 :             if (lhs->as<PropertyByValue>().isSuper()) {
    6166           0 :                 if (!emitDupAt(2))
    6167             :                     return false;
    6168           0 :                 if (!emitDupAt(2))
    6169             :                     return false;
    6170           0 :                 if (!emitDupAt(2))
    6171             :                     return false;
    6172             :                 elemOp = JSOP_GETELEM_SUPER;
    6173             :             } else {
    6174           1 :                 if (!emit1(JSOP_DUP2))
    6175             :                     return false;
    6176             :                 elemOp = JSOP_GETELEM;
    6177             :             }
    6178           1 :             if (!emitElemOpBase(elemOp))
    6179             :                 return false;
    6180             :             break;
    6181             :           }
    6182             :           case PNK_CALL:
    6183             :             // We just emitted a JSOP_THROWMSG and popped the call's return
    6184             :             // value.  Push a random value to make sure the stack depth is
    6185             :             // correct.
    6186           0 :             if (!emit1(JSOP_NULL))
    6187             :                 return false;
    6188             :             break;
    6189             :           default:;
    6190             :         }
    6191             :     }
    6192             : 
    6193           1 :     if (!EmitAssignmentRhs(this, rhs, offset))
    6194             :         return false;
    6195             : 
    6196             :     /* If += etc., emit the binary operator with a source note. */
    6197           1 :     if (op != JSOP_NOP) {
    6198           1 :         if (!newSrcNote(SRC_ASSIGNOP))
    6199             :             return false;
    6200           1 :         if (!emit1(op))
    6201             :             return false;
    6202             :     }
    6203             : 
    6204             :     /* Finally, emit the specialized assignment bytecode. */
    6205           1 :     switch (lhs->getKind()) {
    6206             :       case PNK_DOT: {
    6207           1 :         JSOp setOp = lhs->as<PropertyAccess>().isSuper() ?
    6208           0 :                        (sc->strict() ? JSOP_STRICTSETPROP_SUPER : JSOP_SETPROP_SUPER) :
    6209           1 :                        (sc->strict() ? JSOP_STRICTSETPROP : JSOP_SETPROP);
    6210           1 :         if (!emitIndexOp(setOp, atomIndex))
    6211             :             return false;
    6212             :         break;
    6213             :       }
    6214             :       case PNK_CALL:
    6215             :         // We threw above, so nothing to do here.
    6216             :         break;
    6217             :       case PNK_ELEM: {
    6218             :         JSOp setOp = lhs->as<PropertyByValue>().isSuper() ?
    6219           0 :                        sc->strict() ? JSOP_STRICTSETELEM_SUPER : JSOP_SETELEM_SUPER :
    6220           1 :                        sc->strict() ? JSOP_STRICTSETELEM : JSOP_SETELEM;
    6221           1 :         if (!emit1(setOp))
    6222             :             return false;
    6223             :         break;
    6224             :       }
    6225             :       case PNK_ARRAY:
    6226             :       case PNK_OBJECT:
    6227           1 :         if (!emitDestructuringOps(lhs, DestructuringAssignment))
    6228             :             return false;
    6229             :         break;
    6230             :       default:
    6231             :         MOZ_ASSERT(0);
    6232             :     }
    6233             :     return true;
    6234             : }
    6235             : 
    6236             : bool
    6237           1 : ParseNode::getConstantValue(JSContext* cx, AllowConstantObjects allowObjects,
    6238             :                             MutableHandleValue vp, Value* compare, size_t ncompare,
    6239             :                             NewObjectKind newKind)
    6240             : {

    6428           1 : BytecodeEmitter::emitCatch(ParseNode* pn)
    6429             : {
    6430             :     // We must be nested under a try-finally statement.
    6431           1 :     TryFinallyControl& controlInfo = innermostNestableControl->as<TryFinallyControl>();
    6432             : 
    6433             :     /* Pick up the pending exception and bind it to the catch variable. */
    6434           1 :     if (!emit1(JSOP_EXCEPTION))
    6435             :         return false;
    6436             : 
    6437             :     /*
    6438             :      * Dup the exception object if there is a guard for rethrowing to use
    6439             :      * it later when rethrowing or in other catches.
    6440             :      */
    6441           1 :     if (pn->pn_kid2 && !emit1(JSOP_DUP))
    6442             :         return false;
    6443             : 
    6444           1 :     ParseNode* pn2 = pn->pn_kid1;
    6445           1 :     switch (pn2->getKind()) {
    6446             :       case PNK_ARRAY:
    6447             :       case PNK_OBJECT:
    6448           1 :         if (!emitDestructuringOps(pn2, DestructuringDeclaration))
    6449             :             return false;
    6450           1 :         if (!emit1(JSOP_POP))
    6451             :             return false;
    6452             :         break;
    6453             : 
    6454             :       case PNK_NAME:
    6455           1 :         if (!emitLexicalInitialization(pn2))
    6456             :             return false;
    6457           1 :         if (!emit1(JSOP_POP))
    6458             :             return false;
    6459             :         break;
    6460             : 
    6461             :       default:
    6462             :         MOZ_ASSERT(0);
    6463             :     }
    6464             : 
    6465             :     // If there is a guard expression, emit it and arrange to jump to the next
    6466             :     // catch block if the guard expression is false.
    6467           1 :     if (pn->pn_kid2) {
    6468           1 :         if (!emitTree(pn->pn_kid2))
    6469           0 :             return false;
    6470             : 
    6471             :         // If the guard expression is false, fall through, pop the block scope,
    6472             :         // and jump to the next catch block.  Otherwise jump over that code and
    6473             :         // pop the dupped exception.
    6474             :         JumpList guardCheck;
    6475           1 :         if (!emitJump(JSOP_IFNE, &guardCheck))
    6476             :             return false;
    6477             : 
    6478             :         {

    6480             : 
    6481             :             // Move exception back to cx->exception to prepare for
    6482             :             // the next catch.
    6483           1 :             if (!emit1(JSOP_THROWING))
    6484           0 :                 return false;

    6486             :             // Leave the scope for this catch block.
    6487           1 :             if (!nle.prepareForNonLocalJump(&controlInfo))
    6488             :                 return false;
    6489             : 
    6490             :             // Jump to the next handler added by emitTry.
    6491           1 :             if (!emitJump(JSOP_GOTO, &controlInfo.guardJump))
    6492           1 :                 return false;
    6493             :         }
    6494             : 
    6495             :         // Back to normal control flow.

    6508             : // Using MOZ_NEVER_INLINE in here is a workaround for llvm.org/pr14047. See the
    6509             : // comment on EmitSwitch.
    6510             : MOZ_NEVER_INLINE bool
    6511           1 : BytecodeEmitter::emitTry(ParseNode* pn)
    6512             : {
    6513           1 :     ParseNode* catchList = pn->pn_kid2;
    6514           1 :     ParseNode* finallyNode = pn->pn_kid3;
    6515             : 
    6516             :     TryEmitter::Kind kind;
    6517           1 :     if (catchList) {
    6518           1 :         if (finallyNode)
    6519             :             kind = TryEmitter::TryCatchFinally;
    6520             :         else
    6521           1 :             kind = TryEmitter::TryCatch;
    6522             :     } else {
    6523             :         MOZ_ASSERT(finallyNode);
    6524             :         kind = TryEmitter::TryFinally;
    6525             :     }
    6526             :     TryEmitter tryCatch(this, kind);
    6527             : 
    6528           1 :     if (!tryCatch.emitTry())
    6529             :         return false;
    6530             : 
    6531           1 :     if (!emitTree(pn->pn_kid1))
    6532             :         return false;
    6533             : 
    6534             :     // If this try has a catch block, emit it.
    6535           1 :     if (catchList) {
    6536             :         MOZ_ASSERT(catchList->isKind(PNK_CATCHLIST));
    6537             : 
    6538             :         // The emitted code for a catch block looks like:
    6539             :         //
    6540             :         // [pushlexicalenv]             only if any local aliased
    6541             :         // exception
    6542             :         // if there is a catchguard:
    6543             :         //   dup
    6544             :         // setlocal 0; pop              assign or possibly destructure exception
    6545             :         // if there is a catchguard:
    6546             :         //   < catchguard code >
    6547             :         //   ifne POST
    6548             :         //   debugleaveblock
    6549             :         //   [poplexicalenv]            only if any local aliased
    6550             :         //   throwing                   pop exception to cx->exception
    6551             :         //   goto <next catch block>
    6552             :         //   POST: pop
    6553             :         // < catch block contents >
    6554             :         // debugleaveblock
    6555             :         // [poplexicalenv]              only if any local aliased
    6556             :         // goto <end of catch blocks>   non-local; finally applies
    6557             :         //
    6558             :         // If there's no catch block without a catchguard, the last <next catch
    6559             :         // block> points to rethrow code.  This code will [gosub] to the finally
    6560             :         // code if appropriate, and is also used for the catch-all trynote for
    6561             :         // capturing exceptions thrown from catch{} blocks.
    6562             :         //
    6563           1 :         for (ParseNode* pn3 = catchList->pn_head; pn3; pn3 = pn3->pn_next) {
    6564           1 :             if (!tryCatch.emitCatch())
    6565             :                 return false;
    6566             : 
    6567             :             // Emit the lexical scope and catch body.
    6568             :             MOZ_ASSERT(pn3->isKind(PNK_LEXICALSCOPE));
    6569           1 :             if (!emitTree(pn3))
    6570             :                 return false;
    6571             :         }
    6572             :     }
    6573             : 
    6574             :     // Emit the finally handler, if there is one.
    6575           1 :     if (finallyNode) {
    6576           1 :         if (!tryCatch.emitFinally(Some(finallyNode->pn_pos.begin)))
    6577             :             return false;
    6578             : 
    6579           1 :         if (!emitTree(finallyNode))
    6580             :             return false;
    6581             :     }
    6582             : 
    6583           1 :     if (!tryCatch.emitEnd())
    6584             :         return false;
    6585             : 
    6586           1 :     return true;
    6587             : }

    6681             : 
    6682             :     // Update line number notes before emitting TDZ poison in
    6683             :     // EmitterScope::enterLexical to avoid spurious pausing on seemingly
    6684             :     // non-effectful lines in Debugger.
    6685             :     //
    6686             :     // For example, consider the following code.
    6687             :     //
    6688             :     // L1: {
    6689             :     // L2:   let x = 42;
    6690             :     // L3: }
    6691             :     //
    6692             :     // If line number notes were not updated before the TDZ poison, the TDZ
    6693             :     // poison bytecode sequence of 'uninitialized; initlexical' will have line
    6694             :     // number L1, and the Debugger will pause there.
    6695           1 :     if (!ParseNodeRequiresSpecialLineNumberNotes(body)) {

    6742             : 
    6743             : bool
    6744           1 : BytecodeEmitter::emitRequireObjectCoercible()
    6745             : {
    6746             :     // For simplicity, handle this in self-hosted code, at cost of 13 bytes of
    6747             :     // bytecode versus 1 byte for a dedicated opcode.  As more places need this
    6748             :     // behavior, we may want to reconsider this tradeoff.
    6749             : 
    6750             : #ifdef DEBUG
    6751             :     auto depth = this->stackDepth;
    6752             : #endif
    6753             :     MOZ_ASSERT(depth > 0);                 // VAL
    6754           1 :     if (!emit1(JSOP_DUP))                  // VAL VAL
    6755             :         return false;
    6756             : 
    6757             :     // Note that "intrinsic" is a misnomer: we're calling a *self-hosted*
    6758             :     // function that's not an intrinsic!  But it nonetheless works as desired.
    6759           1 :     if (!emitAtomOp(cx->names().RequireObjectCoercible,
    6760           1 :                     JSOP_GETINTRINSIC))    // VAL VAL REQUIREOBJECTCOERCIBLE
    6761             :     {
    6762             :         return false;
    6763             :     }
    6764           1 :     if (!emit1(JSOP_UNDEFINED))            // VAL VAL REQUIREOBJECTCOERCIBLE UNDEFINED
    6765             :         return false;
    6766           1 :     if (!emit2(JSOP_PICK, 2))              // VAL REQUIREOBJECTCOERCIBLE UNDEFINED VAL
    6767             :         return false;
    6768           1 :     if (!emitCall(JSOP_CALL_IGNORES_RV, 1))// VAL IGNORED
    6769             :         return false;
    6770             :     checkTypeSet(JSOP_CALL_IGNORES_RV);
    6771             : 
    6772           1 :     if (!emit1(JSOP_POP))                  // VAL
    6773             :         return false;
    6774             : 
    6775             :     MOZ_ASSERT(depth == this->stackDepth);
    6776           1 :     return true;
    6777             : }
    6778             : 
    6779             : bool
    6780           1 : BytecodeEmitter::emitIterator()
    6781             : {
    6782             :     // Convert iterable to iterator.
    6783           1 :     if (!emit1(JSOP_DUP))                                         // OBJ OBJ
    6784             :         return false;
    6785           1 :     if (!emit2(JSOP_SYMBOL, uint8_t(JS::SymbolCode::iterator)))   // OBJ OBJ @@ITERATOR
    6786             :         return false;

    6788             :         return false;

    6790             :         return false;

    6792             :         return false;

    6795             :         return false;
    6796           1 :     return true;

    6856             : bool
    6857           1 : BytecodeEmitter::emitSpread(bool allowSelfHosted)
    6858             : {
    6859           1 :     LoopControl loopInfo(this, StatementKind::Spread);
    6860             : 
    6861             :     // Jump down to the loop condition to minimize overhead assuming at least
    6862             :     // one iteration, as the other loop forms do.  Annotate so IonMonkey can
    6863             :     // find the loop-closing jump.
    6864             :     unsigned noteIndex;
    6865           1 :     if (!newSrcNote(SRC_FOR_OF, &noteIndex))
    6866             :         return false;
    6867             : 
    6868             :     // Jump down to the loop condition to minimize overhead, assuming at least
    6869             :     // one iteration.  (This is also what we do for loops; whether this
    6870             :     // assumption holds for spreads is an unanswered question.)
    6871             :     JumpList initialJump;
    6872           1 :     if (!emitJump(JSOP_GOTO, &initialJump))               // ITER ARR I (during the goto)
    6873             :         return false;
    6874             : 
    6875           1 :     JumpTarget top{ -1 };
    6876           1 :     if (!emitLoopHead(nullptr, &top))                     // ITER ARR I
    6877             :         return false;
    6878             : 
    6879             :     // When we enter the goto above, we have ITER ARR I on the stack.  But when
    6880             :     // we reach this point on the loop backedge (if spreading produces at least
    6881             :     // one value), we've additionally pushed a RESULT iteration value.
    6882             :     // Increment manually to reflect this.
    6883           1 :     this->stackDepth++;
    6884             : 
    6885             :     JumpList beq;
    6886           1 :     JumpTarget breakTarget{ -1 };
    6887             :     {
    6888             : #ifdef DEBUG
    6889             :         auto loopDepth = this->stackDepth;
    6890             : #endif
    6891             : 
    6892             :         // Emit code to assign result.value to the iteration variable.
    6893           1 :         if (!emitAtomOp(cx->names().value, JSOP_GETPROP)) // ITER ARR I VALUE
    6894             :             return false;
    6895           1 :         if (!emit1(JSOP_INITELEM_INC))                    // ITER ARR (I+1)
    6896             :             return false;
    6897             : 
    6898             :         MOZ_ASSERT(this->stackDepth == loopDepth - 1);
    6899             : 
    6900             :         // Spread operations can't contain |continue|, so don't bother setting loop
    6901             :         // and enclosing "update" offsets, as we do with for-loops.
    6902             : 
    6903             :         // COME FROM the beginning of the loop to here.
    6904           1 :         if (!emitLoopEntry(nullptr, initialJump))         // ITER ARR I
    6905             :             return false;
    6906             : 
    6907           1 :         if (!emitDupAt(2))                                // ITER ARR I ITER
    6908             :             return false;
    6909           1 :         if (!emitIteratorNext(nullptr, IteratorKind::Sync, allowSelfHosted))  // ITER ARR I RESULT
    6910             :             return false;
    6911           1 :         if (!emit1(JSOP_DUP))                             // ITER ARR I RESULT RESULT
    6912             :             return false;
    6913           1 :         if (!emitAtomOp(cx->names().done, JSOP_GETPROP))  // ITER ARR I RESULT DONE
    6914             :             return false;
    6915             : 
    6916           1 :         if (!emitBackwardJump(JSOP_IFEQ, top, &beq, &breakTarget)) // ITER ARR I RESULT
    6917             :             return false;
    6918             : 
    6919             :         MOZ_ASSERT(this->stackDepth == loopDepth);
    6920             :     }
    6921             : 
    6922             :     // Let Ion know where the closing jump of this loop is.
    6923           1 :     if (!setSrcNoteOffset(noteIndex, 0, beq.offset - initialJump.offset))
    6924             :         return false;
    6925             : 
    6926             :     // No breaks or continues should occur in spreads.
    6927             :     MOZ_ASSERT(loopInfo.breaks.offset == -1);
    6928             :     MOZ_ASSERT(loopInfo.continues.offset == -1);
    6929             : 
    6930           1 :     if (!tryNoteList.append(JSTRY_FOR_OF, stackDepth, top.offset, breakTarget.offset))
    6931             :         return false;
    6932             : 
    6933           1 :     if (!emit2(JSOP_PICK, 3))                             // ARR FINAL_INDEX RESULT ITER
    6934             :         return false;
    6935             : 
    6936           1 :     return emitPopN(2);                                   // ARR FINAL_INDEX
    6937             : }
    6938             : 
    6939             : bool
    6940           1 : BytecodeEmitter::emitInitializeForInOrOfTarget(ParseNode* forHead)
    6941             : {
    6942             :     MOZ_ASSERT(forHead->isKind(PNK_FORIN) || forHead->isKind(PNK_FOROF));
    6943             :     MOZ_ASSERT(forHead->isArity(PN_TERNARY));
    6944             : 
    6945             :     MOZ_ASSERT(this->stackDepth >= 1,
    6946             :                "must have a per-iteration value for initializing");

    6949             :     MOZ_ASSERT(!forHead->pn_kid2);
    6950             : 
    6951             :     // If the for-in/of loop didn't have a variable declaration, per-loop
    6952             :     // initialization is just assigning the iteration value to a target
    6953             :     // expression.
    6954           1 :     if (!parser->handler.isDeclarationList(target))
    6955           1 :         return emitAssignment(target, JSOP_NOP, nullptr); // ... ITERVAL
    6956             : 
    6957             :     // Otherwise, per-loop initialization is (possibly) declaration
    6958             :     // initialization.  If the declaration is a lexical declaration, it must be
    6959             :     // initialized.  If the declaration is a variable declaration, an

    6961             :     // variable!) must be generated.

    6968             : 
    6969           1 :     if (target->isKind(PNK_NAME)) {
    6970             :         auto emitSwapScopeAndRhs = [](BytecodeEmitter* bce, const NameLocation&,
    6971             :                                       bool emittedBindOp)
    6972             :         {
    6973           1 :             if (emittedBindOp) {
    6974             :                 // Per-iteration initialization in for-in/of loops computes the
    6975             :                 // iteration value *before* initializing.  Thus the
    6976             :                 // initializing value may be buried under a bind-specific value
    6977             :                 // on the stack.  Swap it to the top of the stack.
    6978             :                 MOZ_ASSERT(bce->stackDepth >= 2);

    6983             :             // nothing needs be done.
    6984             :             MOZ_ASSERT(bce->stackDepth >= 1);
    6985             :             return true;
    6986             :         };
    6987             : 
    6988             :         // The caller handles removing the iteration value from the stack.
    6989           1 :         return emitInitializeName(target, emitSwapScopeAndRhs);
    6990             :     }
    6991             :

    7185           1 : BytecodeEmitter::emitForIn(ParseNode* forInLoop, EmitterScope* headLexicalEmitterScope)
    7186             : {
    7187             :     MOZ_ASSERT(forInLoop->isKind(PNK_FOR));
    7188             :     MOZ_ASSERT(forInLoop->isArity(PN_BINARY));
    7189             :     MOZ_ASSERT(forInLoop->isOp(JSOP_ITER));

    7196             :     // |for (var i = initializer in expr) { ... }|

    7199           1 :         ParseNode* decl = parser->handler.singleBindingFromDeclaration(forInTarget);

    7214             : 
    7215             :                 // Pop the initializer.
