    7234             :     // For-in loops have both the iterator and the value on the stack. Push
    7235             :     // undefined to balance the stack.
    7236           1 :     if (!emit1(JSOP_UNDEFINED))                           // ITER ITERVAL
    7237             :         return false;
    7238             : 
    7239           1 :     LoopControl loopInfo(this, StatementKind::ForInLoop);
    7240             : 
    7241             :     /* Annotate so IonMonkey can find the loop-closing jump. */
    7242             :     unsigned noteIndex;
    7243           1 :     if (!newSrcNote(SRC_FOR_IN, &noteIndex))
    7244             :         return false;
    7245             : 
    7246             :     // Jump down to the loop condition to minimize overhead (assuming at least
    7247             :     // one iteration, just like the other loop forms).
    7248             :     JumpList initialJump;
    7249           1 :     if (!emitJump(JSOP_GOTO, &initialJump))               // ITER ITERVAL
    7250             :         return false;
    7251             : 
    7252           1 :     JumpTarget top{ -1 };
    7253           1 :     if (!emitLoopHead(nullptr, &top))                     // ITER ITERVAL
    7254             :         return false;
    7255             : 
    7256             :     // If the loop had an escaping lexical declaration, replace the current
    7257             :     // environment with an dead zoned one to implement TDZ semantics.
    7258           1 :     if (headLexicalEmitterScope) {
    7259             :         // The environment chain only includes an environment for the for-in
    7260             :         // loop head *if* a scope binding is captured, thereby requiring
    7261             :         // recreation each iteration. If a lexical scope exists for the head,
    7262             :         // it must be the innermost one. If that scope has closed-over
    7263             :         // bindings inducing an environment, recreate the current environment.
    7264             :         MOZ_ASSERT(forInTarget->isKind(PNK_LET) || forInTarget->isKind(PNK_CONST));
    7265             :         MOZ_ASSERT(headLexicalEmitterScope == innermostEmitterScope);
    7266             :         MOZ_ASSERT(headLexicalEmitterScope->scope(this)->kind() == ScopeKind::Lexical);
    7267             : 
    7268           1 :         if (headLexicalEmitterScope->hasEnvironment()) {
    7269           1 :             if (!emit1(JSOP_RECREATELEXICALENV))          // ITER ITERVAL
    7270             :                 return false;
    7271             :         }
    7272             : 
    7273             :         // For uncaptured bindings, put them back in TDZ.
    7274           1 :         if (!headLexicalEmitterScope->deadZoneFrameSlots(this))
    7275             :             return false;
    7276             :     }
    7277             : 
    7278             :     {
    7279             : #ifdef DEBUG
    7280             :         auto loopDepth = this->stackDepth;
    7281             : #endif
    7282             :         MOZ_ASSERT(loopDepth >= 2);
    7283             : 
    7284           1 :         if (!emitInitializeForInOrOfTarget(forInHead))    // ITER ITERVAL
    7285             :             return false;
    7286             : 
    7287             :         MOZ_ASSERT(this->stackDepth == loopDepth,
    7288             :                    "iterator and iterval must be left on the stack");
    7289             :     }
    7290             : 
    7291             :     // Perform the loop body.
    7292           1 :     ParseNode* forBody = forInLoop->pn_right;
    7293           1 :     if (!emitTree(forBody))                               // ITER ITERVAL
    7294             :         return false;
    7295             : 
    7296             :     // Set offset for continues.
    7297           1 :     loopInfo.continueTarget = { offset() };
    7298             : 
    7299           1 :     if (!emitLoopEntry(nullptr, initialJump))             // ITER ITERVAL
    7300             :         return false;
    7301           1 :     if (!emit1(JSOP_POP))                                 // ITER
    7302             :         return false;
    7303           1 :     if (!emit1(JSOP_MOREITER))                            // ITER NEXTITERVAL?
    7304             :         return false;
    7305           1 :     if (!emit1(JSOP_ISNOITER))                            // ITER NEXTITERVAL? ISNOITER
    7306             :         return false;
    7307             : 
    7308             :     JumpList beq;
    7309           1 :     JumpTarget breakTarget{ -1 };
    7310           1 :     if (!emitBackwardJump(JSOP_IFEQ, top, &beq, &breakTarget))
    7311             :         return false;                                     // ITER NEXTITERVAL
    7312             : 
    7313             :     // Set the srcnote offset so we can find the closing jump.
    7314           1 :     if (!setSrcNoteOffset(noteIndex, 0, beq.offset - initialJump.offset))
    7315             :         return false;
    7316             : 
    7317           1 :     if (!loopInfo.patchBreaksAndContinues(this))
    7318             :         return false;
    7319             : 
    7320             :     // Pop the enumeration value.
    7321           1 :     if (!emit1(JSOP_POP))                                 // ITER
    7322             :         return false;
    7323             : 
    7324           1 :     if (!tryNoteList.append(JSTRY_FOR_IN, this->stackDepth, top.offset, offset()))
    7325             :         return false;
    7326             : 
    7327           1 :     return emit1(JSOP_ENDITER);                           //
    7328             : }
    7329             : 
    7330             : /* C-style `for (init; cond; update) ...` loop. */
    7331             : bool
    7332           1 : BytecodeEmitter::emitCStyleFor(ParseNode* pn, EmitterScope* headLexicalEmitterScope)
    7333             : {
    7334           1 :     LoopControl loopInfo(this, StatementKind::ForLoop);
    7335             : 
    7336           1 :     ParseNode* forHead = pn->pn_left;
    7337           1 :     ParseNode* forBody = pn->pn_right;
    7338             : 
    7339             :     // If the head of this for-loop declared any lexical variables, the parser
    7340             :     // wrapped this PNK_FOR node in a PNK_LEXICALSCOPE representing the
    7341             :     // implicit scope of those variables. By the time we get here, we have
    7342             :     // already entered that scope. So far, so good.
    7343             :     //
    7344             :     // ### Scope freshening
    7345             :     //
    7346             :     // Each iteration of a `for (let V...)` loop creates a fresh loop variable
    7347             :     // binding for V, even if the loop is a C-style `for(;;)` loop:
    7348             :     //
    7349             :     //     var funcs = [];
    7350             :     //     for (let i = 0; i < 2; i++)
    7351             :     //         funcs.push(function() { return i; });
    7352             :     //     assertEq(funcs[0](), 0);  // the two closures capture...
    7353             :     //     assertEq(funcs[1](), 1);  // ...two different `i` bindings
    7354             :     //
    7355             :     // This is implemented by "freshening" the implicit block -- changing the
    7356             :     // scope chain to a fresh clone of the instantaneous block object -- each
    7357             :     // iteration, just before evaluating the "update" in for(;;) loops.
    7358             :     //
    7359             :     // No freshening occurs in `for (const ...;;)` as there's no point: you
    7360             :     // can't reassign consts. This is observable through the Debugger API. (The
    7361             :     // ES6 spec also skips cloning the environment in this case.)
    7362           1 :     bool forLoopRequiresFreshening = false;
    7363           1 :     if (ParseNode* init = forHead->pn_kid1) {
    7364             :         // Emit the `init` clause, whether it's an expression or a variable
    7365             :         // declaration. (The loop variables were hoisted into an enclosing
    7366             :         // scope, but we still need to emit code for the initializers.)
    7367           1 :         if (!updateSourceCoordNotes(init->pn_pos.begin))
    7368             :             return false;
    7369           1 :         if (init->isForLoopDeclaration()) {
    7370           1 :             if (!emitTree(init))
    7371             :                 return false;
    7372             :         } else {
    7373             :             // 'init' is an expression, not a declaration. emitTree left its
    7374             :             // value on the stack.
    7375           1 :             if (!emitTree(init, ValueUsage::IgnoreValue))
    7376             :                 return false;
    7377           1 :             if (!emit1(JSOP_POP))
    7378             :                 return false;
    7379             :         }
    7380             : 
    7381             :         // ES 13.7.4.8 step 2. The initial freshening.
    7382             :         //
    7383             :         // If an initializer let-declaration may be captured during loop iteration,
    7384             :         // the current scope has an environment.  If so, freshen the current
    7385             :         // environment to expose distinct bindings for each loop iteration.
    7386           1 :         forLoopRequiresFreshening = init->isKind(PNK_LET) && headLexicalEmitterScope;
    7387           1 :         if (forLoopRequiresFreshening) {
    7388             :             // The environment chain only includes an environment for the for(;;)
    7389             :             // loop head's let-declaration *if* a scope binding is captured, thus
    7390             :             // requiring a fresh environment each iteration. If a lexical scope
    7391             :             // exists for the head, it must be the innermost one. If that scope
    7392             :             // has closed-over bindings inducing an environment, recreate the
    7393             :             // current environment.
    7394             :             MOZ_ASSERT(headLexicalEmitterScope == innermostEmitterScope);
    7395             :             MOZ_ASSERT(headLexicalEmitterScope->scope(this)->kind() == ScopeKind::Lexical);
    7396             : 
    7397           1 :             if (headLexicalEmitterScope->hasEnvironment()) {
    7398           1 :                 if (!emit1(JSOP_FRESHENLEXICALENV))
    7399             :                     return false;
    7400             :             }
    7401             :         }
    7402             :     }
    7403             : 
    7404             :     /*
    7405             :      * NB: the SRC_FOR note has offsetBias 1 (JSOP_NOP_LENGTH).
    7406             :      * Use tmp to hold the biased srcnote "top" offset, which differs
    7407             :      * from the top local variable by the length of the JSOP_GOTO
    7408             :      * emitted in between tmp and top if this loop has a condition.
    7409             :      */
    7410             :     unsigned noteIndex;
    7411           1 :     if (!newSrcNote(SRC_FOR, &noteIndex))
    7412             :         return false;
    7413           1 :     if (!emit1(JSOP_NOP))
    7414             :         return false;
    7415           1 :     ptrdiff_t tmp = offset();
    7416             : 
    7417             :     JumpList jmp;
    7418           1 :     if (forHead->pn_kid2) {
    7419             :         /* Goto the loop condition, which branches back to iterate. */
    7420           1 :         if (!emitJump(JSOP_GOTO, &jmp))
    7421             :             return false;
    7422             :     }
    7423             : 
    7424             :     /* Emit code for the loop body. */
    7425           1 :     JumpTarget top{ -1 };
    7426           1 :     if (!emitLoopHead(forBody, &top))
    7427             :         return false;
    7428           1 :     if (jmp.offset == -1 && !emitLoopEntry(forBody, jmp))
    7429             :         return false;
    7430             : 
    7431           1 :     if (!emitTreeInBranch(forBody))
    7432             :         return false;
    7433             : 
    7434             :     // Set loop and enclosing "update" offsets, for continue.  Note that we
    7435             :     // continue to immediately *before* the block-freshening: continuing must
    7436             :     // refresh the block.
    7437           1 :     if (!emitJumpTarget(&loopInfo.continueTarget))
    7438             :         return false;
    7439             : 
    7440             :     // ES 13.7.4.8 step 3.e. The per-iteration freshening.
    7441           1 :     if (forLoopRequiresFreshening) {
    7442             :         MOZ_ASSERT(headLexicalEmitterScope == innermostEmitterScope);
    7443             :         MOZ_ASSERT(headLexicalEmitterScope->scope(this)->kind() == ScopeKind::Lexical);
    7444             : 
    7445           1 :         if (headLexicalEmitterScope->hasEnvironment()) {
    7446           1 :             if (!emit1(JSOP_FRESHENLEXICALENV))
    7447             :                 return false;
    7448             :         }
    7449             :     }
    7450             : 
    7451             :     // Check for update code to do before the condition (if any).
    7452             :     // The update code may not be executed at all; it needs its own TDZ cache.
    7453           1 :     if (ParseNode* update = forHead->pn_kid3) {
    7454             :         TDZCheckCache tdzCache(this);
    7455             : 
    7456           1 :         if (!updateSourceCoordNotes(update->pn_pos.begin))
    7457           0 :             return false;
    7458           1 :         if (!emitTree(update, ValueUsage::IgnoreValue))
    7459             :             return false;
    7460           1 :         if (!emit1(JSOP_POP))
    7461             :             return false;
    7462             : 
    7463             :         /* Restore the absolute line number for source note readers. */
    7464           1 :         uint32_t lineNum = parser->tokenStream.srcCoords.lineNum(pn->pn_pos.end);
    7465           1 :         if (currentLine() != lineNum) {
    7466           1 :             if (!newSrcNote2(SRC_SETLINE, ptrdiff_t(lineNum)))
    7467             :                 return false;
    7468           1 :             current->currentLine = lineNum;
    7469           1 :             current->lastColumn = 0;
    7470           1 :         }
    7471             :     }
    7472             : 
    7473           1 :     ptrdiff_t tmp3 = offset();
    7474             : 
    7475           1 :     if (forHead->pn_kid2) {
    7476             :         /* Fix up the goto from top to target the loop condition. */
    7477             :         MOZ_ASSERT(jmp.offset >= 0);
    7478           1 :         if (!emitLoopEntry(forHead->pn_kid2, jmp))
    7479             :             return false;
    7480             : 
    7481           1 :         if (!emitTree(forHead->pn_kid2))
    7482             :             return false;
    7483           1 :     } else if (!forHead->pn_kid3) {
    7484             :         // If there is no condition clause and no update clause, mark
    7485             :         // the loop-ending "goto" with the location of the "for".
    7486             :         // This ensures that the debugger will stop on each loop
    7487             :         // iteration.
    7488           1 :         if (!updateSourceCoordNotes(pn->pn_pos.begin))
    7489             :             return false;
    7490             :     }
    7491             : 
    7492             :     /* Set the first note offset so we can find the loop condition. */
    7493           1 :     if (!setSrcNoteOffset(noteIndex, 0, tmp3 - tmp))
    7494             :         return false;
    7495           1 :     if (!setSrcNoteOffset(noteIndex, 1, loopInfo.continueTarget.offset - tmp))
    7496             :         return false;
    7497             : 
    7498             :     /* If no loop condition, just emit a loop-closing jump. */
    7499             :     JumpList beq;
    7500           1 :     JumpTarget breakTarget{ -1 };
    7501           1 :     if (!emitBackwardJump(forHead->pn_kid2 ? JSOP_IFNE : JSOP_GOTO, top, &beq, &breakTarget))
    7502             :         return false;
    7503             : 
    7504             :     /* The third note offset helps us find the loop-closing jump. */
    7505           1 :     if (!setSrcNoteOffset(noteIndex, 2, beq.offset - tmp))
    7506             :         return false;
    7507             : 
    7508           1 :     if (!tryNoteList.append(JSTRY_LOOP, stackDepth, top.offset, breakTarget.offset))
    7509             :         return false;
    7510             : 
    7511           1 :     if (!loopInfo.patchBreaksAndContinues(this))
    7512             :         return false;
    7513             : 
    7514           1 :     return true;
    7515             : }
    7516             : 
    7517             : bool
    7518           1 : BytecodeEmitter::emitFor(ParseNode* pn, EmitterScope* headLexicalEmitterScope)

    7535             : bool
    7536           0 : BytecodeEmitter::emitComprehensionForInOrOfVariables(ParseNode* pn, bool* lexicalScope)
    7537             : {
    7538             :     // ES6 specifies that lexical for-loop variables get a fresh binding each
    7539             :     // iteration, and that evaluation of the expression looped over occurs with
    7540             :     // these variables dead zoned.  But these rules only apply to *standard*
    7541             :     // for-in/of loops, and we haven't extended these requirements to
    7542             :     // comprehension syntax.
    7543             : 
    7544           1 :     *lexicalScope = pn->isKind(PNK_LEXICALSCOPE);
    7545           1 :     if (*lexicalScope) {
    7546             :         // This is initially-ES7-tracked syntax, now with considerably murkier
    7547             :         // outlook. The scope work is done by the caller by instantiating an
    7548             :         // EmitterScope. There's nothing to do here.
    7549             :     } else {
    7550             :         // This is legacy comprehension syntax.  We'll have PNK_LET here, using
    7551             :         // a lexical scope provided by/for the entire comprehension.  Name
    7552             :         // analysis assumes declarations initialize lets, but as we're handling
    7553             :         // this declaration manually, we must also initialize manually to avoid
    7554             :         // triggering dead zone checks.
    7555             :         MOZ_ASSERT(pn->isKind(PNK_LET));
    7556             :         MOZ_ASSERT(pn->pn_count == 1);
    7557             : 
    7558           0 :         if (!emitDeclarationList(pn))
    7559             :             return false;
    7560             :     }
    7561             : 
    7562             :     return true;
    7563             : }
    7564             : 
    7565             : bool
    7566           1 : BytecodeEmitter::emitComprehensionForOf(ParseNode* pn)
    7567             : {
    7568             :     MOZ_ASSERT(pn->isKind(PNK_COMPREHENSIONFOR));
    7569             : 
    7570           1 :     ParseNode* forHead = pn->pn_left;
    7571             :     MOZ_ASSERT(forHead->isKind(PNK_FOROF));
    7572             : 
    7573           1 :     ParseNode* forHeadExpr = forHead->pn_kid3;
    7574           1 :     ParseNode* forBody = pn->pn_right;
    7575             : 
    7576           1 :     ParseNode* loopDecl = forHead->pn_kid1;
    7577           1 :     bool lexicalScope = false;
    7578           1 :     if (!emitComprehensionForInOrOfVariables(loopDecl, &lexicalScope))
    7579             :         return false;
    7580             : 
    7581             :     // For-of loops run with two values on the stack: the iterator and the
    7582             :     // current result object.
    7583             : 
    7584             :     // Evaluate the expression to the right of 'of'.
    7585           1 :     if (!emitTree(forHeadExpr))                // EXPR
    7586             :         return false;
    7587           1 :     if (!emitIterator())                       // ITER
    7588             :         return false;
    7589             : 
    7590             :     // Push a dummy result so that we properly enter iteration midstream.
    7591           1 :     if (!emit1(JSOP_UNDEFINED))                // ITER VALUE
    7592             :         return false;
    7593             : 
    7594             :     // Enter the block before the loop body, after evaluating the obj.
    7595             :     // Initialize let bindings with undefined when entering, as the name
    7596             :     // assigned to is a plain assignment.
    7597             :     TDZCheckCache tdzCache(this);
    7598             :     Maybe<EmitterScope> emitterScope;
    7599             :     ParseNode* loopVariableName;
    7600           1 :     if (lexicalScope) {
    7601           1 :         loopVariableName = parser->handler.singleBindingFromDeclaration(loopDecl->pn_expr);
    7602           1 :         emitterScope.emplace(this);
    7603           1 :         if (!emitterScope->enterComprehensionFor(this, loopDecl->scopeBindings()))
    7604             :             return false;
    7605             :     } else {
    7606           0 :         loopVariableName = parser->handler.singleBindingFromDeclaration(loopDecl);
    7607             :     }
    7608             : 
    7609           1 :     LoopControl loopInfo(this, StatementKind::ForOfLoop);
    7610             : 
    7611             :     // Jump down to the loop condition to minimize overhead assuming at least
    7612             :     // one iteration, as the other loop forms do.  Annotate so IonMonkey can
    7613             :     // find the loop-closing jump.
    7614             :     unsigned noteIndex;
    7615           1 :     if (!newSrcNote(SRC_FOR_OF, &noteIndex))
    7616             :         return false;
    7617             :     JumpList jmp;
    7618           1 :     if (!emitJump(JSOP_GOTO, &jmp))
    7619             :         return false;
    7620             : 
    7621           1 :     JumpTarget top{ -1 };
    7622           1 :     if (!emitLoopHead(nullptr, &top))
    7623             :         return false;
    7624             : 
    7625             : #ifdef DEBUG
    7626             :     int loopDepth = this->stackDepth;
    7627             : #endif
    7628             : 
    7629           1 :     if (!emit1(JSOP_POP))                                 // ITER
    7630             :         return false;
    7631           1 :     if (!emit1(JSOP_DUP))                                 // ITER ITER
    7632             :         return false;
    7633           1 :     if (!emitIteratorNext(forHead))                       // ITER RESULT
    7634             :         return false;
    7635           1 :     if (!emit1(JSOP_DUP))                                 // ITER RESULT RESULT
    7636             :         return false;
    7637           1 :     if (!emitAtomOp(cx->names().done, JSOP_GETPROP))      // ITER RESULT DONE
    7638             :         return false;
    7639             : 
    7640             :     IfThenElseEmitter ifDone(this);
    7641             : 
    7642           1 :     if (!ifDone.emitIf())                                 // ITER RESULT
    7643             :         return false;
    7644             : 
    7645             :     // Remove RESULT from the stack to release it.
    7646           1 :     if (!emit1(JSOP_POP))                                 // ITER
    7647             :         return false;
    7648           1 :     if (!emit1(JSOP_UNDEFINED))                           // ITER UNDEF
    7649             :         return false;
    7650             : 
    7651             :     // If the iteration is done, leave loop here, instead of the branch at
    7652             :     // the end of the loop.
    7653           1 :     if (!loopInfo.emitSpecialBreakForDone(this))          // ITER UNDEF
    7654             :         return false;
    7655             : 
    7656           1 :     if (!ifDone.emitEnd())                                // ITER RESULT
    7657             :         return false;
    7658             : 
    7659             :     // Emit code to assign result.value to the iteration variable.
    7660           1 :     if (!emitAtomOp(cx->names().value, JSOP_GETPROP))     // ITER VALUE
    7661             :         return false;

    7663             :     // Notice: Comprehension for-of doesn't perform IteratorClose, since it's
    7664             :     // not in the spec.
    7665           1 :     if (!emitAssignment(loopVariableName, JSOP_NOP, nullptr)) // ITER VALUE
    7666             :         return false;
    7667             : 
    7668             :     // Remove VALUE from the stack to release it.
    7669           1 :     if (!emit1(JSOP_POP))                                 // ITER
    7670             :         return false;
    7671           1 :     if (!emit1(JSOP_UNDEFINED))                           // ITER UNDEF
    7672             :         return false;
    7673             : 
    7674             :     // The stack should be balanced around the assignment opcode sequence.
    7675             :     MOZ_ASSERT(this->stackDepth == loopDepth);
    7676             : 
    7677             :     // Emit code for the loop body.
    7678           1 :     if (!emitTree(forBody))                               // ITER UNDEF
    7679             :         return false;
    7680             : 
    7681             :     // The stack should be balanced around the assignment opcode sequence.
    7682             :     MOZ_ASSERT(this->stackDepth == loopDepth);
    7683             : 
    7684             :     // Set offset for continues.
    7685           1 :     loopInfo.continueTarget = { offset() };
    7686             : 
    7687           1 :     if (!emitLoopEntry(forHeadExpr, jmp))
    7688             :         return false;
    7689             : 
    7690           1 :     if (!emit1(JSOP_FALSE))                               // ITER VALUE FALSE
    7691             :         return false;
    7692             : 
    7693             :     JumpList beq;
    7694           1 :     JumpTarget breakTarget{ -1 };
    7695           1 :     if (!emitBackwardJump(JSOP_IFEQ, top, &beq, &breakTarget))
    7696             :         return false;                                     // ITER VALUE
    7697             : 
    7698             :     MOZ_ASSERT(this->stackDepth == loopDepth);
    7699             : 
    7700             :     // Let Ion know where the closing jump of this loop is.
    7701           1 :     if (!setSrcNoteOffset(noteIndex, 0, beq.offset - jmp.offset))
    7702             :         return false;
    7703             : 
    7704           1 :     if (!loopInfo.patchBreaksAndContinues(this))
    7705             :         return false;
    7706             : 
    7707           1 :     if (!tryNoteList.append(JSTRY_FOR_OF, stackDepth, top.offset, breakTarget.offset))
    7708             :         return false;
    7709             : 
    7710           1 :     if (emitterScope) {
    7711           1 :         if (!emitterScope->leave(this))
    7712             :             return false;
    7713             :         emitterScope.reset();
    7714             :     }
    7715             : 
    7716             :     // Pop the result and the iter.
    7717           1 :     return emitPopN(2);                                   //
    7718             : }
    7719             : 
    7720             : bool
    7721           0 : BytecodeEmitter::emitComprehensionForIn(ParseNode* pn)
    7722             : {
    7723             :     MOZ_ASSERT(pn->isKind(PNK_COMPREHENSIONFOR));
    7724             : 
    7725           0 :     ParseNode* forHead = pn->pn_left;
    7726             :     MOZ_ASSERT(forHead->isKind(PNK_FORIN));
    7727             : 
    7728           0 :     ParseNode* forBody = pn->pn_right;
    7729             : 
    7730           0 :     ParseNode* loopDecl = forHead->pn_kid1;

    8100             : bool
    8101           1 : BytecodeEmitter::emitAsyncWrapper(unsigned index, bool needsHomeObject, bool isArrow,
    8102             :                                   bool isStarGenerator)
    8103             : {
    8104             :     // needsHomeObject can be true for propertyList for extended class.
    8105             :     // In that case push both unwrapped and wrapped function, in order to
    8106             :     // initialize home object of unwrapped function, and set wrapped function
    8107             :     // as a property.
    8108             :     //
    8109             :     //   lambda       // unwrapped
    8110             :     //   dup          // unwrapped unwrapped
    8111             :     //   toasync      // unwrapped wrapped
    8112             :     //
    8113             :     // Emitted code is surrounded by the following code.
    8114             :     //
    8115             :     //                    // classObj classCtor classProto
    8116             :     //   (emitted code)   // classObj classCtor classProto unwrapped wrapped
    8117             :     //   swap             // classObj classCtor classProto wrapped unwrapped
    8118             :     //   inithomeobject 1 // classObj classCtor classProto wrapped unwrapped
    8119             :     //                    //   initialize the home object of unwrapped
    8120             :     //                    //   with classProto here
    8121             :     //   pop              // classObj classCtor classProto wrapped
    8122             :     //   inithiddenprop   // classObj classCtor classProto wrapped
    8123             :     //                    //   initialize the property of the classProto
    8124             :     //                    //   with wrapped function here
    8125             :     //   pop              // classObj classCtor classProto
    8126             :     //
    8127             :     // needsHomeObject is false for other cases, push wrapped function only.
    8128           1 :     if (!emitAsyncWrapperLambda(index, isArrow))
    8129             :         return false;
    8130           1 :     if (needsHomeObject) {
    8131           1 :         if (!emit1(JSOP_DUP))
    8132             :             return false;
    8133             :     }
    8134           1 :     if (isStarGenerator) {
    8135           0 :         if (!emit1(JSOP_TOASYNCGEN))
    8136             :             return false;
    8137             :     } else {
    8138           1 :         if (!emit1(JSOP_TOASYNC))
    8139             :             return false;
    8140             :     }
    8141             :     return true;
    8142             : }
    8143             : 
    8144             : bool
    8145           1 : BytecodeEmitter::emitDo(ParseNode* pn)
    8146             : {
    8147             :     /* Emit an annotated nop so IonBuilder can recognize the 'do' loop. */
    8148             :     unsigned noteIndex;
    8149           1 :     if (!newSrcNote(SRC_WHILE, &noteIndex))
    8150             :         return false;
    8151           1 :     if (!emit1(JSOP_NOP))
    8152             :         return false;
    8153             : 
    8154             :     unsigned noteIndex2;
    8155           1 :     if (!newSrcNote(SRC_WHILE, &noteIndex2))
    8156             :         return false;
    8157             : 
    8158             :     /* Compile the loop body. */
    8159             :     JumpTarget top;
    8160           1 :     if (!emitLoopHead(pn->pn_left, &top))
    8161             :         return false;
    8162             : 
    8163           1 :     LoopControl loopInfo(this, StatementKind::DoLoop);
    8164             : 
    8165             :     JumpList empty;
    8166           1 :     if (!emitLoopEntry(nullptr, empty))
    8167             :         return false;
    8168             : 
    8169           1 :     if (!emitTree(pn->pn_left))
    8170             :         return false;
    8171             : 
    8172             :     // Set the offset for continues.
    8173           1 :     if (!emitJumpTarget(&loopInfo.continueTarget))
    8174             :         return false;
    8175             : 
    8176             :     /* Compile the loop condition, now that continues know where to go. */
    8177           1 :     if (!emitTree(pn->pn_right))
    8178             :         return false;
    8179             : 
    8180             :     JumpList beq;
    8181           1 :     JumpTarget breakTarget{ -1 };
    8182           1 :     if (!emitBackwardJump(JSOP_IFNE, top, &beq, &breakTarget))
    8183             :         return false;
    8184             : 
    8185           1 :     if (!tryNoteList.append(JSTRY_LOOP, stackDepth, top.offset, breakTarget.offset))
    8186             :         return false;
    8187             : 
    8188             :     /*
    8189             :      * Update the annotations with the update and back edge positions, for
    8190             :      * IonBuilder.
    8191             :      *
    8192             :      * Be careful: We must set noteIndex2 before noteIndex in case the noteIndex
    8193             :      * note gets bigger.
    8194             :      */
    8195           1 :     if (!setSrcNoteOffset(noteIndex2, 0, beq.offset - top.offset))
    8196             :         return false;
    8197           1 :     if (!setSrcNoteOffset(noteIndex, 0, 1 + (loopInfo.continueTarget.offset - top.offset)))
    8198             :         return false;
    8199             : 
    8200           1 :     if (!loopInfo.patchBreaksAndContinues(this))
    8201             :         return false;
    8202             : 
    8203           1 :     return true;
    8204             : }
    8205             : 
    8206             : bool
    8207           1 : BytecodeEmitter::emitWhile(ParseNode* pn)
    8208             : {
    8209             :     /*
    8210             :      * Minimize bytecodes issued for one or more iterations by jumping to
    8211             :      * the condition below the body and closing the loop if the condition
    8212             :      * is true with a backward branch. For iteration count i:
    8213             :      *
    8214             :      *  i    test at the top                 test at the bottom
    8215             :      *  =    ===============                 ==================
    8216             :      *  0    ifeq-pass                       goto; ifne-fail
    8217             :      *  1    ifeq-fail; goto; ifne-pass      goto; ifne-pass; ifne-fail
    8218             :      *  2    2*(ifeq-fail; goto); ifeq-pass  goto; 2*ifne-pass; ifne-fail
    8219             :      *  . . .
    8220             :      *  N    N*(ifeq-fail; goto); ifeq-pass  goto; N*ifne-pass; ifne-fail
    8221             :      */
    8222             : 
    8223             :     // If we have a single-line while, like "while (x) ;", we want to
    8224             :     // emit the line note before the initial goto, so that the
    8225             :     // debugger sees a single entry point.  This way, if there is a
    8226             :     // breakpoint on the line, it will only fire once; and "next"ing
    8227             :     // will skip the whole loop.  However, for the multi-line case we
    8228             :     // want to emit the line note after the initial goto, so that
    8229             :     // "cont" stops on each iteration -- but without a stop before the
    8230             :     // first iteration.
    8231           1 :     if (parser->tokenStream.srcCoords.lineNum(pn->pn_pos.begin) ==
    8232           1 :         parser->tokenStream.srcCoords.lineNum(pn->pn_pos.end) &&
    8233           1 :         !updateSourceCoordNotes(pn->pn_pos.begin))
    8234             :         return false;
    8235             : 
    8236           1 :     JumpTarget top{ -1 };
    8237           1 :     if (!emitJumpTarget(&top))
    8238             :         return false;
    8239             : 
    8240           1 :     LoopControl loopInfo(this, StatementKind::WhileLoop);
    8241           1 :     loopInfo.continueTarget = top;
    8242             : 
    8243             :     unsigned noteIndex;
    8244           1 :     if (!newSrcNote(SRC_WHILE, &noteIndex))
    8245             :         return false;
    8246             : 
    8247             :     JumpList jmp;
    8248           1 :     if (!emitJump(JSOP_GOTO, &jmp))
    8249             :         return false;
    8250             : 
    8251           1 :     if (!emitLoopHead(pn->pn_right, &top))
    8252             :         return false;
    8253             : 
    8254           1 :     if (!emitTreeInBranch(pn->pn_right))
    8255             :         return false;
    8256             : 
    8257           1 :     if (!emitLoopEntry(pn->pn_left, jmp))
    8258             :         return false;
    8259           1 :     if (!emitTree(pn->pn_left))
    8260             :         return false;
    8261             : 
    8262             :     JumpList beq;
    8263           1 :     JumpTarget breakTarget{ -1 };
    8264           1 :     if (!emitBackwardJump(JSOP_IFNE, top, &beq, &breakTarget))
    8265             :         return false;
    8266             : 
    8267           1 :     if (!tryNoteList.append(JSTRY_LOOP, stackDepth, top.offset, breakTarget.offset))
    8268             :         return false;
    8269             : 
    8270           1 :     if (!setSrcNoteOffset(noteIndex, 0, beq.offset - jmp.offset))
    8271             :         return false;
    8272             : 
    8273           1 :     if (!loopInfo.patchBreaksAndContinues(this))
    8274             :         return false;
    8275             : 
    8276           1 :     return true;
    8277             : }
    8278             : 
    8279             : bool
    8280           1 : BytecodeEmitter::emitBreak(PropertyName* label)
    8281             : {
    8282             :     BreakableControl* target;
    8283             :     SrcNoteType noteType;
    8284           1 :     if (label) {
    8285             :         // Any statement with the matching label may be the break target.
    8286             :         auto hasSameLabel = [label](LabelControl* labelControl) {
    8287           1 :             return labelControl->label() == label;
    8288           1 :         };
    8289           1 :         target = findInnermostNestableControl<LabelControl>(hasSameLabel);
    8290           1 :         noteType = SRC_BREAK2LABEL;
    8291             :     } else {
    8292             :         auto isNotLabel = [](BreakableControl* control) {
    8293           1 :             return !control->is<LabelControl>();
    8294             :         };
    8295           1 :         target = findInnermostNestableControl<BreakableControl>(isNotLabel);
    8296           1 :         noteType = (target->kind() == StatementKind::Switch) ? SRC_SWITCHBREAK : SRC_BREAK;
    8297             :     }
    8298             : 
    8299           1 :     return emitGoto(target, &target->breaks, noteType);
    8300             : }
    8301             : 
    8302             : bool
    8303           1 : BytecodeEmitter::emitContinue(PropertyName* label)
    8304             : {
    8305           1 :     LoopControl* target = nullptr;
    8306           1 :     if (label) {
    8307             :         // Find the loop statement enclosed by the matching label.
    8308           1 :         NestableControl* control = innermostNestableControl;
    8309           1 :         while (!control->is<LabelControl>() || control->as<LabelControl>().label() != label) {
    8310           1 :             if (control->is<LoopControl>())
    8311           1 :                 target = &control->as<LoopControl>();
    8312           1 :             control = control->enclosing();
    8313             :         }
    8314             :     } else {
    8315           1 :         target = findInnermostNestableControl<LoopControl>();
    8316             :     }
    8317           1 :     return emitGoto(target, &target->continues, SRC_CONTINUE);
    8318             : }
    8319             : 
    8320             : bool

    8368             : bool
    8369           1 : BytecodeEmitter::emitReturn(ParseNode* pn)
    8370             : {
    8371           1 :     if (!updateSourceCoordNotes(pn->pn_pos.begin))
    8372             :         return false;
    8373             : 
    8374           1 :     bool needsIteratorResult = sc->isFunctionBox() && sc->asFunctionBox()->needsIteratorResult();
    8375           1 :     if (needsIteratorResult) {
    8376           1 :         if (!emitPrepareIteratorResult())
    8377             :             return false;
    8378             :     }
    8379             : 
    8380             :     /* Push a return value */
    8381           1 :     if (ParseNode* pn2 = pn->pn_kid) {
    8382           1 :         if (!emitTree(pn2))
    8383             :             return false;
    8384             :     } else {
    8385             :         /* No explicit return value provided */
    8386           1 :         if (!emit1(JSOP_UNDEFINED))
    8387             :             return false;
    8388             :     }
    8389             : 
    8390           1 :     if (needsIteratorResult) {
    8391           1 :         if (!emitFinishIteratorResult(true))
    8392             :             return false;
    8393             :     }
    8394             : 
    8395             :     // We know functionBodyEndPos is set because "return" is only
    8396             :     // valid in a function, and so we've passed through
    8397             :     // emitFunctionScript.
    8398             :     MOZ_ASSERT(functionBodyEndPosSet);
    8399           1 :     if (!updateSourceCoordNotes(functionBodyEndPos))
    8400             :         return false;
    8401             : 
    8402             :     /*
    8403             :      * EmitNonLocalJumpFixup may add fixup bytecode to close open try
    8404             :      * blocks having finally clauses and to exit intermingled let blocks.
    8405             :      * We can't simply transfer control flow to our caller in that case,
    8406             :      * because we must gosub to those finally clauses from inner to outer,
    8407             :      * with the correct stack pointer (i.e., after popping any with,
    8408             :      * for/in, etc., slots nested inside the finally's try).
    8409             :      *
    8410             :      * In this case we mutate JSOP_RETURN into JSOP_SETRVAL and add an
    8411             :      * extra JSOP_RETRVAL after the fixups.
    8412             :      */
    8413           1 :     ptrdiff_t top = offset();
    8414             : 
    8415           1 :     bool needsFinalYield = sc->isFunctionBox() && sc->asFunctionBox()->needsFinalYield();
    8416             :     bool isDerivedClassConstructor =
    8417           1 :         sc->isFunctionBox() && sc->asFunctionBox()->isDerivedClassConstructor();
    8418             : 
    8419           1 :     if (!emit1((needsFinalYield || isDerivedClassConstructor) ? JSOP_SETRVAL : JSOP_RETURN))
    8420             :         return false;
    8421             : 
    8422             :     // Make sure that we emit this before popping the blocks in prepareForNonLocalJump,
    8423             :     // to ensure that the error is thrown while the scope-chain is still intact.
    8424           1 :     if (isDerivedClassConstructor) {
    8425           1 :         if (!emitCheckDerivedClassConstructorReturn())
    8426             :             return false;
    8427             :     }
    8428             : 
    8429             :     NonLocalExitControl nle(this, NonLocalExitControl::Return);
    8430             : 
    8431           1 :     if (!nle.prepareForNonLocalJumpToOutermost())
    8432             :         return false;
    8433             : 
    8434           1 :     if (needsFinalYield) {
    8435             :         // We know that .generator is on the function scope, as we just exited
    8436             :         // all nested scopes.
    8437             :         NameLocation loc =
    8438           1 :             *locationOfNameBoundInFunctionScope(cx->names().dotGenerator, varEmitterScope);
    8439           1 :         if (!emitGetNameAtLocation(cx->names().dotGenerator, loc))
    8440           0 :             return false;
    8441           1 :         if (!emitYieldOp(JSOP_FINALYIELDRVAL))
    8442             :             return false;
    8443           1 :     } else if (isDerivedClassConstructor) {
    8444             :         MOZ_ASSERT(code()[top] == JSOP_SETRVAL);
    8445           1 :         if (!emit1(JSOP_RETRVAL))
    8446             :             return false;
    8447           1 :     } else if (top + static_cast<ptrdiff_t>(JSOP_RETURN_LENGTH) != offset()) {
    8448           1 :         code()[top] = JSOP_SETRVAL;
    8449           1 :         if (!emit1(JSOP_RETRVAL))
    8450             :             return false;
    8451             :     }
    8452             : 
    8453           1 :     return true;

    8532           1 : BytecodeEmitter::emitYieldStar(ParseNode* iter)
    8533             : {
    8534             :     MOZ_ASSERT(sc->isFunctionBox());
    8535             :     MOZ_ASSERT(sc->asFunctionBox()->isStarGenerator());
    8536             :

    8540             :         return false;

    8542           0 :         if (!emitAsyncIterator())                         // ITER
    8543             :             return false;
    8544             :     } else {
    8545           1 :         if (!emitIterator())                              // ITER
    8546             :             return false;
    8547             :     }
    8548             : 
    8549             :     // Initial send value is undefined.
    8550           1 :     if (!emit1(JSOP_UNDEFINED))                           // ITER RECEIVED
    8551             :         return false;

    8558             :                         TryEmitter::DontUseControl);

    8560             :         return false;

    8564             :         return false;

    8570             :         return false;

    8593             :         return false;

    8597             :         return false;

    8600             :         return false;

    8604             :     // and then throws a TypeError.

    8615           1 :     if (!emit1(JSOP_SWAP))                                // ITER OLDRESULT EXCEPTION THROW ITER
    8616             :         return false;

    8618             :         return false;

    8625             :             return false;
    8626             :     }
    8627             :

    8629             :         return false;

    8631             :         return false;
    8632           1 :     if (!emit1(JSOP_POP))                                 // ITER RESULT
    8633             :         return false;
    8634             :     MOZ_ASSERT(this->stackDepth == startDepth);
    8635             :     JumpList checkResult;
    8636             :     // ES 14.4.13, YieldExpression : yield * AssignmentExpression, step 5.b.ii.
    8637             :     //
    8638             :     // Note that there is no GOSUB to the finally block here. If the iterator has a
    8639             :     // "throw" method, it does not perform IteratorClose.

    8641             :         return false;
    8642             : 
    8643           1 :     if (!tryCatch.emitFinally())
    8644             :          return false;
    8645             : 
    8646             :     // ES 14.4.13, yield * AssignmentExpression, step 5.c
    8647             :     //
    8648             :     // Call iterator.return() for receiving a "forced return" completion from
    8649             :     // the generator.
    8650             : 
    8651             :     IfThenElseEmitter ifGeneratorClosing(this);

    8653             :         return false;

    8655             :         return false;
    8656             : 
    8657             :     // Step ii.
    8658             :     //

    8660           1 :     if (!emitDupAt(3))                                    // ITER RESULT FTYPE FVALUE ITER

    8663             :         return false;

    8665             :         return false;
    8666             : 
    8667             :     // Step iii.
    8668             :     //
    8669             :     // Do nothing if "return" is undefined.
    8670             :     IfThenElseEmitter ifReturnMethodIsDefined(this);
    8671           1 :     if (!emit1(JSOP_DUP))                                 // ITER RESULT FTYPE FVALUE ITER RET RET
    8672             :         return false;
    8673           1 :     if (!emit1(JSOP_UNDEFINED))                           // ITER RESULT FTYPE FVALUE ITER RET RET UNDEFINED
    8674             :         return false;
    8675           1 :     if (!emit1(JSOP_NE))                                  // ITER RESULT FTYPE FVALUE ITER RET ?NEQL
    8676             :         return false;
    8677             : 
    8678             :     // Step iv.
    8679             :     //
    8680             :     // Call "return" with the argument passed to Generator.prototype.return,
    8681             :     // which is currently in rval.value.

    8683             :         return false;

    8685             :         return false;

    8691             :         return false;

    8693             : 
    8694           1 :     if (iterKind == IteratorKind::Async) {
    8695           0 :         if (!emitAwait())                                 // ... FTYPE FVALUE RESULT
    8696             :             return false;
    8697             :     }
    8698             : 
    8699             :     // Step v.
    8700           1 :     if (!emitCheckIsObj(CheckIsObjectKind::IteratorReturn)) // ITER OLDRESULT FTYPE FVALUE RESULT
    8701             :         return false;
    8702             : 
    8703             :     // Steps vi-viii.
    8704             :     //
    8705             :     // Check if the returned object from iterator.return() is done. If not,
    8706             :     // continuing yielding.
    8707             :     IfThenElseEmitter ifReturnDone(this);

    8709             :         return false;

    8711             :         return false;

    8713             :         return false;
    8714           1 :     if (!emitAtomOp(cx->names().value, JSOP_GETPROP))     // ITER OLDRESULT FTYPE FVALUE VALUE
    8715             :         return false;
    8716             : 
    8717           1 :     if (isAsyncGenerator) {
    8718           0 :         if (!emitAwait())                                 // ITER OLDRESULT FTYPE FVALUE VALUE
    8719             :             return false;
    8720             :     }
    8721             : 
    8722           1 :     if (!emitPrepareIteratorResult())                     // ITER OLDRESULT FTYPE FVALUE VALUE RESULT
    8723             :         return false;

    8846             :      * Top-level or called-from-a-native JS_Execute/EvaluateScript,
    8847             :      * debugger, and eval frames may need the value of the ultimate
    8848             :      * expression statement as the script's result, despite the fact
    8849             :      * that it appears useless to the compiler.
    8850             :      *

    9024             : bool
    9025           1 : BytecodeEmitter::emitSelfHostedCallFunction(ParseNode* pn)
    9026             : {
    9027             :     // Special-casing of callFunction to emit bytecode that directly
    9028             :     // invokes the callee with the correct |this| object and arguments.
    9029             :     // callFunction(fun, thisArg, arg0, arg1) thus becomes:
    9030             :     // - emit lookup for fun
    9031             :     // - emit lookup for thisArg
    9032             :     // - emit lookups for arg0, arg1
    9033             :     //
    9034             :     // argc is set to the amount of actually emitted args and the
    9035             :     // emitting of args below is disabled by setting emitArgs to false.
    9036           1 :     ParseNode* pn2 = pn->pn_head;
    9037           1 :     const char* errorName = SelfHostedCallFunctionName(pn2->name(), cx);
    9038             : 
    9039           1 :     if (pn->pn_count < 3) {
    9040           0 :         reportError(pn, JSMSG_MORE_ARGS_NEEDED, errorName, "2", "s");
    9041           0 :         return false;
    9042             :     }
    9043             : 
    9044           1 :     JSOp callOp = pn->getOp();
    9045           1 :     if (callOp != JSOP_CALL) {
    9046           0 :         reportError(pn, JSMSG_NOT_CONSTRUCTOR, errorName);
    9047           0 :         return false;
    9048             :     }
    9049             : 
    9050           1 :     bool constructing = pn2->name() == cx->names().constructContentFunction;
    9051           1 :     ParseNode* funNode = pn2->pn_next;
    9052           1 :     if (constructing)
    9053             :         callOp = JSOP_NEW;
    9054           1 :     else if (funNode->getKind() == PNK_NAME && funNode->name() == cx->names().std_Function_apply)
    9055           1 :         callOp = JSOP_FUNAPPLY;
    9056             : 
    9057           1 :     if (!emitTree(funNode))
    9058             :         return false;
    9059             : 
    9060             : #ifdef DEBUG
    9061             :     if (emitterMode == BytecodeEmitter::SelfHosting &&
    9062             :         pn2->name() == cx->names().callFunction)
    9063             :     {
    9064             :         if (!emit1(JSOP_DEBUGCHECKSELFHOSTED))
    9065             :             return false;
    9066             :     }
    9067             : #endif
    9068             : 
    9069           1 :     ParseNode* thisOrNewTarget = funNode->pn_next;
    9070           1 :     if (constructing) {
    9071             :         // Save off the new.target value, but here emit a proper |this| for a
    9072             :         // constructing call.
    9073           1 :         if (!emit1(JSOP_IS_CONSTRUCTING))
    9074             :             return false;
    9075             :     } else {
    9076             :         // It's |this|, emit it.
    9077           1 :         if (!emitTree(thisOrNewTarget))
    9078             :             return false;
    9079             :     }

    9083             :             return false;
    9084             :     }

    9087           1 :         if (!emitTree(thisOrNewTarget))
    9088             :             return false;
    9089             :     }

    9199           1 : BytecodeEmitter::isRestParameter(ParseNode* pn)
    9200             : {

    9202             :         return false;
    9203             : 
    9204           1 :     FunctionBox* funbox = sc->asFunctionBox();
    9205           1 :     RootedFunction fun(cx, funbox->function());
    9206           1 :     if (!funbox->hasRest())
    9207             :         return false;
    9208             : 
    9209           1 :     if (!pn->isKind(PNK_NAME)) {
    9210           1 :         if (emitterMode == BytecodeEmitter::SelfHosting && pn->isKind(PNK_CALL)) {
    9211           1 :             ParseNode* pn2 = pn->pn_head;

    9213           1 :                 return isRestParameter(pn2->pn_next);

    9216             :     }

    9222           1 :         if (bindings->nonPositionalFormalStart > 0) {
    9223             :             // |paramName| can be nullptr when the rest destructuring syntax is
    9224             :             // used: `function f(...[]) {}`.
    9225           1 :             JSAtom* paramName = bindings->names[bindings->nonPositionalFormalStart - 1].name();
    9226           1 :             return paramName && name == paramName;
    9227             :         }
    9228             :     }
    9229             : 
    9230             :     return false;
    9231             : }
    9232             : 
    9233             : bool
    9234           1 : BytecodeEmitter::emitOptimizeSpread(ParseNode* arg0, JumpList* jmp, bool* emitted)
    9235             : {
    9236             :     // Emit a pereparation code to optimize the spread call with a rest
    9237             :     // parameter:
    9238             :     //
    9239             :     //   function f(...args) {
    9240             :     //     g(...args);
    9241             :     //   }
    9242             :     //
    9243             :     // If the spread operand is a rest parameter and it's optimizable array,
    9244             :     // skip spread operation and pass it directly to spread call operation.
    9245             :     // See the comment in OptimizeSpreadCall in Interpreter.cpp for the
    9246             :     // optimizable conditons.
    9247           1 :     if (!isRestParameter(arg0)) {
    9248           1 :         *emitted = false;
    9249           1 :         return true;
    9250             :     }

    9253             :         return false;

    9268             : bool
    9269           1 : BytecodeEmitter::emitCallOrNew(ParseNode* pn, ValueUsage valueUsage /* = ValueUsage::WantValue */)
    9270             : {
    9271           1 :     bool callop = pn->isKind(PNK_CALL) || pn->isKind(PNK_TAGGED_TEMPLATE);
    9272             :     /*
    9273             :      * Emit callable invocation or operator new (constructor call) code.
    9274             :      * First, emit code for the left operand to evaluate the callable or
    9275             :      * constructable object expression.
    9276             :      *
    9277             :      * For operator new, we emit JSOP_GETPROP instead of JSOP_CALLPROP, etc.
    9278             :      * This is necessary to interpose the lambda-initialized method read
    9279             :      * barrier -- see the code in jsinterp.cpp for JSOP_LAMBDA followed by
    9280             :      * JSOP_{SET,INIT}PROP.
    9281             :      *
    9282             :      * Then (or in a call case that has no explicit reference-base
    9283             :      * object) we emit JSOP_UNDEFINED to produce the undefined |this|
    9284             :      * value required for calls (which non-strict mode functions
    9285             :      * will box into the global object).
    9286             :      */
    9287           1 :     uint32_t argc = pn->pn_count - 1;
    9288             : 
    9289           1 :     if (argc >= ARGC_LIMIT) {
    9290             :         parser->tokenStream.reportError(callop
    9291             :                                         ? JSMSG_TOO_MANY_FUN_ARGS
    9292           0 :                                         : JSMSG_TOO_MANY_CON_ARGS);
    9293           0 :         return false;
    9294             :     }
    9295             : 
    9296           1 :     ParseNode* pn2 = pn->pn_head;
    9297           1 :     bool spread = JOF_OPTYPE(pn->getOp()) == JOF_BYTE;
    9298           1 :     switch (pn2->getKind()) {
    9299             :       case PNK_NAME:
    9300           1 :         if (emitterMode == BytecodeEmitter::SelfHosting && !spread) {
    9301             :             // Calls to "forceInterpreter", "callFunction",
    9302             :             // "callContentFunction", or "resumeGenerator" in self-hosted
    9303             :             // code generate inline bytecode.
    9304           1 :             if (pn2->name() == cx->names().callFunction ||
    9305           1 :                 pn2->name() == cx->names().callContentFunction ||
    9306           1 :                 pn2->name() == cx->names().constructContentFunction)
    9307             :             {
    9308           1 :                 return emitSelfHostedCallFunction(pn);
    9309             :             }
    9310           1 :             if (pn2->name() == cx->names().resumeGenerator)
    9311           1 :                 return emitSelfHostedResumeGenerator(pn);
    9312           1 :             if (pn2->name() == cx->names().forceInterpreter)
    9313           1 :                 return emitSelfHostedForceInterpreter(pn);
    9314           1 :             if (pn2->name() == cx->names().allowContentIter)
    9315           1 :                 return emitSelfHostedAllowContentIter(pn);
    9316           1 :             if (pn2->name() == cx->names().defineDataPropertyIntrinsic && pn->pn_count == 4)
    9317           1 :                 return emitSelfHostedDefineDataProperty(pn);
    9318           1 :             if (pn2->name() == cx->names().hasOwn)
    9319           1 :                 return emitSelfHostedHasOwn(pn);
    9320             :             // Fall through.
    9321             :         }
    9322           1 :         if (!emitGetName(pn2, callop))
    9323             :             return false;
    9324             :         break;

    9326             :         MOZ_ASSERT(emitterMode != BytecodeEmitter::SelfHosting);

    9328           1 :             if (!emitSuperPropOp(pn2, JSOP_GETPROP_SUPER, /* isCall = */ callop))
    9329             :                 return false;
    9330             :         } else {
    9331           1 :             if (!emitPropOp(pn2, callop ? JSOP_CALLPROP : JSOP_GETPROP))
    9332             :                 return false;
    9333             :         }
    9334             : 
    9335             :         break;
    9336             :       case PNK_ELEM:
    9337             :         MOZ_ASSERT(emitterMode != BytecodeEmitter::SelfHosting);
    9338           1 :         if (pn2->as<PropertyByValue>().isSuper()) {
    9339           0 :             if (!emitSuperElemOp(pn2, JSOP_GETELEM_SUPER, /* isCall = */ callop))
    9340             :                 return false;
    9341             :         } else {
    9342           1 :             if (!emitElemOp(pn2, callop ? JSOP_CALLELEM : JSOP_GETELEM))
    9343             :                 return false;
    9344           1 :             if (callop) {
    9345           1 :                 if (!emit1(JSOP_SWAP))
    9346             :                     return false;
    9347             :             }
    9348             :         }
    9349             : 
    9350             :         break;
    9351             :       case PNK_FUNCTION:
    9352             :         /*
    9353             :          * Top level lambdas which are immediately invoked should be
    9354             :          * treated as only running once. Every time they execute we will
    9355             :          * create new types and scripts for their contents, to increase
    9356             :          * the quality of type information within them and enable more
    9357             :          * backend optimizations. Note that this does not depend on the
    9358             :          * lambda being invoked at most once (it may be named or be
    9359             :          * accessed via foo.caller indirection), as multiple executions
    9360             :          * will just cause the inner scripts to be repeatedly cloned.
    9361             :          */
    9362             :         MOZ_ASSERT(!emittingRunOnceLambda);
    9363           1 :         if (checkRunOnceContext()) {
    9364           1 :             emittingRunOnceLambda = true;
    9365           1 :             if (!emitTree(pn2))
    9366             :                 return false;
    9367           1 :             emittingRunOnceLambda = false;
    9368             :         } else {
    9369           1 :             if (!emitTree(pn2))
    9370             :                 return false;
    9371             :         }
    9372             :         callop = false;
    9373             :         break;
    9374             :       case PNK_SUPERBASE:
    9375             :         MOZ_ASSERT(pn->isKind(PNK_SUPERCALL));
    9376             :         MOZ_ASSERT(parser->handler.isSuperBase(pn2));
    9377           1 :         if (!emit1(JSOP_SUPERFUN))
    9378             :             return false;
    9379             :         break;

    9381           1 :         if (!emitTree(pn2))

    9387           1 :     bool isNewOp = pn->getOp() == JSOP_NEW || pn->getOp() == JSOP_SPREADNEW ||

    9398             :                 return false;
    9399             :         }

    9401             : 
    9402             :     /*

    9404             :      * JSOP_NEW bytecode with a two-byte immediate telling how many args
    9405             :      * were pushed on the operand stack.
    9406             :      */

    9409           1 :             if (!emitTree(pn3))

    9419           1 :                 if (!emitDupAt(argc + 1))

    9421             :             }

    9437             :                 return false;

    9439             : 
    9440           1 :         if (isNewOp) {
    9441           1 :             if (pn->isKind(PNK_SUPERCALL)) {
    9442           1 :                 if (!emit1(JSOP_NEWTARGET))
    9443             :                     return false;
    9444             :             } else {
    9445           1 :                 if (!emitDupAt(2))

    9449             :     }
    9450             :

    9518           1 : BytecodeEmitter::emitLogical(ParseNode* pn)
    9519             : {
    9520             :     MOZ_ASSERT(pn->isArity(PN_LIST));
    9521             : 
    9522             :     /*
    9523             :      * JSOP_OR converts the operand on the stack to boolean, leaves the original
    9524             :      * value on the stack and jumps if true; otherwise it falls into the next
    9525             :      * bytecode, which pops the left operand and then evaluates the right operand.
    9526             :      * The jump goes around the right operand evaluation.
    9527             :      *
    9528             :      * JSOP_AND converts the operand on the stack to boolean and jumps if false;
    9529             :      * otherwise it falls into the right operand's bytecode.
    9530             :      */
    9531             : 
    9532             :     TDZCheckCache tdzCache(this);
    9533             : 
    9534             :     /* Left-associative operator chain: avoid too much recursion. */
    9535           1 :     ParseNode* pn2 = pn->pn_head;
    9536           1 :     if (!emitTree(pn2))
    9537             :         return false;
    9538           1 :     JSOp op = pn->getOp();
    9539             :     JumpList jump;
    9540           1 :     if (!emitJump(op, &jump))
    9541             :         return false;
    9542           1 :     if (!emit1(JSOP_POP))
    9543             :         return false;
    9544             : 
    9545             :     /* Emit nodes between the head and the tail. */
    9546           1 :     while ((pn2 = pn2->pn_next)->pn_next) {
    9547           1 :         if (!emitTree(pn2))
    9548             :             return false;
    9549           1 :         if (!emitJump(op, &jump))
    9550             :             return false;
    9551           1 :         if (!emit1(JSOP_POP))
    9552             :             return false;
    9553             :     }

    9555             :         return false;
    9556             : 
    9557           1 :     if (!emitJumpTargetAndPatch(jump))
    9558             :         return false;
    9559           1 :     return true;

    9683           1 :             if (!emit1(JSOP_POP))
    9684             :                 return false;

    9734           1 :             propdef->pn_right->pn_funbox->needsHomeObject())
    9735             :         {
    9736             :             MOZ_ASSERT(propdef->pn_right->pn_funbox->function()->allowSuperProperty());
    9737           1 :             bool isAsync = propdef->pn_right->pn_funbox->isAsync();

    9739           1 :                 if (!emit1(JSOP_SWAP))
    9740             :                     return false;
    9741             :             }

    9743             :                 return false;
    9744           1 :             if (isAsync) {
    9745           1 :                 if (!emit1(JSOP_POP))
    9746             :                     return false;
    9747             :             }
    9748             :         }
    9749             : 
    9750             :         // Class methods are not enumerable.
    9751           1 :         if (type == ClassBody) {
    9752           1 :             switch (op) {

    9758             :         }
    9759             :

    9763             :               case JSOP_INITPROP:               op = JSOP_INITELEM;              break;

    9818             : // Using MOZ_NEVER_INLINE in here is a workaround for llvm.org/pr14047. See

    9820             : MOZ_NEVER_INLINE bool
    9821           1 : BytecodeEmitter::emitObject(ParseNode* pn)
    9822             : {
    9823           1 :     if (!(pn->pn_xflags & PNX_NONCONST) && pn->pn_head && checkSingletonContext())
    9824           1 :         return emitSingletonInitialiser(pn);
    9825             : 
    9826             :     /*
    9827             :      * Emit code for {p:a, '%q':b, 2:c} that is equivalent to constructing
    9828             :      * a new object and defining (in source order) each property on the object
    9829             :      * (or mutating the object's [[Prototype]], in the case of __proto__).
    9830             :      */
    9831           1 :     ptrdiff_t offset = this->offset();
    9832           1 :     if (!emitNewInit(JSProto_Object))
    9833             :         return false;
    9834             : 
    9835             :     /*
    9836             :      * Try to construct the shape of the object as we go, so we can emit a
    9837             :      * JSOP_NEWOBJECT with the final shape instead.
    9838             :      */

    9840             :     // No need to do any guessing for the object kind, since we know exactly
    9841             :     // how many properties we plan to have.
    9842           1 :     gc::AllocKind kind = gc::GetGCObjectKind(pn->pn_count);

    9844           1 :     if (!obj)
    9845             :         return false;

    9847           1 :     if (!emitPropertyList(pn, &obj, ObjectLiteral))
    9848             :         return false;

    9850           1 :     if (obj) {
    9851             :         /*
    9852             :          * The object survived and has a predictable shape: update the original
    9853             :          * bytecode.
    9854             :          */

    9856           1 :         if (!objbox)
    9857             :             return false;
    9858             : 
    9859             :         static_assert(JSOP_NEWINIT_LENGTH == JSOP_NEWOBJECT_LENGTH,
    9860             :                       "newinit and newobject must have equal length to edit in-place");
    9861             : 
    9862           1 :         uint32_t index = objectList.add(objbox);
    9863           1 :         jsbytecode* code = this->code(offset);
    9864           1 :         code[0] = JSOP_NEWOBJECT;
    9865           1 :         code[1] = jsbytecode(index >> 24);
    9866           1 :         code[2] = jsbytecode(index >> 16);
    9867           1 :         code[3] = jsbytecode(index >> 8);
    9868           1 :         code[4] = jsbytecode(index);
    9869             :     }
    9870             : 
    9871             :     return true;
    9872             : }

    9875           1 : BytecodeEmitter::emitArrayComp(ParseNode* pn)

    9895             : bool
    9896           1 : BytecodeEmitter::emitArrayLiteral(ParseNode* pn)
    9897             : {
    9898           1 :     if (!(pn->pn_xflags & PNX_NONCONST) && pn->pn_head) {
    9899           1 :         if (checkSingletonContext()) {
    9900             :             // Bake in the object entirely if it will only be created once.
    9901           1 :             return emitSingletonInitialiser(pn);
    9902             :         }
    9903             : 
    9904             :         // If the array consists entirely of primitive values, make a
    9905             :         // template object with copy on write elements that can be reused
    9906             :         // every time the initializer executes.
    9907           1 :         if (emitterMode != BytecodeEmitter::SelfHosting && pn->pn_count != 0) {
    9908           1 :             RootedValue value(cx);
    9909           1 :             if (!pn->getConstantValue(cx, ParseNode::ForCopyOnWriteArray, &value))
    9910             :                 return false;
    9911           1 :             if (!value.isMagic(JS_GENERIC_MAGIC)) {
    9912             :                 // Note: the group of the template object might not yet reflect
    9913             :                 // that the object has copy on write elements. When the
    9914             :                 // interpreter or JIT compiler fetches the template, it should
    9915             :                 // use ObjectGroup::getOrFixupCopyOnWriteObject to make sure the
    9916             :                 // group for the template is accurate. We don't do this here as we
    9917             :                 // want to use ObjectGroup::allocationSiteGroup, which requires a
    9918             :                 // finished script.

    9921             :                            obj->as<ArrayObject>().denseElementsAreCopyOnWrite());

    9924           1 :                 if (!objbox)
    9925             :                     return false;
    9926             :
