    9934             : 
    9935             : bool
    9936           1 : BytecodeEmitter::emitArray(ParseNode* pn, uint32_t count, JSOp op)
    9937             : {
    9938             : 
    9939             :     /*
    9940             :      * Emit code for [a, b, c] that is equivalent to constructing a new
    9941             :      * array and in source order evaluating each element value and adding
    9942             :      * it to the array, without invoking latent setters.  We use the
    9943             :      * JSOP_NEWINIT and JSOP_INITELEM_ARRAY bytecodes to ignore setters and
    9944             :      * to avoid dup'ing and popping the array as each element is added, as
    9945             :      * JSOP_SETELEM/JSOP_SETPROP would do.
    9946             :      */
    9947             :     MOZ_ASSERT(op == JSOP_NEWARRAY || op == JSOP_SPREADCALLARRAY);
    9948             : 
    9949           1 :     uint32_t nspread = 0;
    9950           1 :     for (ParseNode* elt = pn; elt; elt = elt->pn_next) {
    9951           1 :         if (elt->isKind(PNK_SPREAD))
    9952           1 :             nspread++;
    9953             :     }
    9954             : 
    9955             :     // Array literal's length is limited to NELEMENTS_LIMIT in parser.
    9956             :     static_assert(NativeObject::MAX_DENSE_ELEMENTS_COUNT <= INT32_MAX,
    9957             :                   "array literals' maximum length must not exceed limits "
    9958             :                   "required by BaselineCompiler::emit_JSOP_NEWARRAY, "
    9959             :                   "BaselineCompiler::emit_JSOP_INITELEM_ARRAY, "
    9960             :                   "and DoSetElemFallback's handling of JSOP_INITELEM_ARRAY");
    9961             :     MOZ_ASSERT(count >= nspread);
    9962             :     MOZ_ASSERT(count <= NativeObject::MAX_DENSE_ELEMENTS_COUNT,
    9963             :                "the parser must throw an error if the array exceeds maximum "
    9964             :                "length");
    9965             : 
    9966             :     // For arrays with spread, this is a very pessimistic allocation, the
    9967             :     // minimum possible final size.
    9968           1 :     if (!emitUint32Operand(op, count - nspread))                    // ARRAY
    9969             :         return false;
    9970             : 
    9971             :     ParseNode* pn2 = pn;
    9972             :     uint32_t index;
    9973             :     bool afterSpread = false;
    9974           1 :     for (index = 0; pn2; index++, pn2 = pn2->pn_next) {
    9975           1 :         if (!afterSpread && pn2->isKind(PNK_SPREAD)) {
    9976           1 :             afterSpread = true;
    9977           1 :             if (!emitNumberOp(index))                               // ARRAY INDEX
    9978             :                 return false;
    9979             :         }
    9980           1 :         if (!updateSourceCoordNotes(pn2->pn_pos.begin))
    9981             :             return false;
    9982             : 
    9983           1 :         bool allowSelfHostedIter = false;
    9984           1 :         if (pn2->isKind(PNK_ELISION)) {
    9985           1 :             if (!emit1(JSOP_HOLE))
    9986             :                 return false;
    9987             :         } else {
    9988             :             ParseNode* expr;
    9989           1 :             if (pn2->isKind(PNK_SPREAD)) {
    9990           1 :                 expr = pn2->pn_kid;
    9991             : 
    9992           1 :                 if (emitterMode == BytecodeEmitter::SelfHosting &&
    9993           1 :                     expr->isKind(PNK_CALL) &&
    9994           1 :                     expr->pn_head->name() == cx->names().allowContentIter)
    9995             :                 {
    9996           1 :                     allowSelfHostedIter = true;
    9997             :                 }
    9998             :             } else {
    9999             :                 expr = pn2;
   10000             :             }
   10001           1 :             if (!emitTree(expr))                                         // ARRAY INDEX? VALUE
   10002             :                 return false;
   10003             :         }
   10004           1 :         if (pn2->isKind(PNK_SPREAD)) {
   10005           1 :             if (!emitIterator())                                         // ARRAY INDEX ITER
   10006             :                 return false;
   10007           1 :             if (!emit2(JSOP_PICK, 2))                                    // INDEX ITER ARRAY
   10008             :                 return false;
   10009           1 :             if (!emit2(JSOP_PICK, 2))                                    // ITER ARRAY INDEX
   10010             :                 return false;
   10011           1 :             if (!emitSpread(allowSelfHostedIter))                        // ARRAY INDEX
   10012             :                 return false;
   10013           1 :         } else if (afterSpread) {
   10014           1 :             if (!emit1(JSOP_INITELEM_INC))
   10015             :                 return false;
   10016             :         } else {
   10017           1 :             if (!emitUint32Operand(JSOP_INITELEM_ARRAY, index))
   10018             :                 return false;
   10019             :         }
   10020             :     }
   10021             :     MOZ_ASSERT(index == count);
   10022           1 :     if (afterSpread) {
   10023           1 :         if (!emit1(JSOP_POP))                                            // ARRAY
   10024             :             return false;
   10025             :     }
   10026             :     return true;
   10027             : }

   10059             : bool
   10060           1 : BytecodeEmitter::emitFunctionFormalParametersAndBody(ParseNode *pn)
   10061             : {
   10062             :     MOZ_ASSERT(pn->isKind(PNK_PARAMSBODY));
   10063             : 
   10064           1 :     ParseNode* funBody = pn->last();
   10065           1 :     FunctionBox* funbox = sc->asFunctionBox();
   10066             : 
   10067             :     TDZCheckCache tdzCache(this);
   10068             : 
   10069           1 :     if (funbox->hasParameterExprs) {
   10070             :         EmitterScope funEmitterScope(this);
   10071           1 :         if (!funEmitterScope.enterFunction(this, funbox))
   10072             :             return false;
   10073             : 
   10074           1 :         if (!emitInitializeFunctionSpecialNames())
   10075             :             return false;
   10076             : 
   10077           1 :         if (!emitFunctionFormalParameters(pn))
   10078             :             return false;
   10079             : 
   10080             :         {
   10081             :             Maybe<EmitterScope> extraVarEmitterScope;
   10082             : 
   10083           1 :             if (funbox->hasExtraBodyVarScope()) {
   10084           1 :                 extraVarEmitterScope.emplace(this);
   10085           1 :                 if (!extraVarEmitterScope->enterFunctionExtraBodyVar(this, funbox))
   10086           0 :                     return false;
   10087             : 
   10088             :                 // After emitting expressions for all parameters, copy over any
   10089             :                 // formal parameters which have been redeclared as vars. For
   10090             :                 // example, in the following, the var y in the body scope is 42:
   10091             :                 //
   10092             :                 //   function f(x, y = 42) { var y; }
   10093             :                 //

   10096           1 :                     for (BindingIter bi(*funbox->functionScopeBindings(), true); bi; bi++) {
   10097           1 :                         name = bi.name();
   10098             : 
   10099             :                         // There may not be a var binding of the same name.
   10100           1 :                         if (!locationOfNameBoundInScope(name, extraVarEmitterScope.ptr()))
   10101           1 :                             continue;
   10102             : 
   10103             :                         // The '.this' and '.generator' function special
   10104             :                         // bindings should never appear in the extra var
   10105             :                         // scope. 'arguments', however, may.
   10106             :                         MOZ_ASSERT(name != cx->names().dotThis &&
   10107             :                                    name != cx->names().dotGenerator);
   10108             : 
   10109           0 :                         NameLocation paramLoc = *locationOfNameBoundInScope(name, &funEmitterScope);
   10110             :                         auto emitRhs = [&name, &paramLoc](BytecodeEmitter* bce,
   10111             :                                                           const NameLocation&, bool)
   10112             :                         {
   10113           0 :                             return bce->emitGetNameAtLocation(name, paramLoc);
   10114           0 :                         };
   10115             : 
   10116           0 :                         if (!emitInitializeName(name, emitRhs))
   10117           0 :                             return false;
   10118           0 :                         if (!emit1(JSOP_POP))
   10119             :                             return false;
   10120             :                     }
   10121             :                 }
   10122             :             }
   10123             : 
   10124           1 :             if (!emitFunctionBody(funBody))
   10125             :                 return false;
   10126             : 
   10127           1 :             if (extraVarEmitterScope && !extraVarEmitterScope->leave(this))
   10128             :                 return false;
   10129             :         }
   10130             : 
   10131           1 :         return funEmitterScope.leave(this);
   10132             :     }
   10133             : 
   10134             :     // No parameter expressions. Enter the function body scope and emit
   10135             :     // everything.
   10136             :     //
   10137             :     // One caveat is that Debugger considers ops in the prologue to be
   10138             :     // unreachable (i.e. cannot set a breakpoint on it). If there are no
   10139             :     // parameter exprs, any unobservable environment ops (like pushing the
   10140             :     // call object, setting '.this', etc) need to go in the prologue, else it
   10141             :     // messes up breakpoint tests.
   10142           1 :     EmitterScope emitterScope(this);
   10143             : 
   10144             :     switchToPrologue();
   10145           1 :     if (!emitterScope.enterFunction(this, funbox))
   10146             :         return false;
   10147             : 
   10148           1 :     if (!emitInitializeFunctionSpecialNames())
   10149             :         return false;
   10150             :     switchToMain();
   10151             : 
   10152           1 :     if (!emitFunctionFormalParameters(pn))
   10153             :         return false;
   10154             : 
   10155           1 :     if (!emitFunctionBody(funBody))
   10156             :         return false;
   10157             : 
   10158           1 :     return emitterScope.leave(this);
   10159             : }
   10160             : 
   10161             : bool
   10162           1 : BytecodeEmitter::emitFunctionFormalParameters(ParseNode* pn)
   10163             : {
   10164           1 :     ParseNode* funBody = pn->last();
   10165           1 :     FunctionBox* funbox = sc->asFunctionBox();
   10166           1 :     EmitterScope* funScope = innermostEmitterScope;
   10167             : 
   10168           1 :     bool hasParameterExprs = funbox->hasParameterExprs;
   10169           1 :     bool hasRest = funbox->hasRest();
   10170             : 
   10171           1 :     uint16_t argSlot = 0;
   10172           1 :     for (ParseNode* arg = pn->pn_head; arg != funBody; arg = arg->pn_next, argSlot++) {
   10173           1 :         ParseNode* bindingElement = arg;
   10174           1 :         ParseNode* initializer = nullptr;
   10175           1 :         if (arg->isKind(PNK_ASSIGN)) {
   10176           1 :             bindingElement = arg->pn_left;
   10177           1 :             initializer = arg->pn_right;
   10178             :         }
   10179             : 
   10180             :         // Left-hand sides are either simple names or destructuring patterns.
   10181             :         MOZ_ASSERT(bindingElement->isKind(PNK_NAME) ||
   10182             :                    bindingElement->isKind(PNK_ARRAY) ||
   10183             :                    bindingElement->isKind(PNK_ARRAYCOMP) ||
   10184             :                    bindingElement->isKind(PNK_OBJECT));
   10185             : 
   10186             :         // The rest parameter doesn't have an initializer.
   10187           1 :         bool isRest = hasRest && arg->pn_next == funBody;
   10188             :         MOZ_ASSERT_IF(isRest, !initializer);
   10189             : 
   10190           1 :         bool isDestructuring = !bindingElement->isKind(PNK_NAME);
   10191             : 
   10192             :         // ES 14.1.19 says if BindingElement contains an expression in the
   10193             :         // production FormalParameter : BindingElement, it is evaluated in a
   10194             :         // new var environment. This is needed to prevent vars from escaping
   10195             :         // direct eval in parameter expressions.
   10196             :         Maybe<EmitterScope> paramExprVarScope;
   10197           1 :         if (funbox->hasDirectEvalInParameterExpr && (isDestructuring || initializer)) {
   10198           0 :             paramExprVarScope.emplace(this);
   10199           0 :             if (!paramExprVarScope->enterParameterExpressionVar(this))
   10200             :                 return false;
   10201             :         }
   10202             : 
   10203             :         // First push the RHS if there is a default expression or if it is
   10204             :         // rest.
   10205             : 
   10206           1 :         if (initializer) {
   10207             :             // If we have an initializer, emit the initializer and assign it
   10208             :             // to the argument slot. TDZ is taken care of afterwards.
   10209             :             MOZ_ASSERT(hasParameterExprs);
   10210           1 :             if (!emitArgOp(JSOP_GETARG, argSlot))
   10211           0 :                 return false;
   10212           1 :             if (!emit1(JSOP_DUP))
   10213             :                 return false;
   10214           1 :             if (!emit1(JSOP_UNDEFINED))
   10215             :                 return false;
   10216           1 :             if (!emit1(JSOP_STRICTEQ))
   10217             :                 return false;
   10218             :             // Emit source note to enable Ion compilation.
   10219           1 :             if (!newSrcNote(SRC_IF))
   10220             :                 return false;
   10221             :             JumpList jump;
   10222           1 :             if (!emitJump(JSOP_IFEQ, &jump))
   10223             :                 return false;
   10224           1 :             if (!emit1(JSOP_POP))
   10225             :                 return false;
   10226           1 :             if (!emitInitializerInBranch(initializer, bindingElement))
   10227             :                 return false;

   10229             :                 return false;

   10231           1 :             if (!emit1(JSOP_REST))
   10232             :                 return false;
   10233             :             checkTypeSet(JSOP_REST);
   10234             :         }
   10235             : 
   10236             :         // Initialize the parameter name.
   10237             :

   10240             :             // already on the stack.
   10241           1 :             if (!initializer && !isRest && !emitArgOp(JSOP_GETARG, argSlot))
   10242             :                 return false;

   10396             : {

   10406             : 
   10407             : // This follows ES6 14.5.14 (ClassDefinitionEvaluation) and ES6 14.5.15
   10408             : // (BindingClassDeclarationEvaluation).
   10409             : bool
   10410           1 : BytecodeEmitter::emitClass(ParseNode* pn)
   10411             : {
   10412           1 :     ClassNode& classNode = pn->as<ClassNode>();

   10424           1 :             (methodName.isKind(PNK_OBJECT_PROPERTY_NAME) || methodName.isKind(PNK_STRING)) &&

   10426             :         {
   10427           1 :             constructor = &method.method();
   10428           1 :             break;
   10429             :         }
   10430             :     }
   10431             : 
   10432           1 :     bool savedStrictness = sc->setLocalStrictMode(true);

   10441             :     }
   10442             : 
   10443             :     // This is kind of silly. In order to the get the home object defined on
   10444             :     // the constructor, we have to make it second, but we want the prototype
   10445             :     // on top for EmitPropertyList, because we expect static properties to be
   10446             :     // rarer. The result is a few more swaps than we would like. Such is life.

   10448           1 :         if (!emitTree(heritageExpression))
   10449             :             return false;

   10534           1 : BytecodeEmitter::emitTree(ParseNode* pn, ValueUsage valueUsage /* = ValueUsage::WantValue */,

   10987           1 : BytecodeEmitter::newSrcNote(SrcNoteType type, unsigned* indexp)

   11002           1 :         do {
   11003           1 :             ptrdiff_t xdelta = Min(delta, SN_XDELTA_MASK);

   11056             : bool
   11057           1 : BytecodeEmitter::addToSrcNoteDelta(jssrcnote* sn, ptrdiff_t delta)

   11059             :     /*
   11060             :      * Called only from finishTakingSrcNotes to add to main script note

   11070           1 :         SN_SET_DELTA(sn, newdelta);

   11125             : bool
   11126           1 : BytecodeEmitter::finishTakingSrcNotes(uint32_t* out)
   11127             : {
   11128             :     MOZ_ASSERT(current == &main);
   11129             : 
   11130           1 :     unsigned prologueCount = prologue.notes.length();

   11132             :         switchToPrologue();

   11137             :         /*
   11138             :          * Either no prologue srcnotes, or no line number change over prologue.
   11139             :          * We don't need a SRC_SETLINE, but we may need to adjust the offset
   11140             :          * of the first main note, by adding to its delta and possibly even
   11141             :          * prepending SRC_XDELTA notes to it to account for prologue bytecodes
   11142             :          * that came at and after the last annotated bytecode.

   11326             :     MOZ_ASSERT(length() == array.length());
   11327             : 
   11328           1 :     for (unsigned i = 0; i < length(); i++)
   11329           1 :         array[i] = prologueLength + list[i];
   11330           1 : }
   11331             : 
   11332             : /*
   11333             :  * We should try to get rid of offsetBias (always 0 or 1, where 1 is
   11334             :  * JSOP_{NOP,POP}_LENGTH), which is used only by SRC_FOR.
   11335             :  */
   11336             : const JSSrcNoteSpec js_SrcNoteSpec[] = {
   11337             : #define DEFINE_SRC_NOTE_SPEC(sym, name, arity) { name, arity },
   11338             :     FOR_EACH_SRC_NOTE_TYPE(DEFINE_SRC_NOTE_SPEC)
   11339             : #undef DEFINE_SRC_NOTE_SPEC
   11340             : };
   11341             : 
   11342             : static int
   11343             : SrcNoteArity(jssrcnote* sn)
   11344             : {
   11345             :     MOZ_ASSERT(SN_TYPE(sn) < SRC_LAST);
   11346           1 :     return js_SrcNoteSpec[SN_TYPE(sn)].arity;
   11347             : }
   11348             : 
   11349             : JS_FRIEND_API(unsigned)
   11350           1 : js::SrcNoteLength(jssrcnote* sn)
   11351             : {
   11352             :     unsigned arity;
   11353             :     jssrcnote* base;
   11354             : 
   11355           1 :     arity = SrcNoteArity(sn);
   11356           1 :     for (base = sn++; arity; sn++, arity--) {
   11357           1 :         if (*sn & SN_4BYTE_OFFSET_FLAG)
   11358           1 :             sn += 3;
   11359             :     }
   11360           1 :     return sn - base;
   11361             : }
   11362             : 
   11363             : JS_FRIEND_API(ptrdiff_t)
   11364           1 : js::GetSrcNoteOffset(jssrcnote* sn, unsigned which)
   11365             : {
   11366             :     /* Find the offset numbered which (i.e., skip exactly which offsets). */
   11367             :     MOZ_ASSERT(SN_TYPE(sn) != SRC_XDELTA);
   11368             :     MOZ_ASSERT((int) which < SrcNoteArity(sn));
   11369           1 :     for (sn++; which; sn++, which--) {
   11370           1 :         if (*sn & SN_4BYTE_OFFSET_FLAG)
   11371           1 :             sn += 3;
   11372             :     }
   11373           1 :     if (*sn & SN_4BYTE_OFFSET_FLAG) {
   11374           1 :         return (ptrdiff_t)(((uint32_t)(sn[0] & SN_4BYTE_OFFSET_MASK) << 24)
   11375           1 :                            | (sn[1] << 16)
   11376           1 :                            | (sn[2] << 8)
   11377           1 :                            | sn[3]);
   11378             :     }
   11379           1 :     return (ptrdiff_t)*sn;
